story:
The Millay Colony's 4 for 40 Campaign!

In celebration of The Millay Colony for the Arts’ 40th Anniversary, we invite you to invest in the future of art-making in our country! Your contribution will directly support one-month, all expenses paid residencies for 4 deserving artists in 2014.

Each of these resident-artists at The Millay Colony will receive a lovely private bedroom and spacious private studio for the duration of their residency free-of-charge. An excellent local chef prepares meals. 

Help us bring FOUR artists who might not otherwise be able to spend time with us to The Millay Colony in 2014! And thereby help us to help them create amazing art works that might not otherwise come into being!!

 

Who We Are 

The Millay Colony for the Arts’ artists residency program and arts center is located in Austerlitz, NY on a seven-acre campus bordered by the poet Edna St. Vincent Millay's former house and gardens and the beautiful Harvey Mountain State Forest.  In our forty-year history, we have hosted more than 2,500 composers, visual artists and writers from all cultures and communities. 

Today’s Millay Colony offers residencies of one month and two weeks as well as Virtual Residencies to 64 artists between April and November each year. Residencies are provided FREE to select artists each year following a juried selection process. In addition, we offer a series of related activities including: Workshop Retreats in writing and art on our gorgeous campus; Weekend Workshops on a range of subjects in NYC; and free Master Classes in writing and art at local schools.

Your Participation is ESSENTIAL And We Have So Many Beautiful Ways to Reward You

Without your help we won't be able to offer residencies to these FOUR artists, offering them the time and space to make and refine their art.  In our fast-paced and tech-heavy world, time is a tremendously vital part of the artistic process—the time to work that culminates in published or recorded or exhibited work.  At Millay, we make time a priority.  And that means that there will be more poems, plays, novels, films, operas, songs, paintings, sculptures, etchings etc. that can come into the world with YOUR help.  

4 ARTISTS + ONE MONTH EACH OF TIME, STUDIO AND LIVING SPACE, NOURISHMENT, COLLABORATION = MANY NEW ARTISTIC WORKS BROUGHT INTO THIS WORLD IN 2014

In return, we extend our gratitude with a wide range of benefits, so please choose one that appeals to you and your budget and don’t forget to ask a friend to do the same...


And Follow Us, Our Events, Our Artists...

www.millaycolony.org           

Facebook: Millay Colony for the Arts

Twitter: MillayCol                  

Blog: MillayColony@blogspot

 

Snail Mail: 454 East Hill Road Austerlitz, NY  12017

Phone: (518) 392-4144


Board of Directors

Katy Lederer, Vice President

Ira Sher, Web Designer

story:
Introducing The Latest Anti-Cellulite, 'thigh-tech' Design ...



You’ve tried creams and procedures, yo-yo diets and fad exercises to work on your backside, buttocks or bottom ... or as we like to call it, your 'B-Half.

BUTT

have you settled for just hiding your hyde? 


Cellulite affects over 90% percent of women and 10% of men in the US alone.  It's genetic. 

You're invited - try our SweetCheeks on yours. 

Who We Are and What We're About:

At SweetCheeks Products, Inc., we are committed to developing anti-cellulite products that are effective and complement your daily routine.  If a product requires you to take time out of your day, or spend money again and again, it wasn't invented here.  And if it doesn't help your back shelf, you won't find it on our front shelf!

We've launched our Company in Austin, TX, the Silicon Hills of Technology.  We are changing the landscape from "software" to "thigh-tech" as our contribution toward Keeping Austin Weird!

The SweetCheeks advantages:

  • Results you'll see about one hour.
  • No recurring costs ... just buy one!
  • Convenient to use; sit on this!
  • No messy creams to apply


So What is it and How Does it Work?

SweetCheeks™ is a patent-pending portable and flexible mat that: 

  • Provides temporary reduction in the appearance of cellulite 
  • Provides a temporary increase in local circulation
  • Provides temporary relief of minor muscle aches and pains
  • Provides temporary relief of minor muscle spasms

SweetCheeks achieves these results by leveraging your body weight against the textured surface of the mat - creating a therapeutic massage.  Just sit on it!  You'll feel the tingling sensation that lets you know the mat is working.  After 30 minutes, remove the mat.  Notice the impressions of the textured surface, which will begin to fade after 1 hour.

This resulting massage improves local circulation, while reducing the appearance of cellulite for hours and even into the next day. Wake up, sit again!  Nothing to plug in, no batteries.  This is thigh tech business ... just the power of your body working on your B-Half. 

Photos unretouched and our photographer willing to testify to what she saw, too!


We take what works (massage) and make the impractical, practical!   No time out of your routine and no recurring costs.  

You'll watch the impression from the textured surface fade over the next hour into results as seen above in our After photo.  Results may vary.  

Don't just take our word for it! Check out the testimonials from our happy Users:

“So exciting … great results. I really started struggling with cellulite on the backs of my legs and bottom over the past four years. I like being able to feel the pressure points and increased blood flow. I could feel the warmth in fifteen minutes and some tingling when I stood up. I look forward to continued use and improvement of the appearance of my unwanted cellulite! Thank you! " - Cyndy E., Age 37

 “I want to now put this on my stomach, the front of my legs, arms … I want it everywhere!  It was comfortable to sit on and I could see a big change.  It would make me more comfortable at the beach, even in the gym, and definitely in the bedroom!  Can you make them in leopard?  If I start using this now (age 20) … imagine how my thighs will look in a year?“ - Alice D.  

"I’ve been using SweetCheeks­­ seve­­ral times a week for about two months now and notice that my ‘Before’ photos today look better than my ‘Before’ photos of two months ago.  I can’t say enough about SweetCheeks.  PS:  I use it, too, for my neck and back when my shoulders feel tight.  I don’t go a day now without using it for some part of my ENTIRE B-Half.” - Allison G.,  Age 59

“I have been taking before and after photos with my cellphone for a month now after sitting on SweetCheeks a half hour a day.  I can see the difference.  It’s amazing!  My husband wants to write a testimonial, is that ok?  He noticed the change!” - Nancy A.

“I have tried other products like the creams, roller and suction med spa visits.  But SweetCheeks is the one that works best for me.  Because my job is sitting at a desk all day, I feel like I’m doing something for myself when I’m sitting on SweetCheeks.  It definitely helps me feel good about having to work so hard.  I like that at the end of thirty minutes, I can feel it working.  Then it reminds me to get up and walk around.  It’s a whole healthier routine for me.  I have one for my car, my office and my home.” - Ann F.  Age 40 something.

story:
ACME is an organization created to promote the best comic book artists and professionals in Arizona. ACME events promote comic book art, comic creators and fan interaction.  There is a wealth of comic talent in Arizona  and ACME takes advantage of that, boasting the best lineup in the Southwest. In 2013 we have some very special guests! Erik Larsen, creator of Savage Dragon, artist on Spider-Man and co-founder and former publisher of Image Comics. Eric Canete is an animator who has worked on the DC Universe cartoons as well as worked for Marvel, Image, Dark Horse and DC Comics on books such as Iron Man, The End League, Spider-Man and much more. Other guests include Cory Walker, Tony Parker, Brian Augustyn, Scott Godlewski, Jay Fotos, Hi-Fi Color, Ben Glendenning, Val Hochberg, Armand Villavert, Ryan Cody, Eric Esquivel, Rob Osborne, Jason Gonzalez, Jim Hanna, Jon Goff, Cassandra Poulson, Ernie Najera & John Derrick West.

With a range of writers, artists, colorists and editors that have done work for every major publisher in the country.

What's in it for you!

The funding amoount for ACME is so low becasue we already have some great corporate sponsors helping us out. What we have a need for now is incidentals for our guests to insure everyone, guests and fans have the best experience possible. All funds will go towards this year's event and any leftover funds will go towards next year's ACME event to help bring in even more guests for our fans. By contributing you will recieve some great artwork, but you'll also be part of helping to promote the arts and comic culture in the southwest. 

Why we need your help.

Arizona has several conventions and in-store appearances every year. What we like to do at ACME is to set ourselves apart and give you 20 or more local and national guests all in one place and for FREE. In order to provide this free service, we need help, so that's why we're asking you to help us, and get some wonderful artwork in the process.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't live in Arizona and want other ways to help, or simply can't afford it right now, any attention you can bring to our campaign on social meda or on blogs would be incredibly helpful.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Gregory Russell's Indiegogo campaign is about the reemergence of his Artistic career. The funds raised will contribute to the completion of his latest body of work which will allow him to re position himself and become visible within current artist communities.  A Washington, DC native Gregory attended  Maryland institute of Art were he received a BFA in drawing and a MFA  from MT Royal School of Painting. He spent 1982-84 as a Fulbright Hayes research fellow in Zimbabwe at the National Museum researching contemporary Shona Sculpture. He has exhibited his work at the Baltimore Museum, James Lewis Museum, The Alternative Museum of New York and the Corcoran Gallery of Art. 
  • Gregory was one of the founding members of " No Matter What " Salon Renaissance, a collective charged with the mission to increase the visibility of artist of color through exhibitions and educational seminars.

  • This campaign is designed for Gregory to continue his work as a visual artist, which was sidetracked for a number of years. He decided that he needed balance and that the only way to do that was by creating art again. His Art.  His last commercial project was completed in December of 2012. Committed to the creative process, Gregory has gainedmomentum and wants to continue! His gift is literally the air he breathes. It defines his life. *By contributing to his campaign, you will be helping him to cross the finish line, enable him to be visual in the artistic community once more,  and help him apply for residency exhibitions.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

  • Studio Rental  (per month, Gregory?)                                                $2,600                 
  • Materials:  Paint, Brushes, Paper, Fasteners, Saws /Carving Tools      900
  • Misc:  Photography (what is this, Gregory?) , Application fees , References (and this????) and Shipping Costs                500
  • Totals     $4,000

Now, here is where Gregory gets to give back:  He has created a new body of work that has him shifting from the mixed media wood construction work,  to mixed media collage, entitled"Flowers, Wood, Bricks and Paper."  The work isreturning to a symbol that he used before, during an earlier body of work centered around HIV and Aides. "Send Me No Flowers."

If you take a minute to look at the renderings attached,we're sure there is an original limited edition that you will want! Some of you might want the Original and help move Gregory Russell, the artist, and his commitment forward with new ways of seeing, reading and enjoying what's possible in the World.

Contributing to this project gives you the opportunity to move Gregory and his commitment forward on his purpose, to help shift the planet and help forward new ways of seeing, reading, and enjoying what's Possible in the World! 

As with all the projects that I have created or been apart of the funds set aside will be used to create. Like those set aside for NMW , Fulbright, Commercial Work with Clients. 

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help.  If his work excites you, in lieu of money you can:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you!  I can't move forward without your help!

Gregory Russell

story:
Hello, my name is Giulia, I live in Turin, Italy; and I’ve been working as a freelance artist since 1994. www.giuliacaira.com

Fortunately, last year I've received two important awards, Fabbri italian Award - http://www.fabbri1905.com/it/480/154/iv-edizione - and Vaf Foundation Award-german prize for italian artist - http://www.exibart.com/notizia.asp?IDCategoria=204&IDNotizia=38417&title=Premiopoli-2%3A-Giulia-Caira-sul-podio-del-concorso-Fondazione-VAF.-La-vittoria-annunciata-poco-fa-al-Castello-Colonna-di-Genazzano, thanks to my works using photography and video.

What interests me more is to observe and investigate people's lives, their human and social condition through news, cinema, music and literature. I'm interested in the distortions of behavior that these hard times cause in people I know; the way everyone’s public and personal life collide.To get in touch with the reality around me, to tell it, 

I rely on the thread of emotions, that always makes us all more sensitive, closer, equal to others.

Now, to carry out my new art project I NEED YOUR HELP.

The title of my next project is EVIL SISTERS. 

Will be a video-installation and a series of pictures focusing on problems related to the conflict between women. On the one hand, friendship and complicity and, on the other hand, envy, rivalry, conflict. 

The main characters of Evil Sisters will be two young actresses accompanied by fifty extras, all women. The shooting will take place inside the historical Turinese ballroom Le Roy, still open today, designed by the great Turinese architect and artist Carlo Mollino, in 1959.

The shooting will be taken in just one day, therefore all the preparatory steps will be very important. 

Each aspect must work out smoothly, as if it was an actual performance, because there will be no chance to retake. 

Therefore, a team of professionals is needed in order to guarantee a truly effective organization of the set:

2 operators

2 professional actress

50 extras

mounting video

make-up and clothes

location rent

sound artist

And this is where I need you. Even a small donation will help me realize Evil Sisters. It doesn't take much to create a work that investigates the condition, the conflict, the mystery, the inexplicable energy that ties a woman to all other women.

The first show of Evil Sisters will be in Bari at Muratcentoventidue http://www.muratcentoventidue.com/ , opening in may 2013.

Please, support me!

Thank you.

 

Italiano

Ciao, mi chiamo Giulia, vivo in Italia a Torino e lavoro come artista indipendente dal 1994. Per fortuna lo scorso anno ho vinto due importanti premi - Premio Fabbri, sezione fotografia - http://www.fabbri1905.com/it/480/154/iv-edizione - and Vaf Foundation Award http://www.exibart.com/notizia.asp?IDCategoria=204&IDNotizia=38417&title=Premiopoli-2%3A-Giulia-Caira-sul-podio-del-concorso-Fondazione-VAF.-La-vittoria-annunciata-poco-fa-al-Castello-Colonna-di-Genazzano - con i miei lavori che utilizzano la fotografia e il video.

Quello che m’interessa è osservare e indagare la vita delle persone, la loro condizione umana e sociale, attraverso la cronaca, il cinema, la musica, la letteratura. Mi interessano le distorsioni del comportamento che questi nostri tempi provocano nelle persone, il modo in cui la vita privata e la vita pubblica si scontrano.

Per entrare in contatto con la realtà che mi sta intorno, per raccontarla, mi affido al filo delle emozioni, che sempre rende tutto noi più sensibili, più vicini, uguali agli altri.

Ora, per realizzare il mio nuovo progetto artistico ho bisogno del tuo aiuto.

Il progetto si chiama Evil Sisters (Perfide Sorelle). Si tratta di una video-installazione correlata da una serie fotografica ed è incentrato sui problemi relativi ai conflitti tra donne. Da una parte l’amicizia e la complicità e dall’altra l'invidia, la rivalità.

Le protagoniste di Evil Sisters (Perfide Sorelle) saranno due giovani attrici accompagnate da una cinquantina di comparse, tutte donne. Il luogo dove gireremo è la storica sala da ballo torinese Le Roy, aperta ancora oggi, progettata dal grande architetto e artista Carlo Mollino, anche lui di Torino, nel 1959.

Le riprese si realizzeranno in un solo giorno a fine marzo quindi saranno importantissime le fasi preparatorie. Ogni aspetto del lavoro dovrà essere perfettamente funzionante, come fosse una vera e propria performance, perché non ci sarà possibilità di replica. È per questo che sarà necessario ingaggiare un gruppo di professionisti capaci di garantire un’organizzazione veramente efficace del set.

Il tuo contributo sarà determinante per aiutarmi a concretizzare Evil Sisters. Un'indagine sul conflitto, il mistero, l’energia inspiegabile che lega una donna a tutte le altre.

La prima mostra che inaugurerà la video-installazione Evil Sister si terrà a Bari, presso la galleria Muratcentoventidue http://www.muratcentoventidue.com/, a maggio 2013.

Please, support me!

Grazie.

 

 

Thanks to Silvio Bernelli for advice for text and Veronica Rossi for the translation.
story_txt:
Hello, my name is Giulia, I live in Turin, Italy; and I’ve been working as a freelance artist since 1994. www.giuliacaira.com
Fortunately, last year I've received two important awards, Fabbri italian Award - http://www.fabbri1905.com/it/480/154/iv-edizione - and Vaf Foundation Award-german prize for italian artist - http://www.exibart.com/notizia.asp?IDCategoria=204&IDNotizia=38417&title=Premiopoli-2%3A-Giulia-Caira-sul-podio-del-concorso-Fondazione-VAF.-La-vittoria-annunciata-poco-fa-al-Castello-Colonna-di-Genazzano, thanks to my works using photography and video.
What interests me more is to observe and investigate people's lives, their human and social condition through news, cinema, music and literature. I'm interested in the distortions of behavior that these hard times cause in people I know; the way everyone’s public and personal life collide.To get in touch with the reality around me, to tell it, 
I rely on the thread of emotions, that always makes us all more sensitive, closer, equal to others.
Now, to carry out my new art project I NEED YOUR HELP.
The title of my next project is EVIL SISTERS. 
Will be a video-installation and a series of pictures focusing on problems related to the conflict between women. On the one hand, friendship and complicity and, on the other hand, envy, rivalry, conflict. 
The main characters of Evil Sisters will be two young actresses accompanied by fifty extras, all women. The shooting will take place inside the historical Turinese ballroom Le Roy, still open today, designed by the great Turinese architect and artist Carlo Mollino, in 1959.
The shooting will be taken in just one day, therefore all the preparatory steps will be very important. 
Each aspect must work out smoothly, as if it was an actual performance, because there will be no chance to retake. 
Therefore, a team of professionals is needed in order to guarantee a truly effective organization of the set:
2 operators
2 professional actress
50 extras
mounting video
make-up and clothes
location rent
sound artist
And this is where I need you. Even a small donation will help me realize Evil Sisters. It doesn't take much to create a work that investigates the condition, the conflict, the mystery, the inexplicable energy that ties a woman to all other women.
The first show of Evil Sisters will be in Bari at Muratcentoventidue http://www.muratcentoventidue.com/ , opening in may 2013.
Please, support me!
Thank you.
 
Italiano
Ciao, mi chiamo Giulia, vivo in Italia a Torino e lavoro come artista indipendente dal 1994. Per fortuna lo scorso anno ho vinto due importanti premi - Premio Fabbri, sezione fotografia - http://www.fabbri1905.com/it/480/154/iv-edizione - and Vaf Foundation Award http://www.exibart.com/notizia.asp?IDCategoria=204&IDNotizia=38417&title=Premiopoli-2%3A-Giulia-Caira-sul-podio-del-concorso-Fondazione-VAF.-La-vittoria-annunciata-poco-fa-al-Castello-Colonna-di-Genazzano - con i miei lavori che utilizzano la fotografia e il video.
Quello che m’interessa è osservare e indagare la vita delle persone, la loro condizione umana e sociale, attraverso la cronaca, il cinema, la musica, la letteratura. Mi interessano le distorsioni del comportamento che questi nostri tempi provocano nelle persone, il modo in cui la vita privata e la vita pubblica si scontrano.
Per entrare in contatto con la realtà che mi sta intorno, per raccontarla, mi affido al filo delle emozioni, che sempre rende tutto noi più sensibili, più vicini, uguali agli altri.
Ora, per realizzare il mio nuovo progetto artistico ho bisogno del tuo aiuto.
Il progetto si chiama Evil Sisters (Perfide Sorelle). Si tratta di una video-installazione correlata da una serie fotografica ed è incentrato sui problemi relativi ai conflitti tra donne. Da una parte l’amicizia e la complicità e dall’altra l'invidia, la rivalità.

Il luogo dove gireremo è la storica sala da ballo torinese Le Roy, aperta ancora oggi, progettata dal grande architetto e artista Carlo Mollino, anche lui di Torino, nel 1959.
Le riprese si realizzeranno in un solo giorno a fine marzo quindi saranno importantissime le fasi preparatorie. Ogni aspetto del lavoro dovrà essere perfettamente funzionante, come fosse una vera e propria performance, perché non ci sarà possibilità di replica. È per questo che sarà necessario ingaggiare un gruppo di professionisti capaci di garantire un’organizzazione veramente efficace del set.
Il tuo contributo sarà determinante per aiutarmi a concretizzare Evil Sisters. Un'indagine sul conflitto, il mistero, l’energia inspiegabile che lega una donna a tutte le altre.
La prima mostra che inaugurerà la video-installazione Evil Sister si terrà a Bari, presso la galleria Muratcentoventidue http://www.muratcentoventidue.com/, a maggio 2013.
Please, support me!
Grazie.
 
 
Thanks to Silvio Bernelli for advice for text and Veronica Rossi for the translation.

story:
Your participation willl help foster a diverse and tolerate world by changing perceptions of who we are as a human family and how we relate to one another through the "universal language of art." By supporting this program you have the unique opportunity to  do something important… to make a difference. And you will receive great perks as a thank you and acquire precious works of art spanning the globe – a collector’s dream.

In addition to enjoying your art through the years, you will take an unprecedented journey with TIMOTCA in the realization of a vision whose time has come.

We are anxious to share this amazing story and to offer you the opportunity to participate in a program like no other.

Opening the senses to the breathtaking experience of the connecting spirit  of creativity found everywhere on earth, Art Beyond Borders is a global event working to foster peace and cultural understanding in a world of separateness, violence and strained communications.

Traveling to over 60 countries, TIMOTCA has brought together the world’s greatest artists in an effort to expose that which binds us, creating an unprecedented global exhibition.

Art Beyond Borders is meant to help uplift and enlighten, while exploring our shared humanity as expressed through the creative process found in every country on earth – the common bond uniting the human family…the essence within all of us that has the power to change he world.

To date, over 60 countries and cultures, representing a broad spectrum of political, economic and cultural diversity, have accepted TIMOTCA’s invitation to participate in TIMOTCA and Art Beyond Borders. TIMOTCA will continue to expand Art Beyond Borders until all countries are represented and its message of "art in pursuit of peace" is heard around the world.

TIMOTCA’s Art Beyond Borders exhibition of the original paintings, premiered at United Nations Headquarters in New York and UNESCO Headquarters, Paris.

 

Art Beyond Borders, a collection never before achieved in history, is  now making its way across America in colorful canvas art banner format – making it easily accessible to the largest audience possible. An interactive teacher’s guide combining projectable images with reproducible worksheets maximizes the benefits of the exhibition. The guide includes critiquing lessons, artist and country information, art activities and mapping activities, with versions for all student levels. 

  

The current Indiegogo Campaign presents the works of 42 renowned artists officially selected to represent their respective countries… countries of vast political, philosophical and social differences.  It offers an unprecedented collection of art gathered from master artists from Albania to Zimbabwe, all joined together in a singular mission – “art in pursuit of peace.”  

To see the art from each country please visit the “Artists” page at www.timotca.org

Starting in March 2013 Art Beyond Borders will be travelling in banner format to  major airports, malls, city halls, libraries and schools in: 

  • Chicago
  • Houston
  • New Orleans
  • New York City
  • Orlando
  • San Francisco
  • On its way to the United Nations.

TIMOTCA will purchase exhibition banners and stands for placement at additional venues where funds are limited, helping to bring the important message of peace and culture understanding to more and more youth and adults across America.

Expansion of the Art Beyond Borders Teacher’s Guides for distribution to more and more schools in each city.

Implementation of interactive student art programs.

Support for cultural programs in inner city schools.

Secure additional countries for representation in Art Beyond Borders.

Implementation of fundraising programs to assist in the realization of TIMOTCA goals.

 

This unique exhibition with its message of peace and cultural understanding has been presented to thousands in schools, libraries and city halls across the United States.

Aaron Kelsey, Art Teacher at Madison Consolidated High School, Indiana

"I'm getting students to think about how art is a universal language that breaks language barriers – the art in Art Beyond Borders is from all over    the world - big cultural cross-section. The diversity teaches students about the world.”

 

TIMOTCA is a non-profit 501 (c) (3) educational and charitable corporation founded in 1980.  TIMOTCA’s goal is to foster global peace and cultural understanding through the universal language of art and to build the world’s first global Peace Monument and Cultural Centre presenting the visual   and performing arts of every country, territory and island group of the world and as many cultures as possible.www.timotca.org

 

 “We have committed the last 30 years to the work of TIMOTCA in the  belief that the cause of Peace can be advanced through the Universal Language of Art.

This Generation’s unprecedented vision of the ‘whole earth’ from space, unparalleled communication technology and the realities of Earth’s fragile ecosystems have combined to create an expanded need for people everywhere to communicate with one another and to explore their inter-connectedness.  The people of the world need a gathering place for the world’s cultures, which will reflect a newly-found global consciousness.

While International art museums exist around the world, none exhibit the works of more than a few nations, and none represent all the people of the world.  TIMOTCA will strive to fill this need with the creation of  the TIMOTCA Centre, a unifying cultural and artistic achievement – a United Nations of the Arts.

The Art Beyond Borders Exhibitions and The TIMOTCA Centre will reinforce the connection we all share through the creative spirit. You can become part of a rare moment in history as you join this innovative path toward peace –  a global campaign to make the TIMOTCA vision a reality."

Vlasta Livi, TIMOTCA Director of International Research

For many years the representatives of TIMOTCA (The International Museum Of Twenty-first Century Arts) have traveled the globe meeting with Heads of State, educators, business leaders, diplomats, artists and cultural representatives, securing country participation and assembling a rare and precious collection of art, which has been organized as the Art Beyond Borders Exhibition. Ultimately, every country in the world will be represented.

 

Whether through travel or dialogue, laughter, diplomacy, music or art, any way we can experience our shared humanity  is a path to peace. The Art Beyond Borders Exhibition is a milestone along that path.

 

Albania, American Indians, Angola, Argentina, Australia, Austria, Belgium, Brazil, China, Colombia, Cuba, Czech Republic, Egypt, El Salvador, England, Ethiopia, France, French Polynesia, Germany, Greece, Haiti, Honduras, Iceland, India, Iran, Israel, Italy, Japan, Jordan, Kenya, Korea, Lebanon, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Malaysia, Mali, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mexico, Monaco, Morocco, Nicaragua, Palestine, Papua New Guinea, Peru, Portugal, Russia, San Marino, Seychelles, Slovakia, Solomon Islands, Somali, South Africa, Sudan, Syria, Thailand, Tibet, Tunisia, Vanuatu, Vatican, Venezuela, Vietnam, Zimbabwe.

Ultimately, every country in the world will be represented.


Please Note - Tee Orders will be filled if we receive orders for 25 shirts or more.  Otherwise money will be refunded.

Ultra Cotton Tee size options - Mens: Medium Large, Extra Large.  Womens: Small, Meduium, Large

story:
Short Summary

I have recently completed a Master of Design in Visual Communication from the University of Derby and have been working freelance as an illustrator for about a year. I  enjoy creating work using a more traditional method of ink, fineliner and charcoal to create atmospheric pieces that convey particualr themes.

This project: the errand... is my first picture book for children and has been created from 2 years of intensive research and creative responses. This book explores themes of fear and separation through visual storytelling. I am keen to push the boundaries of visual communication to create the contrasting sensations of fear and safety in my work through perspective and tone. The work illustrates the emotions of the characters and aids the reader in empathising and engaging with the narrative of the book.

The book follows two siblings in their first journey alone from their family home in a block of flats. They have been sent to the local store and the story illustrates their uncertainty of the outside world and their comfort of having each other during this unfamiliar journey.

This book is designed to be shared by a parent or guardian with a child in order for them to develop the childs first experiences of independence. This books is entirely visual and encourages the readers to individually intepret the theme and tone.

What I Need 

When I completed this project I hand printed and bound one copy of the errand... for display at the university degree show. This copy forms part of my creative portfolio which means that until now I haven't been able to distribute duplicate copies for people to enjoy at home.

My target of £600 will cover the high quality re-printing of of the errand... plus the printing and framing of 10 high quality art prints taken from pages of the book to use as part of an exhibition to raise awareness of the book.

If the total amount of £600 is not reached then I will lower the amount of books or prints that are produced. So every penny that you donate will still help me to fund this venture regardless of whether I reach the target or not.

Other Ways You Can Help

I have offered a range of contibution amounts and even the smallest donation is greatly appreciated. As well as generating the funds, spreading the word for my project is equally as important so please share this with your friends and family if you think they would be interested in my campaign.

Many thanks for reading,

Laura

story:
Short Summary

My name is Sandra Blair and I'm a wildlife artist.  My career goal for the past 10 years has been to have one of my paintings accepted into Birds in Art, an international competiton at the Woodson Art Museum in Wausau WI.  Birds in Art is one of the most prestigious exhibitions an avian artist could be a part of.  Out of a field of 940 entries submitted by 577 artists from all around the world, only 120 artists were invited to participate.  Imagine my excitement when I recieved the notice that I was one of them!  The image above is of my accepted painting, SUn Catcher, 14 x 18" acrylic on gessobord.
 
The Woodson Art Museum treats the participating artists in style, providing lodging, meals and transportation for the opening weekend, Sept. 6-9 2012.  All we need to do is get there!
 
Here's where your contributioons are greatly needed...let me give you a little more info to help you make your decision.  On June 28, I was hospitalized for a week with two heart attacks and two strokes.  My right arm function was severely compromised along with my left leg and my vision.  Doctors are stumped as to the causes as I have no heart disease or blocked arteries of any kind.  Tests are still ongoing including CT scans and MRIs seraching for an explanation.  Physical and Occupational Therapy have restored a good portion of my arm and leg functions...when I began therapy, I could barely pick up a fork.  Now I'm able to feed myself, write legibly and I've begun retraining myself to draw by doing daily small sketches.  Needless to say, lost wages and medical bills are taking a huge toll on us including the fact that I'm currently unable to resume my job and my husband has been on temporary leave from his job since the end of June  to help me get around and drive me to my therapy and numerous doctor appointments. In short, we're hurting for cash!
 
It will be very disappointing if I can't attend the opening weekend of Birds in Art...there's no guarantee I'll be accepted into the exhibition again in the future so this may be my only opportunity to experience this incredible opportunity and to meet some of the most respected wildlife artists in the world (including some of my heros)!

What I need!

Air fares are so expensive right now, so my husband and I plan to drive to Wisconsin from Pennsylvania, a distance of 951 miles over 15.5 hours. 

Here's how the funding would break down:

Gasoline (round trip) -- $275.00

Hotel for two nights (one night going and one night returning) -- $200

Road food -- $150

Unforseen expenses -- $75.00

As the funding is flexible, I'll receive anything you contribute, no matter how small an amount, which will help greatly toward the trip.

What you'll receive in return!

In return you'll receive some great perks depending on your contribuion, including my forever thanks, notecards with images of my paintings, a 2013 calendar of my art and an autographed catalog featuring all the art in Birds in Art 2012.

The impact

Your contributions will help me participate in a possibly once-in-a-lifetime experience, network with an incredible group of artists and meet some of the greatest wildlife artists in the world.

Other ways you can help

Please spread the word to friends and colleagues as every little contribution will help me reach my goal.  Thank you so much!

story:
In a culture where art is chronically underfunded and undervalued, talented and driven women artists are being forced to choose between their artistic passions and earning a decent wage each and every day.

This needs to stop.

That's Women's Work Arts Network (TWWAN) is committed to supporting women working in all facets of arts and culture in Toronto, and doing everything in our power to help women to earn a living wage from their art.

But we need your help.

Toronto’s vastly talented community of women artists need a space to support their work. Please join us and help to create a physically and financially accessible space for women to create, display, and acquire assistance with their art.

We can’t do it without you.

The Space

Our dream space is a two-to-three storey house in the west end of Toronto with yard space and lots of room for us to work, experiment and build community.

Under the auspices of TWWAN, this space will:

      • House a gallery with the specific mandate of showing new, emerging and established works by women artists;

      • House an affordable recording studio, operated by Chantelle Japp (http://canadaartsconnect.com/magazine/2012/09/chantelle-japp/) featuring an interactive training program and workshops;

      • House Trade School Toronto classes and workshops (http://tradeschool.coop/toronto/class)

      • Provide work space for artists and performers, including sound-proof rehearsal spaces;

      • Act as an incubator for small business;

      • Offer affordable meeting, conference, workshop and rental spaces;

      • Offer cutting edge workshops on technology and the art of business,

and much much more…

 

The Impact

Your contribution to the TWWAN space allows for accessible art and culture in Toronto, with the reassurance that the same principles you apply to your coffee (fair trade) are being applied to our city’s cultural workers;

provides an opportunity for collectors and enthusiasts to meet and develop relationships with new and emerging artists, eliminating the need for dealers and brokers;

ensures Canadian content and that our artists and performers will gain respect and security, and that women artists will find their places in the Canadian Landscape, allowing them to remain here to produce, teach, help build community and inspire.

By participating in this campaign and helping TWWAN create and provide this supportive space, you will be treating our local artists with the reverence and appreciation that occurs in other parts of the world.

 

The Need

In order to find and fund this dream space, TWWAN is seeking $8000 in support. Where will that money go?

start-up:

first and last month’s rent, insurance, utility connections, wifi, phone, etc.

any cosmetic touches to the space such as cleaning, painting and purchases to help hang or present art

studio gear and/or rentals for the recording studio

sound proofing, materials needed for working spaces for artists and our small business incubation spaces.

If we don’t hit our goal of $8000, TWWAN will continue to support Toronto’s woman artists to the best of our ability, and will not stop working until we see this vision through.

If we overachieve our goal, you can rest assured all funds will go directly to resources, equipment and materials. Instead we will work to secure a large screen television or projector, purchase the materials to create sprung floors, and start a microloans program to help women ignite small business in the city and support artists in their projects.

 

Other Ways to Help

All kinds of contributions are wonderful acts of kindness and will help.

Please take a moment to share our story by twitter, email, word of mouth or by directing folks to the website at http://thatswomensworkartsnetwork.comand to this indiegogo campaign.

We are so very grateful for each and every effort to help That’s Women's Work find a home! Thank you.

NOTE:

https://www.facebook.com/#!/groups/242553748336...for member info like jobs, workshops and community events,

Or visit

https://www.facebook.com/#!/Womens.work.michell...for our social justice page with info on issues that affect women, artists and our environment.

 

Thank you for helping us make this dream a reality.

Michelle van Looy

Founder & CEO

That’s Women’s Work Arts Network
story_txt:
In a culture where art is chronically underfunded and undervalued, talented and driven women artists are being forced to choose between their artistic passions and earning a decent wage each and every day.
This needs to stop.
That's Women's Work Arts Network (TWWAN) is committed to supporting women working in all facets of arts and culture in Toronto, and doing everything in our power to help women to earn a living wage from their art. 
But we need your help.
Toronto’s vastly talented community of women artists need a space to support their work. Please join us and help to create a physically and financially accessible space for women to create, display, and acquire assistance with their art. 
We can’t do it without you.
The Space
Our dream space is a two-to-three storey house in the west end of Toronto with yard space and lots of room for us to work, experiment and build community.
Under the auspices of TWWAN, this space will:


House a gallery with the specific mandate of showing new, emerging and established works by women artists;


House an affordable recording studio, operated by Chantelle Japp (http://canadaartsconnect.com/magazine/2012/09/chantelle-japp/) featuring an interactive training program and workshops;


House Trade School Toronto classes and workshops (http://tradeschool.coop/toronto/class)


Provide work space for artists and performers, including sound-proof rehearsal spaces;


Act as an incubator for small business;


Offer affordable meeting, conference, workshop and rental spaces;


Offer cutting edge workshops on technology and the art of business,

By participating in this campaign and helping TWWAN create and provide this supportive space, you will be treating our local artists with the reverence and appreciation that occurs in other parts of the world. 
 
The Need
In order to find and fund this dream space, TWWAN is seeking $8000 in support. Where will that money go? 
start-up:
first and last month’s rent, insurance, utility connections, wifi, phone, etc.
any cosmetic touches to the space such as cleaning, painting and purchases to help hang or present art
studio gear and/or rentals for the recording studio
sound proofing, materials needed for working spaces for artists and our small business incubation spaces. 
If we don’t hit our goal of $8000, TWWAN will continue to support Toronto’s woman artists to the best of our ability, and will not stop working until we see this vision through.
If we overachieve our goal, you can rest assured all funds will go directly to resources, equipment and materials. Instead we will work to secure a large screen television or projector, purchase the materials to create sprung floors, and start a microloans program to help women ignite small business in the city and support artists in their projects.

story:
I want to pursue a professional tattoo career the old school way as approved by tattoo industry leaders. "I want to be a tattoo artist"...
If I was 16 and said that, you’d tell me to go to college,or hang out at the local shop. But I’m 42 and and one of America's struggle stories.

My goal is to attain the funds to complete my training as a professional tattoo artist, under the supervision of an accredited and legal artist mentor. Moving from Detroit (home of Tattoo Legend Percy Waters) to Norfolk (Tattoo Legend Mr Cap Coleman's stomping ground) to California (current home to Freddy Corbin, Ed Hardy, Grimes, and many more) I've spent the past 6 years devoted to learning the history of everything I could in regards to tattoo. I began my journey after being directed by those I'd been tattoed by and followed a road which led to 3 different positions alongside other artists in their own shops while I stayed  true to my path. I have done everything I could think of, or been suggested to do by those already legal, licensed and in a shop doing what they love. Before you ask, I do NOT tattoo out of my home or kitchen ( aka - Bathroom Butchers / scratchers) . I am NOT paying for an apprenticeship - the funds are to make the move, and for blood courses and liscense fees/supplies I do no t already own. I have passed basic Bloodbourne path courses and am "certified" in safety basics regarding to blood. This to make the "last leg" if you will of my tattoo journey.

Who am I and what have I done ?


Growing up in Michigan, I gravitated to the arts, and eventually wound up attending the College For Creative Arts in Detroit Michigan, and becoming an journalist and photographer. Having worked for several papers, magazines and tons of freelance (- all while working my the family business in floorcovering - a company STILL in business I may add, even in Michigans economy!) . After following work to several states and continuing to study and learn about the body art industy I focused on states famously pertaining to the art - hence my move to Norfolk Virginia and eventually San Diego California . After moving to California, and selling about everything I own to make it this far, I began the first of what would be three positions in working Tattoo Shops. After learning basic skills from three positions at legal shops up and running , I decided to pursue an apprenticeship from the person I'd been talking to about it for over 15 years. That individual has been in the industry for over 20 years, maybe longer and recently opened his newest shop. Gracious enough to put up with my questions, he relented and offered me a proper real apprenticeship , with one caveat - I come home to MICHIGAN.

Where To Start and what happened ?
I have pursued knowledge in learning about what is a real apprenticeship after learning what one is not - the hard way. My lessons of working in shops up until now have been the same for every real artist of note , I basically learned what kind of shop I wanted to be in, and who/what style I wanted to follow. You learn the hard way, and after the 3 shops I was in ALL eventually closed, I like to think it was time well served. I've spent every spare penny earned not paying bills and supporting my family - investing into the proper tools of the trade, and how they work, as well as countless hours hunched over tables drawing. No matter how many times asked, I have never tattooed on my own, instead preferring to learn under those I've been gracious enough to assist me in my quest . I have performed such tasks as front of shop and house artist, to cleaning and sterilization, waiting on customers to drumming up business, I've done as much as I can all in the hope of that one holy grail - the mentor in "hands on" tattooing. Until now. With this offer, I can focus on what I need to learn from a proper teacher, one invested in it with his life. It's the way things used to run in America, and ways skills and trades are passed on and someday I hope I can do the same.


The Apprenticeship Offer
The artist I have been consulting with on and off over the past 15 years ( and have known since childhood) has officially offered me an apprenticeship. A traditional apprenticeship. The offer comes with the requirement of a move to my homestate of Michigan. As a tattoo artist, businessman and artist - it's an offer from someone I admire,respect, and am ready to work for . I adorn my own skin with his art , and I am I'm honored and excited , but - I'm also out of 30 years of savings. I need to augment my supplies with proper tools, and he will guide me so the $ goes where it needs to not in the worng things. I need to move back to Michigan from California, and pack up and sell/rent/figure out what to do with a house in a no selling economy. I have the headaches we all have, but the $ raised here, will be used STRICTLY for supplies to get me into my new trade. Below are sone examples of what I have been up too learning at those various jobs.


What have I been doing ?
The past 10 years has been rough on all of us - especially those in the creative arts. After succeeding in the entertainment photography field , the economy happend. I've always held a stable retail job, until the layoffs began in Detroit . I've moved from Detroit, MI to Norfolk VA, to Carlsbad Ca, then Oceanside CA , then San Diego (two different locations!) and most recently Escondido - all to follow a "regular" job paycheck to afford bills and a home for my family. In 6 years I've been a gallery curator, a interior decorator to a furniture store chain, newspaper staff photographer , and several retail clerk jobs. I've sold my professional camera gear just to make rent and have applied at every local store there is. There is simply no way without asking for assistance I can do this again. My bank account is empty, and family back home is going through the same, or worse. I've put off my own health and dental (a mess, literally) to make sure my fiancee and pet are healthy but at my own detriment. But wait !!!  A new  future awaits me back East, job training that solely depends on my own drive and determination. I've made it this far, now...I just need your help. The amount I am asking for will go directly towards my career of tattooing in a professional shop environment.
I'm asking for an amount to purchase the tools of the trade I still require (Health shots, bloodbourne path courses,license,autoclaive for sterilization and health safety supplies. . With your help I hope to continue to support my family with my art ( I sold my camera gear to make it this far !) and hopefully this will make a more dependable future for them as well. ( a lot of the training is very similar to ER techs, something that could come in handy to daily life as well ).
  I'm offering packages of art prints , but if you want something else - ask, I will do anything to make this happen . I have several websites below most recently offering new work and links to past work , for your review. Everything purchased from my Fine Art America or Society 6 page will get you immediate art . This page is for the health supplies and fees to get legal. I've got the talent and the basics - and everyone needs art ! This way , we all win ! I have already spent a considerable amount on supplies and machinery.  I ask you investigate further and look at my websites, including Facebook, and Fine Art America - where you can gauge my work, and see what I have done in the past and up to this point . I've resisted until now , to ask for help. It's become impossible without your help, and I hope I can offer you something in return.
The Amount - Visit indie-gogo "The Tattoo Apprenticeship"  to see more ! 



Feel free to email me directly at fotogink@gmail.com for any questions , I refuse to give up - I've come too far.

Let's make the world safer, brighter and a better place for art by doing it correctly and with honor . Thank you.

story:
Neo Christian Symbolism

Visual Communication of the Gospel

By Justin

 What is it?

  • An art book created by an American Christian artist living in Central Asia.
  • It is a collection of drawings, paintings and prints created by the artist as a tool to share truth to the Central Asian culture.
  • It shows a Visual communication of Christian faith through art, design and symbols.
  • You will get a unique look into the artist's creative process.

Why would you want this book?

  •  This book is a tool for explaining faith and a training manual for Christian artists.

What is the purpose?

  • By supporting this project you will be enabling a Christian art gallery in one of the largest Muslim cities in the world to continue operating as it encourages and inspires Central Asian Christian artists.
  • This book will be published in Central Asia and the text content will be written in the local language as well as English for spreading Gospel truth visually and training other artists to do the same.

Visual Communication of the Gospel
By Justin
 What is it?

An art book created by an American Christian artist living in Central Asia.
It is a collection of drawings, paintings and prints created by the artist as a tool to share truth to the Central Asian culture.
It shows a Visual communication of Christian faith through art, design and symbols.
You will get a unique look into the artist's creative process.

This book will be published in Central Asia and the text content will be written in the local language as well as English for spreading Gospel truth visually and training other artists to do the same.

story:
La boutique de YesWeCamp ouverte 30 jours 

Yes We Camp, c'est l'aventure d'un lieu-événement qui a débuté en mai 2013 sur le quai de l'Estaque, à Marseille. Ce camping aux architectures innovantes, aux soirées loufoques, au fonctionnement atypique et à l'allure décalée, fermera ses portes en octobre. Gardez un peu de YesWeCamp avec vous en vous offrant la panoplie du YesWeCampeur, réalisée par notre équipe d'artistes et de graphistes.





Pourquoi maintenant?

Pour ceux qui ont eu la chance de venir au camping (vous pouvez toujours venir, il ferme début octobre !), vous avez sûrement pu apercevoir que notre équipe de bénévoles était déjà bien occupée au bon fonctionnement du lieu, et qu'il nous a été difficile de prendre le temps de réaliser et de vendre des objets-souvenirs ! Qu'à cela tienne, il n'est pas trop tard. Ci-contre nous vous proposons tout ce dont vous aurez besoin l'été prochain pour vos futures vacances, ou divers objets, témoins de la photogénie du camping. "Eh oui j'y étais !"


YesWeCamp a-t-il encore besoin de soutien financier ?

Yes We Camp a vu ses hébergements complets tout le mois de juillet et d'août, le bar en a désaltéré plus d'un et a même tenu ses fidèles, les soirées ont battu leur pleins et certaines babines se souviennent encore des samedis bonnes bouffes, alors ?
En effet, grâce à ces bons mois d'été, nous sommes rentrés dans nos frais de dépenses malgré tous les imprévus. Malheureusement, ces bénéfices ne sont pas suffisant pour régler les coûts de la construction du camping.
Rappelons-nous que YesWeCamp est une initiative indépendante qui tourne avec une équipe têtue et téméraire de bénévoles. Même le directeur n'est pas payé, c'est pour vous dire...



Pourquoi passer par indiegogo ?

Notre boutique est éphémère, tout comme le projet du camping ! Pour que celle-ci soit un minimum rentable pour notre association, nous préférons faire un tir groupé de commandes plutôt que de la vente au cas par cas. Les 500€ de but à atteindre n'est donc que symbolique. Certains de nos objets en vente n'ont pas encore été édités. Pour ceux-là, il s'agit d'un pré-achat, afin que nous n'ayons pas de pertes sur nos commandes.



Présentation des objets-souvenirs

(n'oubliez pas de regarder notre vidéo d'introduction, ils y sont présentés)

Les frais de port en France sont compris dans les prix.




Ils ont parlé de YesWeCamp...

"C’est incroyable ici la quantité d’innovation au m² !"
Pascal Canfin, ministre délégué au développement

"Une expérimentation citadine qui rime avec auto-production, recyclage et bon voisinage. Il s’agit de faire du tourisme autrement et de vivre une expérience artistique totale."
La Provence, 19 novembre 2012.

"C’est un petit laboratoire de fabrication de ville et, en même temps, une performance."
L’Humanité, 25 juillet 2013

"Une initiative en open source, collective, non-institutionnelle, et à la portée de tous."
Radio Nova, 20 novembre 2012.



Merci pour votre attention et à bientôt au camping !

"Une expérimentation citadine qui rime avec auto-production, recyclage et bon voisinage. Il s’agit de faire du tourisme autrement et de vivre une expérience artistique totale."La Provence, 19 novembre 2012.

story:
Short Summary

In 1995, the visually stunning film "Waterworld" was released.  A post apocalyptic film on water, it featured a number of great floating vehicles, action sequences, and stunts.  Besides Kevin Costner, the star of the film had to be the giant oil tanker turned floating fortress, the Exxon Valdez or, as the Smokers called it, "The Deez".

For the film, a giant model of the ship was built in the Mojave desert.  It was used for various effects and explosions seen in the film.  After filming, the 100 foot long, 20 feet wide, 12 foot tall carcass of the "model" was stored at Edwards Air Force Base, where it sat for almost 20 years.  In 2014, it was purchased by Post Apocalyptic artist Ron Griffith for use as The Pirates of the Arid Seas tribe camp at the yearly post apocalyptic celebration, "Wasteland Weekend".   Ron and I must get it off Edwards Air Force base in three months, or the entire thing will be sold for scrap, never to be seen again.

The plan is to cut the Exxon Valdez into pieces and create a grounded mini-Valdez post apocalyptic trawler that measures 40 feet long by 12 feet wide.  This smaller Valdez will become the Pirates of the Arid Seas camp AND the new Wasteland Weekend Post Apocalyptic Swimsuit Contest venue!  It will also save forever, the stern of the boat with the Exxon Valdez name on it, along with other notable details from the model.

To do the above, we need $4999.00 dollars in funds to make a 2 piece ship with a crack in the middle (like the one picture above).  BUT, if we can raise $2500, we can make an impressive ship wreck with just the stern of the boat and a little bow part!  So whether we are able to raise the full amount, or even half that, we can still save parts of the Valdez and make an impressive post apocalyptic display!  THIS SMALLER SHIP WILL BE A YEARLY PRESENCE AT WASTELAND WEEKEND and other post apocalyptic events!

By donating to this IndieGoGo event, you will be saving a piece of filmic history, creating an amazing venue for an annual swimsuit contest, and giving yourself and friends an opportunity for VIP treatment with the Pirates of the Arid Seas during the 2015 Wasteland Weekend Event and beyond.

The Impact

This campaign is aimed at preserving pieces of  100' "model" of "The Deez" built for the compelling action film called "Waterworld".   As a contributor, you will be assisting in creating a post-apocalyptic wonder of the world - a grounded trawler in a sea of sand; a new home to a gaggle of ocean-influenced, landlubber pirates aching to get back to the sea during the post apocalyptic festival "Wasteland Weekend".  This is a chance to not only save history, but if you are a Wasteland Weekend participant, touch it and party on it.

The builders of this project all have much experience in building.  Ron Griffith is a master fabricator of Post Apocalyptic Cars.  I, Paul Miller, am a Prop Builder and Production Designer in films and TV, and many of our builders are members of Union 44, the film union for carpenters and artists!

This is a once in a lifetime opportunity to save a part of history, and co-exist with it in a post-apocalyptic setting.  Even if you can't attend Wasteland Weekend, there are many perks that cater to those just wanting to contribute and get a feel for the event!  CHECK OUT THE REDUCED PRICED  PERKS!!!!!!!!!

Risks & Challenges

There are some hurtles we have to overcome in the attempt to save pieces of the Valdez from salvage.  First and foremost, the ship is HUGE!  100 feet long by 20 feet wide, by 12 feet high!  It is our jobs as builders to tear this large beast apart.  Luckily, many of the crew has had a lot of experience in tearing down film sets.  It will be hard work, but it can be done!

The other challenge will be to make the ship smaller and transportable.  If we do the 2 piece, 80' version, it will be done by mounting the two ship pieces onto two car trailers.   Our goal is to keep key pieces of the Valdez and build it into a 2 piece trailerable trawler.  

If are fund raising only brings in half of the needed amount, we'll be making a ship that is modular and built around a small travel trailer.  Set up and take down will involve more work, but at least parts of the ship will be saved.  Either way, my production design experience, along with the Union 44 builders will insure that this is done both safely and visually satisfying.

Other Ways You Can Help

Perhaps you can't contribute financially.  Times are hard and we all have commitments.  You can still help. 

First off, you can share about Wasteland Weekend and The Pirates of the Arid Seas and our goal to save the Exxon Valdez.  Meet someone raving about Mad Max Fury Road or the upcoming Mad Max game (which incidentally features grounded ships)?  Share with them about how they can get involved with this campaign.

You can use Indiegogo to spread the world also.  I know I, and my crew, would greatly appreciate it.

Finally, if you are in the LA area and would like to physically pitch in, either during the tearing apart of the ship (on July 25th and 26th), or the build (during August and September), give me a shout and let me know.  "The Deez" is located at Edwards Air Force Base in Mojave and the ship will be built at Phoenix Auto in  California City.  It's a great road trip and a chance to meet great Wastelanders!  Also, if you have lumber in the form of 2 x4, 2 x 6, 2 x 12, or plywood, please consider donating it to us for our build!

story:
A is for Amber, who drowned in a pool.

B is for Billy, who was eaten by ghouls.

T is for Tasha, a student embarking on a special project!

 

The Story 

 

A Gorey Demise Storybook is a project I'm executing for my 2012 Graduate Exhibition work for Simon Fraser University's School for Contemporary Arts. I've taken on hand-illustrating, printing, and binding a 28-page hardcover graphic-arts book that I will only make 12 copies of.

"A Gorey Demise" is a written piece composed and performed by Curtis Rx and Creature Feature Music. It pays homage to one of the literary influences of the singer-songwriter's projects. A Gorey Demise begs visual representation-  challenge accepted!

 

The text chronicles, alphabetically, a cast of characters' twisted and grisly deaths.  I will reinterpret the original text into a book that reads like a childrens storybook, but calls out a tension between its primary form and macabre content. I'll be illustrating the text with my own stylized type of characters I affectionately call Kriggles. 

Drawing this kind of quirky, creative content impassions me! The process of turning the work into this small run of high-quality books is what makes the whole project a work of art.

 

How am I doing this?

I'm creating a series of original colour illustrations by hand in traditional media. The illustrations will be scanned and printed, then bound hardcover by hand. Ultimately, the books will be exhibited within the arts community and to project contributors. Producing a limited number of quality pieces will make each book a special sculptural work of art.

 

What I Need, And Its Impact

This is a not-for-profit project for my Graduate Exhibition piece. It will cost just over $1600 to do this. Your pledge will directly support making this piece, and paying for:

  • $370 in Art Supplies: drawing paper, inking pens, and illustrative markers and cartridges
  • $150 in Printing Paper: 100lb text-weight paper cut to size for printing the book pages
  • $650  in Printing and Ink costs; printing 30+ different digital files larger-format in small runs is much more expensive than printing 300 copies of a single image.
  • $470 Book Binding Materials and Labor Costs & Shipping Costs

 

Raising funds is critical to the execution of this project. As a student I earn limited income from 2 part-time jobs and working the hours to make money to pay for my project will rob me of the time I need to spend illustrating the artwork for the next 2 months. I need to complete the artwork in January to begin printing, and have the work bound in February. March 2012 is my cushion month to tie up loose ends, and the Exhibition is April 2012. Your pledge will enable me to do the part of this project I'm most excited about; bring my ideas alive through illustration, and create a beautiful piece of art.

 

What if everyone's as excited about A Gorey Demise Storybook as I am, and we overfund?

If we exceed the $1600 production cost goal, 2 things will happen; I'll be able to produce an even better quality final product, and I'm committed that if there are funds left after production, I will donate a percentage  to Creature Feature Music's film and performance projects which are themselves in desperate need of funding.

 
Other Ways You Can Help

Another part of this artwork and project is sharing my process. You can be a part of this by sharing my Campaign, Facebook Page, Tumblr or other outlets with people you think would appreciate my quirky and fun art project.

You can also check out, and love-bomb, the people who are committed to helping me make this project possible;

  • The good folks at www.letraset.co.uk are sincerely committed to helping student art works, and have generously donated a set of Letraset Tria Markers to help with my project.

  • Creature Feature Music www.creaturefeaturemusic.com have granted copyright permissions for me to make my work public! http://www.facebook.com/creaturefeaturemusic

          A Gorey Demise can be found at http://creaturefeature.bandcamp.com/track/a-gorey-demise

  • Pac Blue Printing are committed to supporting the artists and proffessionals with high quality printing, and have generously donated printing sponsorship. www.pacblueprinting.com

  •  Creative Brand Specialist AdaPia d'Errico http://www.linkedin.com/in/adapiais donating time and resources in supporting campaigning.

  •  Painter & Illustrator Camilla d'Errico and d'Errico Studios Ltd., www.camilladerrico.com are making contributions of productions materials and resources http://www.facebook.com/camilladerricoart

story:
Our Story


Black Box is a Vending Machine to dispense independent art and
literature.  It is a way for artists to not only sell their work, but
to get it out there put on display for all to see.  Everything from
Books, Zines, DVDâ€™s, CDâ€™s, Cassettes, Toys, Postcards, or anything
creative that is made by local artists.  All products are non
corporate, independent, local, works.  This is a great opportunity
to create community and culture rather than more candy.


The Impact

The idea came one day when I was in a convenience store and realized that everything from the food to the tabloid magazines were all very unfulfilling. I decided to start a vending machine that sells nothing but local and international, independent media, easily accessible to the community.  It is a project that I would like the create into something bigger, something where every big neighborhood or even small town can have one. 


On the side of all machines, students are free to post what ever they
want from art, poems, band fliers, or even if your looking to sublease
your apartment.  The idea is to create more of a community.  People
will want to hang out around the machine.


What We Need 

We need at least $3,000 to get the machine and website up and running.

story:
As someone who has been fan, proponent and originator of independent publishing in the past (The Key, STOP & CSNA) I'm very excited to announce the launch of my on-line & limited print edition art & literary journal VACZINE. VACZINE will feature a varied assortment of photography, painting, multi-media art & collage, graffiti, video, short stories & broken werd. The extremely talented & visionary art director Frank Gargiulo will be in charge of the design and visual presentation. I will be serving as editor & publisher. Much like my earlier and much celebrated zine STOP, VACZINE is about everything & nothing. No theme yet it all comes together. Open to everyone to express anything. All I ask is that you always come correct and submit your best work. If you don't believe in it then how can you expect anyone else to? VACZINE is an annual publication that celebrates and focuses on all kinds of art, writing and visual or aural expression. We don't follow. We don't lead. We excel. VACZINE hopes to be a venue for artists to showcase their work in an uncensored & completely open venue.
VACZINE will also be curating upcoming exhibitions at The Leslie Lohman Gay & Lesbian Museum & Gallery that will feature the artists first seen in the magazine.

I am hoping to raise the printing costs for our debut issue so I can avoid the typical route of paid advertising. Instead VACZINE is giving 4 pages of advertising space for free to new designers & galleries that we feel are important to watch & worth supporting. Therefore I am seeking to raise $5000 to pay for the 10 deluxe editions and the remaining softcover editions which will be sold exclusively at The Leslie Lohman Museum as well as through VACZINE.

WALT CESSNA IS A WRITER, PHOTOGRAPHER AND FORMER FASHION DESIGNER WHO STARTED HIS CAREER IN FASHION AS A VOGUE OBSESSED THIRTEEN YEAR OLD EVENTUALLY WORKING WITH THE LIKES OF KNOCKOFF KING AND DRESS MOGUL JACK "FAST JACK" MULQUEEN, AND DESIGNER NORMA KAMALI. IN THE YEARS TO COME HE ESTABLISHED HIMSELF AS A FASHION DESIGNER WITH HIS MUCH ACCLAIMED DON CASUAL LABEL, DESIGNING AND SELF-PRODUCING A LINE OF MEN'S AND WOMEN'S SPORTSWEAR. OVER THE YEARS HIS SHORT STORIES HAVE APPEARED IN VARIOUS MAGAZINES SUCH AS PAPER AS WELL AS NUMEROUS BLOGS. HIS PHOTOGRAPHY WORK CAN BE FOUND VIRTUALLY ANYWHERE ON THE INTERNET AS WELL AS IN HIS PUBLISHED PHOTOGRAPHY COLLECTIONS FUKT 2 START WIT AND WOLFPACK! HE CURRENTLY LIVES IN NEW YORK CITY.

FUKT 2 START WITH : Short Stories & Broken Werd by Walt Cessna
http://sixteenfourteen.com/fukt.html

VFiles has archived all 4 issues of my semi-legendary zine STOP (1990-91)
https://www.vfiles.com/users/stop/items

VACZINE

Debut Issue available to order May 1st 2014
Editor & Publisher - Walt Cessna
Art Direction & Logo - Frank Gargiulo


Cover by Scooter LaForge. Featuring original work from Slava Mogutin & Brian Kenny, Dietmar Busse, Natasha Gornik, Brett Lindell, Maria Pineres, Derek DeWitt, Gio Black Peter, Ves Pitts, Darren Ankenbauer, Jody Jock, Walt Cassidy, Stanley Stellar, Tobie Giddio, Jonathan Daniel Federico, Elizabeth McGrath, Dick Mitchell, Scott Pasfield, Michael Anthony Alago, Emily Payne, Max Steele, Penny Arcade, Michel Delsol, Kelly Bush, Barek Art, Simon Crawford, Allen Todd Yeager, George Towne, Marne Lucas Photography, Gregory Moon, Gazelle Paulo, Chick Byrne, Carlo Quispe, Ethan Shoshan, Clint Catalyst, Stu Lewis, Jason Hardung, Pretty Words, Honey McMoney, Jeff Silverman, Joel Handorff, Muffinhead Daehniffum, BOY WOLF, Ben Copperwheat, Lee Baxter, Bubi Canal, Richard Schemmerer, Zoë Williams, Shain K. Pop, Naruki Kukita, Scott Lifshutz, HOMO-RIOT, Robert J. Anderson, Adrian Carroll, Aaron Smith, Boy Hitha, Mikey Pop, Thomas R. Hane II, Michael Donnoe & a few surprises that will shock your senses & titillate your soul. Hopefully ;)

Only 10 DELUXE editions available.
Signed by Walt Cessna, Scooter LaForge & Frank Gargiulo / #’d 8X10 hard cover VACZINE #1 180 pgs. Color/B&W perfect bound
Each comes with an original SCOOTER LAFORGE ENTERPRISES t-shirt & a signed archival 8X10 print by Walt Cessna
$250 
payable to waltcsna@gmail.com at PayPal. Includes shipping.

Soft cover / perfect bound unsigned copies of VACZINE #1 available to order for $100 starting May 25th 2014

inquiries/requests/submissions/info please send to
vaczineartjournal@gmail.com

Save the date! May 1 2015 VACZINE : The Inoculation Of NYC curated by Walt Cessna and featuring 25 of the most important artists utilizing social media will take place at The Leslie Lohman Museum of Gay & Lesbian Art.

Only 10 DELUXE editions available. Signed by Walt Cessna, Scooter LaForge & Frank Gargiulo / #’d 8X10 hard cover VACZINE #1 180 pgs. Color/B&W perfect bound Each comes with an original SCOOTER LAFORGE ENTERPRISES t-shirt & a signed archival 8X10 print by Walt Cessna $250 payable to waltcsna@gmail.com at PayPal. Includes shipping.Soft cover / perfect bound unsigned copies of VACZINE #1 available to order for $100 starting May 25th 2014 inquiries/requests/submissions/info please send to vaczineartjournal@gmail.com
Save the date! May 1 2015 VACZINE : The Inoculation Of NYC curated by
 Walt Cessna and featuring 25 of the most important artists utilizing 
social media will take place at The Leslie Lohman Museum of Gay & 
Lesbian Art.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Chris Donnelly and I am a potter in Edinburgh, Scotland.  
  • I want to create a mini kiln that is fired with charcoal and a fan that is powered through solar, wind, and heat reclamation.  
  • With funding, this project will advance the legacy of Akira Yoshida's work, and it will also get people talking about sustainable and renewable energy in the arts and design.
  • It will contribute to the wider education of ceramics from professional artists and craftspeople to the novice, amateur, and DIY enthusiast.  
  • I will compile all the instructions and assets needed to create one of these kilns in an electronic publication.


What We Need & What You Get

  • I am asking for £500.00 to get this project off the ground.  
  • This will enable the purchase of refractory products for the kiln to experiment with the shape and size.
  • The funds will also allow research time and development of the wind power and heat reclamation power generating systems. 
  • If the funding goal is unsuccessful, I will still go ahead with the project but with a much longer timeline.
  • If the funding exceeds the goal,  I will be able to put a more professional finish on the documenting and distributable content as well as presenting this project to institutions that can use this project as a teaching tool.

The Impact

  • I think that this project is important because it will start a conversation about renewable and sustainable energy without being heavy handed with environmentalism
  • The research put together for this project will make this and similar processes in ceramics more accessible and understandable to students, hobbyist, and professionals. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I realize not everybody can contribute to this project, but if you could do one of these free things

  • Promote this campaign using social media
  • Tell someone that might be interested in either supporting or interested in the outcome
