story:
HELLO!

My name is Natalia, though I've gone under the alias of 'ZPS' for over a decade.

Art is something that has supported me throughout my life. Through the years it has helped me develop parts of myself I find difficult to put into words. Art is a big part of what makes me grow, and it is really exciting when doing something you love has the potential to  inspire growth in others.

When it comes to art, people often attach expectation of what they want the finished product to look like before they even start. Along the way they unintentionally fall into a 'fear' mindset of 'I can't do this' and doubt their own abilities. My intention with printing this coloring book is to ease the burden. It is very cathartic to relax into a writing instrument and see what comes out onto paper. When you are making a mark you can do no wrong! 

When I look at an older piece of my work, I can recall where I was physically and mentally at that period of my life. The collection of pictures in this book came as a result of great flux. There are themes of self love, centering, spirit. There is nudity, there is magic. This book is meant to help an adult connect and explore with their inner child.


What We Need 

There is an astounding number of factors that contribute to printing something. Over the last few weeks I've been collecting quotes and have settled on a company, then gone through options on sizes, paper weight, binding style, etc. Plus there are other costs that will come into play along the way- shipping, duty, etc. Also to take into account the amount of hours that went into making the images and prepping them for printing. Its been my dream for a long time to do this but I am not in a situation that I can invest in this without some help. So with much consideration, these are the goals:

Tier 1: Goal - $777  6x9 inch coloring books, coil bound, 70lb paper

This is the least expensive option. This paper would be good for pencil crayons, but not the best for markers. The pages will be single sided, but might result in some bleed through.

Tier 2: Stretch Goal - $1111 8.5x11 inch coloring books, coil bound, 70lb paper

Bigger coloring books! Same weight of paper and coiled as tier 1 but a better size for all the small details.

Tier 3: Fancy Stretch Goal - $1212 8.5x11 inch coloring books, coil bound, 100lb paper, vertical perforation 

When I think of what I would love for this to look like, this is the dream. Thicker stock of paper, larger size and vertical perforation to easily rip pages out and ready to frame.

More money? More books! If the demand is high this gives me freedom to print more books, make more art, put money towards different kinds of printing. 

Perks

Give stuff get stuuuuuff!
At these donation levels, you can also choose to have these things! This is what I've listed these book at, but I like to adopt a pay what you will on my stuff. These are the suggested prices but if you feel like you wanna pay more, I will certainly toss in some extra goodies for you. *u*

$5 - Lets Get Sticky

Hand drawn stickers! If you follow my social media @zpsart you can see examples of these, I've been trying to draw them every day! I'll mail you some sticky love for an extra $1 in Canada, $2 to the States or $3 International.

$7 - Slow Loving

Postcards! I will send you a handmade photo postcard with a doodle on it. I can send it in an envelope so I can put stickers in it. Plus shipping $1 in Canada, $2 to the States or $3 International or free local pickup.

$15 - 1 Copy of the Coloring Book

To get a copy of the thing, slapped fresh off the printer, pick this one. The total book size will be determined based off of how much $$ we can pile up. If the magic number is not hit, I will fund the remainder for the lowest cost I can that I am still happy with. 

$25 - Coloring Book Deluxe

Ooh so fancy. Get a super deluxe copy of the thing with a doodle along with some stickers and other extra goodies. Send it by snail mail for an extra $10 in Canada, $12 to the States or $15 International or free local pickup.

$35 - Handmade Gemstone Clay Pendant

Pick one of six handmade gemstone clay pendants measuring approximately 3 inches long. These are available first come first served, and one of a kind. Add an extra $10 for Canadian shipping or $12 for US.

$40 - Coloring Book & Small Watercolor

With this perk, you will receive a brand spanking new book along with a 6x9" original watercolor from the Goddess Summoning series (existing piece). Free local pickup or send my snail mail for an extra $10 in Canada, $12 to the States.

$45 - Coloring Book & Watercolor - SOLD OUT

Holy smokes, all gone! You'll get a brand new lovely coloring book- plus an original watercolor (existing piece 8.5x11" or smaller). Send it by snail mail for an extra $10 in Canada, $12 to the States or $15 International. Free local pickup.

$60 - Custom Art

No coloring book, but you want some ZPSart? I will draw you a custom girl portrait in the medium of your choice or make a custom mixed media art piece 8.5x11" or smaller. These might take a bit longer though, kay? Send it by snail mail for an extra $10 in Canada, $12 to the States or $15 International. Free local meetup exchange tea time.

$160 - Mixed Media Art Party

WOAH! Oh golly. You wanna make some art? You got some friends that like to make art? Let's get four of them together with you and I and have a little party. I'll bring the stuff, you bring the snacks. We'll meet up somewhere, have a good time and get our hands covered and paint. (Additional travel costs outside of Edmonton)


Risks & Challenges

The risk is on myself, and it is one I was afraid to take for a long time. Many of you that know me know that I have been talking about this for a while. The big changes over the last year have been a set back, and even setting up a campaign wasn't without its worries- what if I don't succeed? I am finally in a position where I am ready to take the leap and take a chance on myself and my passion. Any support I can get in that would be a monumental help.

The challenge is that I have the short deadline because I would like to attempt to make these in time for the YEG Whyte Avenue Art Walk on July 8-10. I will have a table on the 103rd block in front of Mars & Venus.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, there are still ways to help if you wanna. Make some noise! Please like, follow, share this campaign or my art page on whatever social media, shout it out in the streets. Spread the ZPS love.

With gratitude! <3

story:
The project:

As a young artist, I need to begin taking steps to building a long-term career. The first thing I can think of to do this is to start selling my art. In order to be successful in the arts one must put them self out there and take risks, so that's what I'm doing.

People have asked to buy my art, but until now I have been focusing on building a portfolio and haven't tried to sell it. I'm starting with a challenge to myself: the 'An Eye a Day' project is about drawing and selling 30 eye drawings in 30 days. 

The motives:

As a high school student, I am excited about a future where I can be my own boss and support myself with my talent and my passion. With this project, I hope to start making money to save up for life after graduation and tuition for art school.

I could get a job, but this is a win-win-win situation: I make more art, practice the business side of being an artist, and you get a personal piece of art for yourself.

Why eyes?

Eyes are my favorite thing to draw for a couple of reasons:

The variety in textures from the eyeball to the skin to the eyelashes and brows makes them a challenge to draw

The way eyes express human emotion in such a pure and honest way makes them deeply personal and unique, and in my opinion, the most interesting feature humans possess.

Why a 30-day challenge? 

I chose to do a 30-day challenge as a starting place so that I can practice discipline as an artist and to prove to myself that I can accomplish goals that I set for myself without motivation from others. 30 days is not a long time so it's a good way to start without too much stress or pressure, while still being challenging and pushing myself as an artist.

story:
MirrorrorriM: The Alchemy of Play

MirrorrorriM is an art project being pioneered by a group of artists who have come together to create a giant, transportable kaleidoscope that is completely participant operated. This 30' long kaleidoscope is clad in wood and spins in-place on a series of caster wheels. At one end is a viewing chamber for folks to enjoy the show, and on the other end is our own version of the "object chamber" where you might find small beads or glass in a regular kaleidoscope, but not MirrorrorriM. Our object chamber is a giant wheel that participants strap their feet into and spin to create a pattern with their body, while behind them a fire wheel adds light and chaos (oh, and some heat). The whole kaleidoscope is participant-operated: it spins when several people work together to push it, and the psychedelic images are created by a real person's body turning in front of a fire wheel. Sound awesome? Read on!   

The aim of this campaign is to get enough funding to get our project rolling! As a team, we are completely dedicated to the project and have been putting much love (and money!) into it. With your help we can take our project not only to Burning Man 2016 but also the road to be appreciated everywhere. The intention behind this project is to take it as many places as possible, so everyone can experience transformative, large-scale, interactive, community-driven art.  We have plans to take it to community events, have it installed at art galleries, and take it to schools! MirrorrorriM can be altered depending on the event: we can remove the fire element if it is not desired or we can add additional colour wheels (think Rainbows for Pride or Red and White for Canada Day!).

So, How Much Money do We Need? 

We've budgeted our project to be about $30,000 and we are hoping the raise half of that with this campaign. If we do not reach the goal of our campaign, the funds will still go directly into the project and we will explore new funding avenues. 

What's The $$ For?

Materials: Polycarbonate mirrors, wood siding, copper tubing, wheels, lasers (LASERS!), etc. 

Transportation: The usual fuel costs AND a 40' trailer to build it on so that we can roll into any city and be instantly ready to delight!

Perks For You!

We've got some really amazing perks. We've got t-shirts, hoodies, stickers, and bandannas. We also have some handmade kaleidoscopes and some CNC'd artwork for you to enjoy any time! And there's a chance that we could bring the project to your birthday party (if you live on the west coast of North America). **

The Impact

MirrorrirriM has the potential to make an impact in the areas of art, community, play, and science. The first thing participants will feel when they see a school-bus-sized kaleidoscope before them is a sense of awe and delight, but quickly they move into a space of gathering the folks around them into a team (or community) to get the main tube spinning. Whether we're talking about adults on playa or kids at a science centre, the project encourages communication and teamwork. Some people have to push, some people get to watch the results inside, some people control the lasers, and at least two people have to be brave enough to strap into the roll-chamber in front of the fire-wheel and go for a ride. 

The kaleidoscope also offers an opportunity for discussion and teaching. The science of how and why a kaleidoscope creates such strange and unpredictable images is a great opportunity to talk about light refraction and geometry. Do you know how and why a kaleidoscope works?

One thing bout MirrorrorriM is that you get out of as much as you put into it, so that it may appear as a giant child's toy, it is in fact an alchemic transmutation device inspired by Leonardo da Vinci's genius. Inspired by the Virtruvian Man and the alchemic questions of "squaring the circle," MirrorrorriM turns these equations and puzzles into art. We encourage participants to explore deeper to discover the hidden symbolize within the act of play.

Mostly though, the impact of MirrorrorriM will be delight and awe. Remember when you were a kid and someone gave you a little cardboard tube rolled in coloured paper? Remember how amazed you felt when you peered inside and found an ever-changing world of colour and light? Now, let's fast forward, scale-up, and you'll find that MirrorrorriM is an epic experience that you won't soon forget. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everybody is in a position to donate money (although seriously, even a small sum goes a long way), but that doesn't mean you can't help. Help us spread the word about MirrorrorriM to your friends, family, and colleagues. You never know who might be interested in supporting the project or having MirrorrorriM visit their town. By sharing on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or wherever you connect, you help bring us one step closer to sharing MirrorrorriM with more folks! Use the Indiegogo Sharing Tools!

With your help, we can make this project come alive. It will stand triumphantly on playa in Black Rock City, being enjoyed by hoards of Burners all working together to make it operate. After it's debut, we hope to bring the playa-experience to everyone. Akin to how a kaleidoscope uses a triangle of three mirrors to create an entrancing image, MirrorrorriM: The Alchemy of Play utilizes a triangle of Art, Play, and Interactivity to create a whole-body experience.

story:
Hello, my name is Matt Kleckner. Originally from Pennsylvania, I moved to Manhattan in Fall of 2014 to purse a career as an actor and writer. Last April my first play "Thursday, Five Years from Now" had its premiere production and now I'm ready to do it again! The play will be a part of Manhattan Repertory Theatre's Spring One Act Competition this March.

Thursday, Five Years From Now examines a young man's relationship with his own mortality and the fear and uncertainty that lurk within us when faced with a life altering diagnosis. It is a very bare piece without being unnecessarily shocking or vulgar. That being said, it possesses a comedic warmth and sincerity that we all use as coping mechanisms during times of adversity. It is a short, slice of life comedy with a bit of an edge. Thursday Five Years from Now asks that timeless question; If an asshole gets cancer, who gives a shit? 

 I am asking for 2,700 dollars to fund this project which will be used as detailed;

-I consider performing as a profession for which one deserves compensation. Approximately 1/3 of my funding will go to pay my actors and creative team

-While the cost of the performance space and marketing are provided for us it falls upon myself to provide rehearsal space as well as any props or costuming materials I need. This is where the other 2/3's of my funding will be expended.

If I fail to reach my 2,700 dollar goal whatever funds raised will still go towards the production, with the exception of money pledged to the Colon Cancer Alliance and Free to Breathe: Lung Resource Center.  As an Eagle Scout I know how to be thrifty with what I have and will make it work regardless of my budget.

My qualifications for this project are listed below;

-BA in Acting/Directing from DeSales University

-Singed actor with Dulcina-Eisen Associates

-Previously produced playwright in Manhattan

I am extremely excited to work on this production again. Thank you for your consideration and hopefully your contribution! If you would like any further information about the project please feel free to contact me at m.kleckner92@gmail.com or at my website www.matt-kleckner.com.

Thanks again! -Matt
story_txt: Hello, my name is Matt Kleckner. Originally from Pennsylvania, I moved to Manhattan in Fall of 2014 to purse a career as an actor and writer. Last April my first play "Thursday, Five Years from Now" had its premiere production and now I'm ready to do it again! The play will be a part of Manhattan Repertory Theatre's Spring One Act Competition this March.Thursday, Five Years From Now examines a young man's relationship with his own mortality and the fear and uncertainty that lurk within us when faced with a life altering diagnosis. It is a very bare piece without being unnecessarily shocking or vulgar. That being said, it possesses a comedic warmth and sincerity that we all use as coping mechanisms during times of adversity. It is a short, slice of life comedy with a bit of an edge. Thursday Five Years from Now asks that timeless question; If an asshole gets cancer, who gives a shit?  I am asking for 2,700 dollars to fund this project which will be used as detailed;-I consider performing as a profession for which one deserves compensation. Approximately 1/3 of my funding will go to pay my actors and creative team-While the cost of the performance space and marketing are provided for us it falls upon myself to provide rehearsal space as well as any props or costuming materials I need. This is where the other 2/3's of my funding will be expended.If I fail to reach my 2,700 dollar goal whatever funds raised will still go towards the production, with the exception of money pledged to the Colon Cancer Alliance and Free to Breathe: Lung Resource Center.  As an Eagle Scout I know how to be thrifty with what I have and will make it work regardless of my budget.My qualifications for this project are listed below;-BA in Acting/Directing from DeSales University-Singed actor with Dulcina-Eisen Associates-Previously produced playwright in ManhattanI am extremely excited to work on this production again. Thank you for your consideration and hopefully your contribution! If you would like any further information about the project please feel free to contact me at m.kleckner92@gmail.com or at my website www.matt-kleckner.com.Thanks again! -Matt

story:
We are back!

  • After a wildly successful 8,000 mile road trip in 2013 visiting women's safe houses and shelters, the Women’s Wisdom Initiative's Shelter to Shelter  program is ready to hit the road again!

    This August Caroline & Juliette will pack up art supplies, take to the road and bring the Traveling Postcards Workshop to refugee support centers whose women’s empowerment programs would benefit from additional therapies.

    They will  carry with them the love, wisdom and support of hundreds of women who have shared their voices to help end gender-based violence.


    What We Do:

  • Shelter to Shelter is an opportunity to raise awareness about the pervasive consequences of gender-based violence. At the same time, we hope to give voice and connection to survivors through the healing arts and to celebrate their resiliency and strength!     


What is the issue?

The focus for our 2015 Shelter-to-Shelter trip is the international refugee and immigrant community of Northern California and the Northwestern United States.

  • After Texas, California receives the second highest influx of refugees to any US state; refugees in California come primarily from Iraq, Iran, Burma, and Somalia.
  • During times of war, sexual violence is waged on women’s bodies and spirits as a means of terror and control. Many women arrive in the US with scars of trauma and humiliation. Once relocated, women refugees experience a higher rate of gender inequality due to the extreme instability displacement causes, and they are often reluctant to speak of their abuse for fear of deportation, discrimination and disrespect. 

Our goal is to work in unison with local refugee service organizations to provide our free, therapeutic art workshop, Traveling Postcards, to refugees as a means of support and healing.

What We Need:

  • We are raising $10,000 to fully fund the 2015 Shelter to Shelter program.  This covers the cost of two artists and all planning and travel costs to bring our program to 10 shelters this summer. 
  • We have a proven track record! In 2013 we traveled across the United States and made every one of our intended goals. We showed up to each shelter on time and somedays drove for 4 hours, led a workshop for 4 hours and got back in the car and drove another 4 hours until we found a place to sleep. And we never ran out of gas!


We are motivated to bring the opportunity to speak and to be heard to as many women as we can.
"I am grateful that there are women, such as yourself that continue to make a difference in lives of other women; when often times they feel that no one cares. Thank you for your passion to empower other women so they know they are not alone in their unique journey and not just in your own community but across America. Thank you!" 

Pam Gillenwater Resolve Family Abuse Program Director YWCA Charleston


"The Shelter to Shelter experience allowed me to feel that I was able to be in a room with many other women that have experienced many of the same experiences that I have. I talked to many of my clients afterwards and they discussed that sitting and working on the postcard was a very emotional and powerful experience. They did not know what they were going to make as they sat down but as the postcard was completed it did completely represent them. I would have to agree that my final product was a total representation of myself. I was surprised how hard it was to give it up to someone else and how amazing it felt to know that someone in need was going to get this piece of me and hopefully help them in their healing." 

April Alaspa SafePlace L.P.C.-S. Family Shelter Counselor


“Thanks for the opportunity to participate, reminds us that we are not alone in this work and there are great people such as yourself to give so much time to help others all over the United States!!!“

White Buffalo Calf Woman Society, Rosebud Indian Reservation, SD

The Impact

How does art help?

  • Helping women to reconnect to their hearts and to find the strength to speak their truth is where healing and transformation can occur, and is the central focus of our work. We find the creative arts to be an invaluable tool in this process. 

  • Self-confidence and pride: Each woman is asked to share her voice, her innate wisdom and her resiliency when she makes a postcard; her expression will not only serve as a gift for another survivor, but she will share her voice with a global community of women worldwide. She will be seen and valued.

  • Freedom: Allowing each workshop participant to be the creator and the decision maker increases her sense of belonging and responsibility. Each time she has the option to choose a shape or color and decide where to place it on her card, she is empowered.

  • Empowerment: Through simple transformative art-making processes we have discovered that we can easily share what might seem impossible to verbalize and our voices can then become a powerful catalyst for change.


Our creative and global workshop has created over 2500 cards that have been sent among women around the world in over nine countries.

  • Traveling Postcards creates a non-threatening opportunity for personal connection to humanitarian issues that may seem overwhelming or geographically separate from our own lives. By providing personal connection, we create the possibility for every individual to become socially active in her community in a way that utilizes her best self.

Our Personal Connection

The women's Wisdom Initiative is proud to support women refugees in Nashville, TN. We have partnered with Sew For Hope which offers classes and sewing training to adult refugees in Nashville. The program offers a valuable sense of worth and accomplishment while adding skills for earning an income. With their help, we began sewing the first 200 Traveling Heart Hospital Bags in 2014.


Ways You Can Help

We will also be giving each woman who participates in our workshop an opportunity to choose a Traveling Postcard to keep. We are currently collecting Traveling Postcards to take with us to give away as a gift of solidarity and support. If you would like to send one on our trip please click here for directions!

There is remarkable power in a woman coming to understand that her abuse is not normal and that, in spite of the violence, she is a survivor and deserves equality and justice. 

Don't forget to spread the word and make some noise about our campaign!
Thank you for your support! More info: http://sheltertoshelter.org/ and at http://womenswisdominitiative.org/. 
"Where, after all, do human rights begin? In small places, close to home — so close and so small that they cannot be seen on any maps of the world. Such are the places where every man, woman and child seek equal opportunity, equal dignity, without discrimination. Unless these rights have meaning there, they have little meaning anywhere." ~Eleanor Roosevelt

story:
THE BIG BABY VIKING - ART PROJECT @ AFRIKABURN 2017

This year we are bringing our baby to come and play at AfrikaBurn 2017. This little baby is entirely made of wood and will be around 6 meters tall. A projection will give our baby a face with moving mouth and his eyes will follow the crowd. Speakers are attached so the baby (or you) can say whatever inappropriate things need to be said at night. For all these nightly disturbances our baby has to burn on Sunday evening! Yes! He shall be burned on our last evening in the desert, combined with some dusty blues on the piano. 

Around 60% of the costs are covered and funded by camp Walhalla but we are looking to fund the last 40%. So please help us to get this baby playing at AfrikaBurn 2017!

WHAT ELSE IS HAPPENING AT WALHALLA?

What do they serve in heaven?! Yup! Walhalla Beers and Bears! 

The teddy bears are on their way to the townships to make many little children happy as a flying unicorn. But first they will come to Walhalla to bring some fluffy love and cover all your cuttle needs.

Furthermore relax and play some funky blues on our Piano and get dressed at the Funky Boutique. Later in the evening please hit the DIY Party Button for a 5 min Poco-Loco-Party! 

WHO WE ARE

Walhalla theme camp is a mixed group of around 40 people. Most of us are from The Netherlands but we also have other nationalities joining us. Some are virgin burners and some have been going to BurningMan and AfrikaBurn for over a decade.

Our team captain Ronald Duikersloot is a professional artists based in the Netherlands who works on all kinds of (international) projects. His work and shows can be seen at festivals and events and his free work is to be found in exhibitions and gallery’s. Check out the websites www.spray-art.nl www.atelierRD.nl www.ronaldduikersloot.com

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?

Every euro, dollar and rand donated will be spent on our little baby. Most of it will be for materials like wood, electronics, etc but also for the transport to Tankwa Karoo. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Do you like our project but not able to contribute financially? There are other ways you can help! Mention us on your social media, tell your family, friends, neighbors or any random strangers on the street. We are happy with all the publicity we can find to help us fund our project!

story:
Who We Are:

Andrea Barone = Ohio -> Chicago -> Boston -> New York /// painting & sculpture

Jennifer Conrad = Boulder -> Chicago -> New York /// video & performance 

Sarah Fuhrman = Troy -> Albany -> New York /// painting

Amy Gartrell = California -> New York -> Brooklyn/// sculpture

Elizabeth Knowlton = Washington, CT -> Brooklyn /// video & sculpture

Eugenia Malioykova = Belarus -> Miami -> New York /// painting & printmaking

Lachell Workman = Stratford, CT -> New York ///photography & sculpture

We've come a long way to get here, but we need your help for the final step which is our MFA Thesis Exhibition opening May 1, 2015 at Momenta Art at 56 Bogart St, Brooklyn

All Cats Are Gray In The Dark

"Misogynous traces cling to the phrase, though when the British group The Cure composed their lyrics to “All Cats Are Grey,” the 1981 song that was the more immediate inspiration for the seven women who make up our class of 2015, the phrase was transformed into a dreamy refrain with no agenda."  – Faye Hirsch

Please help these extraordinary emerging artists with the production of their MFA Thesis exhibition at Momenta in Brooklyn. Funds raised will cover the costs of transportation, installation, and opening reception.

The MFA candidates are pleased to offer you perks so as to encourage your liberal donations – the more the better!

story:
Mad About Fiber

The Española Valley Fiber Arts Center (EVFAC) is a community Center for all types of Fiber Arts activity in New Mexico. We are a nonprofit 501(c)3 Member-focused organization that supports our region’s active fiber community through education, programs and economic development.

What We Need

Our Members are creative and we want to offer them the space and equipment that can inspire them beyond their present dreams. Support our effort to upgrade our facilities with a Strauch Double-wide Motorized Carder - the Mad Batt’r, a few additional tools, rolling tables, and fiber drying racks. Many of our Members will benefit from this addition, such as:

  • Barbara - who loves her alpacas and wants to spin elegant fine yarns from their soft fleece, and blend it with silk to add that extra sheen.
  • Liane - who spins wolf, dog and bison fiber into yarns, and does not want to use commercial mills where she will lose 50% of her fiber.
  • Kathy - who is a passionate knitter and is always on the lookout for fancy yarns for her innovative mobius scarves.
  • Erica - who wet-felts luxurious local fibers into sumptuous scarves and needs batts that she can design based on her imagination.

All of them have a passion for processing fiber into batts or yarn, and then into a unique “Wearable Art” product.  Your contribution in developing the “Mad About Fiber” studio will impact our 350+ Membership body and strengthen EVFAC’s positions as the Center for Fiber Arts, attracting fiber enthusiasts to visit us, take classes, and shop many locally made fiber wearables.

The investment needed to create this facility upgrade will cost $3,424, and we have already raised $1,000 from a generous donor in our community. We still need $2,424 to make this a reality. If we raise more than our set goal we will out the amount towards the purchase an agitator-free washing machine to facilitate washing of raw fleece!

The image above shows a single-wide version - we are going for the double-wide!

Artful handspun yarn is just one outcome this equipment can help our Members produce!

What You Get

And when you GIVE, you RECEIVE:
  • $25 - HANDSPUN YARN: You will receive a small sample skein of yarn that was created during one of our Spinning Adventures.
  • $50 – LIMITED EDITION ROVING: You will receive one skein of Berry Granita roving from the EVFAC’s Own line using local fiber (86% Merino 4% Romney 10% Mohair) and local processing.
  • $125 – LIMITED EDITION YARN: You will receive one skein of Little Grey Bird yarn from EVFAC’s Own line roving using local fiber (94% Wool (Merino, Dorset, Jacob), 6% Nylon for some sparkle) and local processing.
  • $300 – FIBER SURPRISE: You will receive a bag full of fiber surprises that will be a delight for your eyes to see and your hands to touch.

The Impact

By contributing to this campaign, you are directly supporting sustainability in the fiber arts. The more resources we can provide to see artists creations through from vision to reality helps to further their fiber arts practice, and ultimately contributes to their financial sustainability & creative well-being.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can continue to show your support by sharing this campaign with friends, family, & fiber enthusiasts. 

Additionally, visit our website, our Facebook, stop by the center, or sign up for our newsletter. Support comes in many forms, & we value your participation in this vibrant community.

story:
Il libro di Umani a Milano in vendita solo qui.

Oltre 200 pagine di persone, ognuno con il suo volto e un piccolo pezzo di una piccola storia.

 

 

Index

Umani a Milano - LIBRO 

  • Progetto Editoriale
  • PERK come acquistare il libro di UAM

... e ancora

  • Storia di UAM e precedenti mostre
  • Press Room -parlano bene di noi
  • Extra, Testimonial, Video Messaggi, i featuring di Gatto Morto
  • Stefano D'Andrea - curatore di UAM
  • Con UAM collaborano

ENG - version

1. Umani a Milano - LIBRO

Una persona al giorno, un ritratto al giorno, una piccola storia al giorno, ecco cos’è Umani a Milano. Cinque minuti di vita di un essere umano incontrato casualmente sui marciapiedi della città. Uno scambio di fiducia. Un gigantesco specchio della città, ecco cosa è e cosa troverete nel Libro di Umani a Milano.

back to index

2. Progetto Editoriale

 

Formato volume:  20 cm x 20 cm

Copertina in brossura con alette, carta patinata e plastificata opaca

Rilegatura filo rete cucita più resistente e adatta ad un libro illustrato.

Oltre 200 pagine, fotografie su carta patinata opaca da 150gr

Dorso circa 15 mm

 

Ecco alcune foto del prototipo

back to index

 

 

back to index

 

back to index

prezzo speciale 25,00 € * + Spedizione **

back to index

 

9. Storia di UAM e precedenti mostre

Visto il successo virale del progetto, Umani a Milano si è costituito in un’associazione senza finalità di lucro, che nello statuto ha, come finalità: 

“ (…) promuovere e diffondere la cultura del rispetto del territorio e dei diritti della persona. A tal scopo si attiva per raccogliere e promuovere storie personali di persone incontrate sul territorio di Milano e organizzare dibattiti, incontri e performance con la popolazione, iniziative di formazione e informazione pubblica.”

Precedenti mostre ed iniziative sul territorio

Umani a Milano è uscito dal web molto presto per confrontarsi con la realtà che rappresenta. Lo fa con mostre, installazioni e iniziative autofinanziate, in sedi e di concerto con partner e soggetti più vari.

  • Dal 16 Settembre 2015 al 10 Gennaio 2016 la grande mostra nello spazio pubblico della nuova Darsena di Milano, con il patrocinio del Comune di Milano, il supporto del nostri sostenitori attraverso la campagna di #crowdfunding e la sponsorizzazione di Levi's

  • Il 27 maggio 2014 UAM presenta un’installazione presso l’Università Commerciale Bocconi, nell’ingresso della nuova sede di via Roetgen. 

  • Il 22 giugno 2014 UAM ha mostrato le storie che sta raccogliendo a Niguarda, presso il Circolo culturale Cromotaranta, in collaborazione con il Consiglio di Zona 9 e l’Ufficio Iniziative e Rapporti con Associazioni Giovanili del Comune di Milano. 

  • Tutto comincia nel gennaio 2014 con la mostra di UAM presso il Santeria, spazio espositivo in zona Lambrate. L’evento ha successo e occupa una pagina del Corriere della Sera attirando ulteriori e diverse attenzioni. 

 

 

back to index

 

10. Stefano D'Andrea 

Bio del curatore del Progetto UAM

 

 

      

 

Stefano D’Andrea. Nato a Milano, dove risiede, nel 1967, si è formato tra Roma, Bologna e New York. Ha insegnato Sociologia della Comunicazione presso l’Università IULM, ed è stato educatore professionale. Ghostwriter e autore radiofonico è anche creatore e conduttore di Gatto Morto. La vita è una pizza è il suo ultimo libro uscito nel febbraio 2015 per Corbaccio. E' web editor per Yahoo! Social Media manager per varie aziende e consulente sulle attività di storytelling per il web.

ENG - Version

"Umani a Milano" | Humans of Milan - The Book

One person a day, one picture a day, one little story a day , that's Umani a Milano. Five minutes of life of a human being accidentally met on the sidewalks of the city. An exchange of trust. To go from the Internet to reality is not so easy but we will do it with this book: 200 and more pages, pictures and stories.

A huge mirror of the city. We're just a happy storytellers .

 

Stefano D'Andrea Humans of Milan's Curator

Stefano D'Andrea. Born 1967 in Milan, where he lives, growe up also in Rome, Bologna and New York. He taught Sociology of Communication at IULM University, and has been a professional educator . Ghostwriter and author for the radio he is also the creator and host of Gatto Morto. La vita è una pizza is his latest book, released in February 2015, ed. Corbaccio. He is web editor for Yahoo! Social Media manager for various companies, he’s a consultant on storytelling.

story:
What is BORDES? / ¿Qué es BORDES?

We are a very diverse group of people who believe in art and culture as means to develop a plural society. 

BORDES is a nonprofit organization located in San Cristóbal, a small city, on the Venezuelan border with Colombia, in the north of South America.  BORDES is also the name of our annual gathering: festival/conference. 

Somos un diverso grupo de personas quienes creemos en la cultura y el arte como medio para construir una sociedad más plural. 

BORDES es  una organización sin fines de lucro que funciona en San Cristóbal, una pequeña ciudad en la frontera venezolana con Colombia, en el norte de Suramérica. BORDES también es el nombre de nuestro encuentro anual, un festival/seminario en torno a las artes y estudios culturales.


Our goal: cultivating arts and humanities, in an indifferent or sometimes downright hostile environment, where everyone speaks only of violence and economic crisis.


Nuestra meta: cultivar las artes y humanidades, en un ambiente indiferente o a veces hostil, donde solo se habla de violencia y de crisis económica.

Art, humanities and creativity promotion may not be heroic, but we believe that these small and constant activities result in valuable outcomes that contribute significantly towards social change, daily building the country and the world that we want and we know is possible. While others promise salvation of the country through political or economic measures, we continue working, nonstop, because we believe in what we do and it is the top priority for us. 

El arte, las humanidades y la promoción cultural puede que no sean heroicas, pero creemos que estas actividades constantes tienen un resultado valioso, y que contribuimos significativamente con el cambio social, construyendo cotidianamente la región y el país que queremos. Mientras otros prometen salvar al país a través de medidas políticas o económicas, nosotros seguimos trabajando sin parar, porque creemos en lo que hacemos y para nosotros es prioridad. 

In a town where there are no official institutes for formal education in arts, we have developed a network for creative learning; bringing artists and scholars, organizing workshops, conferences, seminars, where artists share their experience with the community. Collaborative projects have arisen from these encounters, with individuals and groups who work in other parts of the country or the world. We are never the same after these exchanges, which deeply enrich our lives. We want other people to live what we are experiencing; these continued transforming opportunities. 

En un lugar donde no tenemos institutos formales de educación en arte, nosotros hemos construido una red de formación, traemos talleristas, grandes artistas y otros estudiantes y aficionados, a compartir con nosotros sus experiencias. Hemos realizado a partir de estos encuentros proyectos conjuntos, con personas dentro y fuera del país. Y no somos los mismos después de haber vivido estos intercambios que nos enriquecen. Queremos que otras personas sigan teniendo esta oportunidad de transformación.

Why support us? / ¿Por qué apoyar este proyecto?

BORDES is in danger of extinction.

Previous editions of the BORDES Conference have been accomplished with small financial backing but huge efforts. It has been hard to do, but not impossible.

Now, Venezuela´s economic crisis is playing against us, and for the first time we are facing the risk of letting this event disappear.

BORDES está en peligro de extinción. 

En las ediciones anteriores del Seminario hemos logrado realizar un evento de esta magnitud con mucho esfuerzo y poco dinero. Era difícil hacerlo, pero no imposible.

Ahora la situación económica de Venezuela juega en contra de nosotros y por primera vez sentimos que corremos el riesgo de que este evento desaparezca.

Many people haven't heard of it, but for us, it is important that this project survives and makes it through not only by seven, but many more editions. We want other people, like us, to fall in love with this project and what it stands for in our community.

Muchas personas no lo conocen, pero para nosotros es importante que sobreviva y se mantenga no solo por siete sino por muchos años más. Queremos que otras personas, al igual que nosotros, se enamoren de este proyecto y de lo que representa para nuestra comunidad.


For us, giving up is not an option; this is why we come to you, asking for help, to keep giving opportunities to people who may learn to see beyond crisis and difficulties, and begin to enjoy and learn through art.

Para nosotros, rendirse no es opción; es por eso que acudimos a ustedes para que nos ayuden a seguir dándole una oportunidad a las personas de ver más allá de las dificultades y puedan disfrutar y aprender a través del arte.


Where does the money go? / ¿A dónde va el dinero?

The organization of an international festival where we host conferences, workshops and different artistic presentations, is very expensive.

La organización de un evento internacional donde tenemos conferencias, talleres y presentaciones artísticas de distintas disciplinas, conlleva muchos gastos.


Since we started this project in 2010, we have always prided ourselves in giving a warm greeting to every guest and attendant. We work to provide food and housing for four days, for approximately 500 people (growing every time). 

Technical assistance includes: 

  • Sound amplification
  • Illumination 
  • Scenography
  • Paint, strings, nails, glue, etc. 
  • Video projectors for cinema, video art presentations and lectures.
  • Creating an artistic catalog, posters and other design material is part of the job.

Desde que empezamos este proyecto en 2010 nos hemos caracterizado por brindarle una cálida atención a todos nuestros invitados y a los participantes. Nos preocupamos por ofrecerles hidratación, alimentación e incluso hospedaje durante cuatro días; todo esto para una cantidad de aproximadamente 500 personas que sigue aumentando cada año. 

La asistencia técnica adecuada incluye: 

  • Equipos de amplificación de sonido 
  • Iluminación 
  • Escenografía para los artistas escénicos 
  • Pintura, clavos, hilo, madera
  • Se requieren muchos proyectores y reproductores de video para  cine y video arte, para las conferencias.
  • El diseño de un catálogo artístico, afiches y otros materiales gráficos es parte de un buen trabajo.

Donations will not only be destined to the execution of our 6th BORDES Seminar. We could use extra funds in the 7th edition in 2016 as well as the consolidation of permanent activities such as our website and other means of publishing the results of all the hard work and sharing it with the world. 

El dinero recaudado no sólo será destinado a la ejecución del VI Seminario Bordes, sino que cualquier monto extra lo invertiríamos en la VII edición del 2016, en las actividades permanentes (talleres de danza, teatro, cine, radio, literatura), así como en la publicación de nuestra experiencia, para compartir los resultados del trabajo con el mundo entero.

Borders, limits, frontiers, can be seen as barriers that separate differents...

BORDES for us, is that in between space, where lines fuse and mingle, where differences merge, and creative cooperation with another is posible.

Bordes, límites, fronteras, pueden ser vistas como barreras que separan bandos diferentes.

BORDES para nosotros es ese espacio intermedio, donde las líneas se borran y entremezclan, donde las diferencias convergen y se vuelve posible la creación cooperativa con el Otro.

Borders, limits, frontiers, can be seen as barriers that separate differents...
BORDES for us, is that in between space, where lines fuse and mingle, where differences merge, and creative cooperation with another is posible.
Bordes, límites, fronteras, pueden ser vistas como barreras que separan bandos diferentes.
BORDES para nosotros es ese espacio intermedio, donde las líneas se borran y entremezclan, donde las diferencias convergen y se vuelve posible la creación cooperativa con el Otro.

story:
Bring Bandwidth to Lumens!

Lumens Festival, located in Staten Island NY, has invited me to exhibit my work Bandwidth: Interactive Installation on June 23, 2012.

Unfortunately, the festival does not have funds to support the artists presentations. Now I need to raise the funds to fly from my home in Vancouver, Canada, stay in NYC, rent equipment for the presentation, take ground transportation to the island with equipment and continue to pay my bills at home. Oh, and a place to sleep and meals too.

I estimate it will cost approximately $1600. to accomplish everything I need to do to have a great show.

Please support this fun art project so that the audience attending the festival can "dance" the abstract objects to the music.

Bandwidth: Interactive Installation

Projected abstract images, controlled with hand gestures, dance to original music. Advanced technology makes it easy for audience members of all ages and ability levels to create a new version of the visual work, inspired by their own imagination.

Bandwidth is a projection art exhibit displayed on three surfaces -- at the Lumens festival the projections may be as large as the side of a building for outside audiences. The audio component may be reproduced in stereo with a subwoofer if funds are available.

The exhibit blurs the lines of definition between installation, video game and performance as three visual components are each controlled by gesture. One element on each screen automatically dances to specific frequencies in the music, but one element per screen must be user controlled. This makes for an excellent audience participation work as 3 participants per performance are invited to control the size, shape or movement of one of the visual elements to create a unique performance.

As an Integrated Media Artist, with core training as a composer and performer of music, Victoria Gibson created the music and the visual accompaniment. An experienced facilitator, she encourages individuals to work in “Practice mode” to become comfortable with the interaction. Then she starts the music to begin the performance.

Bandwidth was shown in 2010 as a work-in-progress at EMPAC Center, Troy,NY and premiered as part of the Nuit Blanche, 2011 Guelph Jazz Festival, Ontario, Canada. It would be wonderful to share this interactive installation with the people of NY on Staten Island on June 23rd, 2012.

Short films of the performances are available on Vimeo

Guelph http://vimeo.com/35085077

EMPAC http://vimeo.com/25854039

More information can be found on Victoria's portfolio site:

http://www.livemorelightly.com/portfolio/2011/08/01/bandwidth/

NEW YORK CITY RESIDENTS -- come to the show!

You can also help if you can lend me a sound system or a projector, invite me for dinner or just tell all your friends!

All rights reserved – copyright Victoria Gibson 2010

story:
The Exchanghibition Bank needs your bailout!

"When Bankers get together for dinner they discuss Art. When artists get together for dinner, they discuss money" - Oscar Wilde


November 2009 I destroyed my most recent project (Checkpoint Dreamyourtopia - a border control checkpoint to enter your own Dreams) with chainsaws and sledgehammers in an old swimming pool in Berlin. That day we tore down the walls between Dreams and Reality, exactly twenty years after the Berlin Wall came down. As always, a new Dream is only a Reality away and the Exchanghibition Bank will be the first step in realizing a new Dream!

Do you remember the image of Scrooge Duck diving into his money? Wealth and material accumulation once provided a happy image to children around the world, but have become increasingly dystopian and suspicious in recent times. Financial crisis has removed the pot of gold awaiting us at the end of the rainbow.  Even though the fantasy of riches has gotten ever more distasteful, can you still resist a swim in a pool filled with money?

                     

And that will be my new art project: a pool filled with millions of money bills, bundled in stacks. A closer look at the pool will reveal that the bills in the pool are not real money, but pieces of aesthetically pleasing art. During today's financial crisis, art has been frequently cited as an advantageous alternative asset class and diamond encrusted skulls and Picasso's go for over one hundred million.

As the participants will strip down to enter in a pool of artful riches, they'll realize it's strictly forbidden and enforced by security guards to take even one bill back home.

The pool itself will be built at the Burning Man festival in Nevada. That festival is a temporary city (Black Rock City), built in the Nevada desert, based on a gift-economy. In Black Rock City, a city that functions without money, a Fort Knox like vault will hopefully challenge the assumptions and relationships participants have with money, and art.


No real bank will finance this project, so I'll start my own bank; the Exchanghibition Bank, which will hopefully help this dream come true. The Bank itself will be a specially designed exchange booth and will travel to different places. People can buy or rather exchange their money for the specially designed art bills  and a bill with denomination zero might become worth more than a bill with a value of a hundred thousand.


This way we can start raising some money to fill the pool and at the same time establish an exchange rate for the bills.  This exchange rate will eventually also result in a very interesting total value for all the bills in the pool project, which might propel the installation itself into the multi-million dollar elite league of art. Which means it's a great work of art, right?

And of course this bank won't get a bailout from the Government, so we need you!

Let's swim in our fantasy while others drown in their reality ! The Money raised with this campaign will make sure the bank booth can be built, banker costumes can be made and money/art bills can be printed, and , NO, no money left over will disappear in greedy bankers' pockets, but will be used to start filling up the pool!

Building a huge interactive project in the Nevada desert as an artist from Amsterdam will provide more than the usual challenges. Therefore I am happy that Nimby in Oakland offered me working space, which could become the very needed 'Home away from Home', with an infrastructure that's already in place. Hopefully the money raised might also enable me to fly to San Francisco to connect in real life with those who offered help through the internet and set up the beginnings of the Exchanghibition Bank Headquarters.

After all: "Money alone won't make Dreams come true but it sure helps!"

(quote from the Dreamyourtopia dream currency as shown below)

story:
The Story

Jolie is an international exchange student from New York, studying art in Paris, France.  The year is almost up on my visa and I am not in the midst of remigrating back home to the United States in order to finish my studies and obtain my degree in Art Education K-12.  

Your contribution will create another educational figure in the world for your children to learn from and grow with.  By helping Jolie come back to New York, she'll be able to complete her education and eventually go on to educate others after. 

What We Need & What You Get

A basic plane ticket in August runs from 700-1000$.  Every dollar counts.  The suggested donation is 10$ for which you will receive one of two Buddha prints created in Paris and mailed directly to you from France.

The prints are approx. 11cmx16cm thats 4.33”x6.29” for us Americans.
There are two colors to choose from Black or Red or Both for the Tree Meditation Print.
Each print you receive is made upon request and production will stop at 100 for each block.


Other Ways You Can Help

Send this campaign to your friends or anyone who might be interested in purchasing art to help an art student complete her degree.

Parinirvana Print



Meditation Print

story:
Painting the North

North to Norway, by way of east and then west. 

I am Claudia Massie, a Scottish artist, and during July I will be traveling to the Radøy Kunstsenter in Norway to undertake my second artist residency there. To get there, I will take my trusty VW Touran car by sea from Newcastle to Holland and then tour onwards through Germany, Denmark and Sweden before crossing the Norwegian interior to arrive at Radøy. My destination is an island on the west coast of Norway, a little north of Bergen and not so very far from Shetland.

I am taking the long way round, the scenic route, the road less traveled so that I can explore and draw and paint these northern regions of Europe. Every day will be recorded in paint, ink and pencil.


What I Need & What You Get

This will be an adventure, but it won't be as romantically free of cost as I might wish. The Norwegian government has allocated me a grant which will cover the cost of my stay in Norway but I still need to pay for travel, board and sustenance elsewhere.

  • Return ferry, Newcastle - Ijmuilen, Netherlands: £590
  • I'll be driving something in the region of 3000 miles in total which, according to the michelin website, should cost around £600 in diesel.
  • Accommodation and food: free camping will only take me so far, not least because it is illegal in some of the countries I will pass through: £50 some days, £0 others... Plus contingency funds for sudden engine collapse and so on.
  • Art materials! Lots of paint and plenty pencils needed to produce a stack  of work every day: £100.
STRETCH GOAL: The response to 'Painting the North' has been amazing and I am thrilled and astonished to have achieved my target so early in the campaign. I am creating an additional 'stretch' goal of £1200 which any further contributions will go towards. These funds will be used to buy more materials and pay for framing in preparation for an exhibition of the work resulting from this expedition. The same perks apply, of course. 

Perks: your reward for helping

In exchange for helping to fund campaign, I am offering a range of perks from postcards, drawings and plein air acrylic studies to finished, framed oil paintings. This is a chance to acquire some unique, handmade and original artworks, some of which will be mailed direct from locations along my journey.


The Impact

I worked at the Radøy Kunstsenter in Norway last year and it was just tremendous. The experience of painting an entirely new landscape was invigorating and I produced work which seemed to have an increased fluency and vision. I relish the opportunity to extend this process during an ambitious road trip through a variety of northern European landscape and cultures.

I am in discussion with a prominent gallery about a solo exhibition of the work produced from this trip. It is a great gallery but they need to see the goods before they can commit fully, and I need to produce them. You can help!


Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't help financially, and even if you can, please consider spreading the word about this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
the Unsung : Vignettes and Voicings

I’m Regan.  This campaign will fund a project in the South Atlantic states of the US : a region that is a source of inspiration for me.  I received a scholarship to attend a two-week photography intensive this July at Penland School in North Carolina.  When I began setting aside resources for the journey, I saw an opportunity to take my work farther.

Following Penland, I will embark upon a seven-day ‘mobile residency’.  My route will take me through Charleston and Savannah and sites along the way.  I will document with photography, audio and video recordings.  I am requesting  financial aid for the significant costs not covered by the scholarship and to support the residency. 

***

The camera and the microphone are my mediums.  I find that in solitary singing, my voice sheds inhibition and resonates something deeply honest.  The recording process allows me to edit these voicings into songs.  

And what is a story without pictures?  When used skillfully, the lens magnifies the poignancies of it’s subject and tells a story in a single frame.  I listen for the voices of ghosts, the things that haunt; the unsung, unarticulated and chaotic. In these is a quality of authenticity that I long for.  

***

Each day of the residency, i will scout a different site to serve as a studio-laboratory.

My investigations during this excursion will focus on  :

I.  Framing and the inhabitation of space.

II. Thresholds or the gateways that bridge a one with an-other.

                         and 

III. Songs as mythologies imbedded in a place.


At journey's end, I will have compiled a series of photographs, audio recordings and film clips of these investigations that will become part of a larger body of work :  'The Unsung' (a picture/album).

***

Expenses for this phase of work total  $3,300.  All funding will help off-set these costs and enable manifestation of 'The Unsung' body.  I have chosen the most budget-conscious options whenever possible.

Let us not impoverish ourselves by relegating the arts to elite professional
                                                   hinterlands.

          

                                  Thank you for your support.
