story:
ANTARES, Scarlet Haïku.

This book is an important step, this is my really first self-project to be published.

Antares is a special concept. It's mainly an Illustration book, but the project follows also 2 rules: The Haïku and the color Red. 
Below you can find a short explanation about it.
50 illustrations in color on double pages, with a Haïku linked to each.
The main technic is watercolors/colored inks, black ink and pencil, sometimes some discreet acrylics
The texts on each illustration are in French, but you will find the English translations at the end of the book. 


  1. The Haïku is a very short form of Japanese poetry to say the evanescence of things, composed of 17 syllabes, declined in 5-7-5. 
  2. Antares is the red star in the constellation Scorpius, and it is also its Hearth. Scarlet is a one of the red colors sounding really nice in French.             In each Illustration you'll find the red appearing.

If you are curious about the painting style, you can have a look to my Facebook page, I posted many sneak peeks since I started to work on this project.
Helcanen

The investment:

The amount will cover the production of 100 books, A4 size in full color.
Any extra to this amount will be used:

  • to print some extras goods (postcards, posters, or reproductions for all perks with the book)
  • to produce more books 
  • to buy new painting material for a new project.
And
  • to print promotion for the project (flyers, posters, roll-up, or anything possible in the budget)


What you get:

  • The basic perk includes the printed A4 book. 
  • The perk Antares book + 1 illustration:
    The book  + 1 real illustration I will paint for you only. So, it will be a unique piece, that you won't find in the book. 
    You can tell me your favourite color(s) as a guide line. 
And of course, your name mentioned in the book ("thanks"), unless you don't want to ;)


Shipping:

* The book can be given hand-to-hand during a concert, the MFVF, a convention, a trip, etc... there are no additional costs in that case.
* The book can be shipped worldwide, but unfortunately the Postal rates in Belgium are quite expensive. The shipping costs will be added by Indiegogo on the perk mentioning "shipping" following your country. The rates are for normal sending, not secured. If you wish a secured shipping, please contact me.
*There is no "shipping" option for the perk with the illustration as it's not secured pack. If you wish it to be shipped anyway, contact me by e-mail to fix the rates helcanen (at) gmail.com 
* If you are not sure yet about the shipping, you can select the normal perk without shipping and contact me later to see if we can meet at any event or not. No worries, the shipping costs can be paid apart, after the campaign.

Any help is welcome

Every euros counts! If you just want to support my work, any little help is welcome.
5€ help, and you will receive a thanks postcard at your home ;)

If you can't help financially, you can support this project by sharing it on social networks. This will be greatly appreciated too!
story_txt:
ANTARES, Scarlet Haïku.


This book is an important step, this is my really first self-project to be published.Antares is a special concept. It's mainly an Illustration book, but the project follows also 2 rules: The Haïku and the color Red. 

Below you can find a short explanation about it.50 illustrations in color on double pages, with a Haïku linked to each. The main technic is watercolors/colored inks, black ink and pencil, sometimes some discreet acrylicsThe texts on each illustration are in French, but you will find the English translations at the end of the book. 


The Haïku is a very short form of Japanese poetry to say the evanescence of things, composed of 17 syllabes, declined in 5-7-5. 


Antares is the red star in the constellation Scorpius, and it is also its Hearth. Scarlet is a one of the red colors sounding really nice in French.             In each Illustration you'll find the red appearing.




If you are curious about the painting style, you can have a look to my Facebook page, I posted many sneak peeks since I started to work on this project.Helcanen

The investment:
The amount will cover the production of 100 books, A4 size in full color.Any extra to this amount will be used:


to print some extras goods (postcards, posters, or reproductions for all perks with the book)


to produce more books 


to buy new painting material for a new project.


And

to print promotion for the project (flyers, posters, roll-up, or anything possible in the budget)



What you get:
The basic perk includes the printed A4 book. 

The perk Antares book + 1 illustration:The book  + 1 real illustration I will paint for you only. So, it will be a unique piece, that you won't find in the book. You can tell me your favourite color(s) as a guide line. 

And of course, your name mentioned in the book ("thanks"), unless you don't want to ;)




Shipping:* The book can be given hand-to-hand during a concert, the MFVF, a convention, a trip, etc... there are no additional costs in that case.* The book can be shipped worldwide, but unfortunately the Postal rates in Belgium are quite expensive. The shipping costs will be added by Indiegogo on the perk mentioning "shipping" following your country. The rates are for normal sending, not secured. If you wish a secured shipping, please contact me.*There is no "shipping" option for the perk with the illustration as it's not secured pack. If you wish it to be shipped anyway, contact me by e-mail to fix the rates helcanen (at) gmail.com * If you are not sure yet about the shipping, you can select the normal perk without shipping and contact me later to see if we can meet at any event or not. No worries, the shipping costs can be paid apart, after the campaign.



Any help is welcome
Every euros counts! If you just want to support my work, any little help is welcome.5€ help, and you will receive a thanks postcard at your home ;)
If you can't help financially, you can support this project by sharing it on social networks. This will be greatly appreciated too!

story:
Get out your phones and get ready for some paper-flinging fun! It's the Go to the Whistle Stop Gallery... Man... game.

Now for the really, really short version.

The world needs art. You’re part of the world. You need art. So, you need artists. Artists need to succeed to create the art you need. Help me help artists succeed.

Back my campaign. You get cheap cool stuff, artists get cheap cool stuff. Help me get to my goal, and you get free cool stuff. Help me get more than my goal, and both you and artists get free cool stuff.

That’s pretty much it.

I wish you’d read the long version though. It’s a lot more fun.

Follow the Whistle Stop Gallery on Twitter and like us on Facebook!

How does this help artists?

Entering art shows can get expensive real quick. I’d like to change that. I want to charge $5 (USD) per accepted work – not submitted, accepted. Trust me, it’s a big deal. The Whistle Stop Gallery also takes no commissions on sales from the web Shows. That’s a big deal too. Like what you’re seeing? Read on!

My website is all set for the next 10 years! Well, the hosting and the domains are. All I have to do is to write it and run it. That shouldn’t be too hard, right? And it only cost me $1436! Well, that’s not really only to me, no matter how many times the salesperson says it’s a ‘good deal’. Their ‘good deal’ is almost 2 months of expenses to me. This is where you come in. I’d like at least 1436 of you reading this to chip in $1.

What do you get out of it? You get to finish a sentence. Not just any sentence… a really special one. Why do you care? Because your name will appear with it, at the bottom of the main website, for at least the next 10 years. Of course, only one will display at a time – otherwise the page would get kind of long. Each will have an opportunity to display in a random fashion. Each sentence will also appear in The Big List (yes, I named it The Big List), which is a list of all the quotes. It’s your chance to be famous… well, sort of. No, I don’t get many visitors right now, but your $1 will help me concentrate on that.

You never know what the future holds. This one sentence of yours might result in fame and fortune. Probably not, but we can dream, right? Your words will inspire artists – that I can promise. Plus, you get to share your thoughts with everyone who visits my site. As long as I approve them, anyway. I know you’re thinking “riiight, he’s going to post what I have to say.” I really will, as long as it’s family-friendly (c’mon, you know what that is). Not hateful, nasty, racist, obscene… you get the idea. Oh, and I might have to discuss shortening it with you, but only if you write extremely long, run on sentences. We’ll need to work together to eradicate spelling and punctuation errors, too.

I do have one more rule: I only speak English. I tried to learn another language – it didn’t go smoothly. I doubt I’d get many Latin submissions, though. I have to be able to read what you wrote. You don’t have to write it in English, but what you give me needs to be. It’s also only fair, since the rest of the site is in English too.

Here’s the mysterious sentence that I’m sure you have a burning desire to know. Here it comes.

Art is:

Yes, that’s it. If you’re serious about it, you’ll have trouble finishing the sentence. If not, you get to dazzle us with your amazing wit. You could even go severely minimalist and put nothing… but I’d rather not get too many of those or it will look like my website is broken.

Still not sure? Really? Can you name one really great reason you shouldn’t? Didn’t think so. Try it! It’ll be fun! Or serious, or meditative, or comedic, or thoughtful…

Your words might even appear in a book someday.

You’ll need to provide me and the Whistle Stop Gallery the right to display the final approved quote for free and forever, as long as it has your name (or whatever name you provided) displayed with it. If a book is ever in the works, you’ll get a request for that specifically.

Really don’t want to be Quoted? Looking for something else? I have other Perks, too!

 

What I need

I already paid the $1436. It includes 8 domains and web hosting. And by paid I mean paying little bits each month, with interest. You see where I’m heading. I really need that money for other expenses, like taxes.

My goal is to start offering at least 2 web Shows a year that artists can submit to, starting with a show later this year. And of course to get the rest of the website running smoothly, which is mostly done.

 

Stretch Goals

  • $250 more than my goal: The next Best of Show award becomes $250, instead of $50 like I originally planned. This would be for the Whistle Stop Gallery Winter*16 web Show.

  • $1000 more: Winter*16 becomes free for artists. No fees to submit, no fees to be in the show. And I’ll award a $250 Best of Show. How’s that sound?

  • $5000 – the next 4 web Shows after Winter*16 get the same treatment!

  • $10,000 – 4 more web Shows get the same treatment. This would be incredible!

  • $100,000 – Oh my! Didn’t expect that. Is that some kind of record? Uhh… I know! EVERY web Show for the Whistle Stop Gallery becomes free starting with Winter*16, with a $250 Best of Show prize awarded in each!

 

What you get:

Everybody who backs this campaign gets a badge! Show off your support for the arts - back this campaign at any level and you get a nifty badge image.

I’m offering another really special gift to all Quoted Project supporters. If I reach my goal, every backer gets an artsy photo taken especially for them. I’ll send each of you a file that you can print, use in and for ‘stuff’, and pretty much anything (other than selling the file to someone else, because you got it for free). I enjoy photography, but don’t get much chance.

Give me an excuse to take a few thousand photos! Get this campaign through its goal!

 

  • Quoted. For $1 you get to be Quoted and have it displayed on my website with your name, as I described earlier. Missed it? Go back and read it again – make sure you read the rules.

  • You want a thank you, too? For $2 you can be Quoted and I’ll post a personal thank you @1938State on Twitter and Facebook.

  • "But I don’t LIKE writing!" If you REALLY can’t come up with anything to say, for $3 I can write a Quote for you, and it becomes yours. You have to pick the subject though. You can choose intellectual, serious, funny, weird, or art-specific. Can’t decide? Too bad. If I’m writing it for you, you at least need to pick. If you’d like to modify the Quote to suit your taste, I can do that too.

  • Enjoy a card now and then? For $5 I’ll draw a card, personalize it, and send it to you. I’m covering the shipping for the card.

  • Like puzzles? For $10 I’ll create, personalize, and send you a hand drawn card, and I’ll make you one of my fun hand-drawn paper puzzles too! The puzzle comes in the card. I’m covering the shipping.

  • You’re an artist? Well maybe you’d like a Joseph’s ReMedia™ or Joseph’s ReSurface™ artist’s panel! Artist meet Joseph’s ReMedia(tm) - the gesso-coated Artist’s Panel made of plastics destined for the landfill. You don’t want canvas on a surface, you want a Joseph’s ReSurface(tm). The panel’s reused plastics make a perfect backing for new primed canvas. It’s your choice, either one, in portrait or landscape format. The panel is paired with a frame and hanging hardware. It also includes an opportunity to display your finished work. Normally I charge shipping for these, but right now there is absolutely no shipping cost. Get one today for only $15!

  • Your Quote deserves more. For just $20 get an original Joseph A. Langley typography design of your Quote. As an added bonus, commercial use is included! That means you can even print it on t-shirts, cards, etc. and sell them! You also get the source file. I’ve added a few examples of my typography work.




  • Need a little extra security? For $25 get 100 sheets (yes, a hundred sheets) of my ReSecure™ paper. I draw on old catalog pages with marker. I can’t guarantee it will be completely secure, but I can guarantee it’s an improvement over not using any! Each sheet is about 8.25 inches by 10.25 inches. Once again, I’m covering shipping.

  • The Web Tour: Want a tour of the Gallery’s web home? For only $30 you get a tour of the website. After that, I’ll answer up to 50 of your questions about it – as long as you don’t ask me to reveal the security, which I won’t do. Sorry web vandals, no secrets for you. I’ll also give you special early information for a whole year about what’s going on with the site, before the public can see it. That includes new content and upcoming shows. Nosy people take notice!

  • Like the Quoted logo? For only $35 you get the graphite idea sketch of the Quoted project logo! It’s signed, too. I’ll mat and frame it, so it’s ready to display! Wouldn’t you like to own the only one? Get it before someone else does! Shipping is included in the $35, by the way.

  • Participate and be named! For $50 you get to help me test the website. I’ll tell you what I expect – it’s nothing more than using the site and telling me about it in plain language. I’ll thank you personally on the site for your work, and write you a reference letter. You also get to provide a link for me to display, subject to approval. It must be family friendly. No link farms or spam pages either. Applying for a job soon? Note: I can't give you the reference letter until you actually do the testing.

  • Like artwork? Like free shipping? Like great deals? Well, here’s one for you! My selling price for 8x10 inch paintings is $135 framed. I have two listed on my personal shop right now for exactly that price, and there’s also a shipping charge. If a few of you will help me out, I’ll paint a new 8x10, frame it, and ship it to you for only $75! You don’t have to pay shipping, and you’re getting it for $60 cheaper!

  • Art for all seasons. For $100 get this amazing photo set. I chose these four photos of mine to represent the four seasons. Only two sets were made. Display them all, or change them each season for your own mini one-work gallery! They’re printed at 8 inches by 10 inches (landscape) on aluminum with rounded corners. Four mounting blocks and a storage box are included! I’ll be covering the shipping.

  • The Gallery Tour: Maybe you really want to see the Gallery in person. It isn’t open to the public right now, but for $250 you get to visit the Whistle Stop Gallery’s Granite City home. Step inside, hear about the history of the building and what I know about the area, and about what I’m trying to do! You also get to TAKE HOME a piece of the Gallery with you! The building’s old brick, and some of it is damaged. I save the pieces, which get turned into original paintings by local artists. I’ll give it to you while you’re here. Feel free to take photos if you want, too. You also get a map of downtown points of interest, and a list of city-wide points of interest. THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE YOUR TRAVEL AND LODGING; YOU MUST GET HERE ON YOUR OWN. The Gallery is located in Granite City, Illinois, 62040, USA. I’ll give you the address by email. You MUST work out a time to visit, you cannot just stop by! You may bring one guest.

  • The Gallery Tour - remotely: (also $250) Can’t make it to Granite City, Illinois but still want to see it? I’ll record a video tour for you and send it to you. You can also ask questions after and I’ll send you a video with responses. You also get a piece of the Gallery with an original painting on it! I’ll have to ship the art to you, so I have to limit where I can send it. Due to this being a larger contribution, I can do some (but not all) international shipping while just covering the cost. You also get the map and points of interest too, if you make it to Granite City in the future. If you don’t see your home country and want this Perk, contact me and I’ll personally check to see if it’s possible.

 

Risks and challenges

I’m writing the site myself, so there’s a small chance the randomizer won’t work well at first. It will work, even if I have to use the ugliest code imaginable. But I’m very confident it will work nicely, especially since I finally gave in and agreed to use a database. The Big List is a simple page, so there’s not much that can go wrong there. There’s a tiny possibility that your Quote might end up with a typo, but I’d be more than happy to fix it. I’m really stubborn and persistent, so if it’s between me and the server, the server loses. Seriously, I prepared in advance. The major parts of the new site are already operating. This is a really cool addition to an operating website.

It’s also hard to get people to visit the website. One of the reasons for this campaign is to use everything I can to get the word out in new and different ways. Hey, you’re looking, right? I’ve got other really great ideas that I can’t concentrate on right now, but your contribution could change that.

 

Other ways you can help

If you absolutely, positively can’t spare a dollar, you could share this campaign with others. Of course, it doesn’t really help if you tell people not to participate, but I think you already know that. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Visit the Whistle Stop Gallery website, too. Know any artists? Tell them how much you like the Whistle Stop Gallery! Share this with friends and followers, many or few. You might try #art_is, #WhistleStopGallery, and #QuotedProject!

If you think of something else, great! Get in touch – I’d like to hear from you.

 

Questions and Answers

Are you NOT displaying the quotes if you DON’T get all the money?

It doesn’t matter how many I get, every one that follows my rules will be displayed as I’ve described. If yours is the only one, it will be displayed every time, but please don’t prevent other people from participating – contact me for other opportunities instead of doing that.

I’ve never heard of the Whistle Stop Gallery. Are you new?

No. The Whistle Stop Gallery has been around since our first show in 2008. You’ve just never heard of us until now.

Is the Whistle Stop Gallery only online?

No. There is a physical gallery too, but it’s closed for renovations right now.

Is the Whistle Stop Gallery a commercial gallery?

Yes it is. It’s a for-profit, but its purpose isn’t to make a profit.

Where’s the rest of your staff?

When I told people that I could pay them in thanks and warm wishes, they didn’t want the job. Go figure. Seriously, the Whistle Stop Gallery can’t afford staff. I don’t even get paid yet.

I see you’re giving away art as perks. Who’s the artist?

That would be me. Would you like to offer something too? Contact me and we’ll discuss it.

Is whistlestop-gallery.com going to disappear if you aren’t fully funded?

No. It’s been around since 2007, and it’s not going anywhere, especially since it’s already paid for.

Do I have to be an artist to participate?

Definitely not. I’d really like to hear from everyone, artists, art lovers, and even art haters too!

How long will it be before my quote appears on the website?

Hmmm. Well, I work on the website by hand – with the keyboard. And fingers. So, your quote should show up in the Big List within a week (unless something goes wrong). The randomizer isn’t done yet, but as soon as it is I’ll start loading the quotes in there too. If you’d like updates by email, contact me and let me know. I can let you know when yours is posted too.

I’ll be keeping offline backups too, so the worst that could happen is that I have to (sigh) retype each one.

The basics of the new website are already in place. Soon, you’ll be able to find The Big List by visiting whistlestop-gallery.com/project and clicking on Quoted.

Where exactly will the quotes be?

Each one will be on The Big List. Visit the Whistle Stop Gallery Project Directory at www.whistlestop-gallery.com/project and click on Quoted. Visit whistlestop-gallery.com/site to see a random single quote.

What if you get more than 1436 quotes? Will some not display?

All of the quotes will appear in The Big List, and all of them will be available to the randomizer, no matter how many or how few I get.

Can I put something else instead of my name, like a website?

I’d really like your name. If you’d rather not, I can put anonymous instead. But no, you can’t put advertisements in there, like a website. If it’s advertisement you’re looking for, I may have something else for you. Check out my other Perks. You can also contact me.

My name is too big. What do I do?

Wow. Your name is more than 255 characters? I guess I’ll have to modify the randomizer backend. Until then, it will still be in The Big List.

My quote is too big. What do I do?

That’s a pretty long quote. Let’s review it and I’ll decide if it needs to be shorter, or if the randomizer needs to be modified for longer lengths.

Do I have to put my name?

You can be anonymous, or only use a first or last name or a nickname if you want. Pen names work too.

How can I contact you?

You can contact me on this site directly, or via my form on the Whistle Stop Gallery website. You can even mail me a letter – the address is on the Whistle Stop Gallery Site too. If you’re using the Whistle Stop Gallery form, please remember it’s not a secure form, so don’t put bank or credit card stuff in there. If you’re having trouble getting a hold of me, you can reach out to Indiegogo too – they can get in touch as well.

How much will it cost to ship my Perk?

It doesn’t. I pay the shipping. If it can be shipped to your address, the shipping's free.

Why do some of the Perks only ship to the United States?

I can offer better Perks that way. Have an idea of how I can ship Perks internationally without outrageous shipping costs? Contact me and tell me about it!

Why do you keep capitalizing Show and Shows?

It’s a part of the Whistle Stop Gallery website. It’s divided into Shows, Galleries, Projects, and Proposals. And last but not least the main Site, which displays the randomized quotes. That’s why Site is sometimes capitalized too - it’s the Site section of the Whistle Stop Gallery website. Confused yet?

That means you can even print it on t-shirts, cards, etc. and sell them! You also get the source file. I’ve added a few examples of my typography work.

Need a little extra security? For $25 get 100 sheets (yes, a hundred sheets) of my ReSecure™ paper. I draw on old catalog pages with marker. I can’t guarantee it will be completely secure, but I can guarantee it’s an improvement over not using any! Each sheet is about 8.25 inches by 10.25 inches. Once again, I’m covering shipping.


The Web Tour: Want a tour of the Gallery’s web home? For only $30 you get a tour of the website. After that, I’ll answer up to 50 of your questions about it – as long as you don’t ask me to reveal the security, which I won’t do. Sorry web vandals, no secrets for you. I’ll also give you special early information for a whole year about what’s going on with the site, before the public can see it. That includes new content and upcoming shows. Nosy people take notice!
Like the Quoted logo? For only $35 you get the graphite idea sketch of the Quoted project logo! It’s signed, too. I’ll mat and frame it, so it’s ready to display! Wouldn’t you like to own the only one? Get it before someone else does! Shipping is included in the $35, by the way.
Participate and be named! For $50 you get to help me test the website. I’ll tell you what I expect – it’s nothing more than using the site and telling me about it in plain language. I’ll thank you personally on the site for your work, and write you a reference letter. You also get to provide a link for me to display, subject to approval. It must be family friendly. No link farms or spam pages either. Applying for a job soon? Note: I can't give you the reference letter until you actually do the testing.
Like artwork? Like free shipping? Like great deals? Well, here’s one for you! My selling price for 8x10 inch paintings is $135 framed. I have two listed on my personal shop right now for exactly that price, and there’s also a shipping charge. If a few of you will help me out, I’ll paint a new 8x10, frame it, and ship it to you for only $75! You don’t have to pay shipping, and you’re getting it for $60 cheaper!
Art for all seasons. For $100 get this amazing photo set. I chose these four photos of mine to represent the four seasons. Only two sets were made. Display them all, or change them each season for your own mini one-work gallery! They’re printed at 8 inches by 10 inches (landscape) on aluminum with rounded corners. Four mounting blocks and a storage box are included! I’ll be covering the shipping.
The Gallery Tour: Maybe you really want to see the Gallery in person. It isn’t open to the public right now, but for $250 you get to visit the Whistle Stop Gallery’s Granite City home. Step inside, hear about the history of the building and what I know about the area, and about what I’m trying to do! You also get to TAKE HOME a piece of the Gallery with you! The building’s old brick, and some of it is damaged. I save the pieces, which get turned into original paintings by local artists. I’ll give it to you while you’re here. Feel free to take photos if you want, too. You also get a map of downtown points of interest, and a list of city-wide points of interest. THIS DOES NOT INCLUDE YOUR TRAVEL AND LODGING; YOU MUST GET HERE ON YOUR OWN. The Gallery is located in Granite City, Illinois, 62040, USA. I’ll give you the address by email. You MUST work out a time to visit, you cannot just stop by! You may bring one guest.
The Gallery Tour - remotely: (also $250) Can’t make it to Granite City, Illinois but still want to see it? I’ll record a video tour for you and send it to you. You can also ask questions after and I’ll send you a video with responses. You also get a piece of the Gallery with an original painting on it! I’ll have to ship the art to you, so I have to limit where I can send it. Due to this being a larger contribution, I can do some (but not all) international shipping while just covering the cost. You also get the map and points of interest too, if you make it to Granite City in the future. If you don’t see your home country and want this Perk, contact me and I’ll personally check to see if it’s possible.
 Risks and challengesI’m writing the site myself, so there’s a small chance the randomizer won’t work well at first. It will work, even if I have to use the ugliest code imaginable. But I’m very confident it will work nicely, especially since I finally gave in and agreed to use a database. The Big List is a simple page, so there’s not much that can go wrong there. There’s a tiny possibility that your Quote might end up with a typo, but I’d be more than happy to fix it. I’m really stubborn and persistent, so if it’s between me and the server, the server loses. Seriously, I prepared in advance. The major parts of the new site are already operating. This is a really cool addition to an operating website.It’s also hard to get people to visit the website. One of the reasons for this campaign is to use everything I can to get the word out in new and different ways. Hey, you’re looking, right? I’ve got other really great ideas that I can’t concentrate on right now, but your contribution could change that. Other ways you can helpIf you absolutely, positively can’t spare a dollar, you could share this campaign with others. Of course, it doesn’t really help if you tell people not to participate, but I think you already know that. Use the Indiegogo share tools! Visit the Whistle Stop Gallery website, too. Know any artists? Tell them how much you like the Whistle Stop Gallery! Share this with friends and followers, many or few. You might try #art_is, #WhistleStopGallery, and #QuotedProject!If you think of something else, great! Get in touch – I’d like to hear from you. Questions and AnswersAre you NOT displaying the quotes if you DON’T get all the money?It doesn’t matter how many I get, every one that follows my rules will be displayed as I’ve described. If yours is the only one, it will be displayed every time, but please don’t prevent other people from participating – contact me for other opportunities instead of doing that.I’ve never heard of the Whistle Stop Gallery. Are you new?No. The Whistle Stop Gallery has been around since our first show in 2008. You’ve just never heard of us until now.Is the Whistle Stop Gallery only online?No. There is a physical gallery too, but it’s closed for renovations right now.Is the Whistle Stop Gallery a commercial gallery?Yes it is. It’s a for-profit, but its purpose isn’t to make a profit.Where’s the rest of your staff?When I told people that I could pay them in thanks and warm wishes, they didn’t want the job. Go figure. Seriously, the Whistle Stop Gallery can’t afford staff. I don’t even get paid yet.I see you’re giving away art as perks. Who’s the artist?That would be me. Would you like to offer something too? Contact me and we’ll discuss it.Is whistlestop-gallery.com going to disappear if you aren’t fully funded?No. It’s been around since 2007, and it’s not going anywhere, especially since it’s already paid for.Do I have to be an artist to participate?Definitely not. I’d really like to hear from everyone, artists, art lovers, and even art haters too!How long will it be before my quote appears on the website?Hmmm. Well, I work on the website by hand – with the keyboard. And fingers. So, your quote should show up in the Big List within a week (unless something goes wrong). The randomizer isn’t done yet, but as soon as it is I’ll start loading the quotes in there too. If you’d like updates by email, contact me and let me know. I can let you know when yours is posted too.I’ll be keeping offline backups too, so the worst that could happen is that I have to (sigh) retype each one.The basics of the new website are already in place. Soon, you’ll be able to find The Big List by visiting whistlestop-gallery.com/project and clicking on Quoted.Where exactly will the quotes be?Each one will be on The Big List. Visit the Whistle Stop Gallery Project Directory at www.whistlestop-gallery.com/project and click on Quoted. Visit whistlestop-gallery.com/site to see a random single quote.What if you get more than 1436 quotes? Will some not display?All of the quotes will appear in The Big List, and all of them will be available to the randomizer, no matter how many or how few I get.Can I put something else instead of my name, like a website?I’d really like your name. If you’d rather not, I can put anonymous instead. But no, you can’t put advertisements in there, like a website. If it’s advertisement you’re looking for, I may have something else for you. Check out my other Perks. You can also contact me.My name is too big. What do I do?Wow. Your name is more than 255 characters? I guess I’ll have to modify the randomizer backend. Until then, it will still be in The Big List.My quote is too big. What do I do?That’s a pretty long quote. Let’s review it and I’ll decide if it needs to be shorter, or if the randomizer needs to be modified for longer lengths.Do I have to put my name?You can be anonymous, or only use a first or last name or a nickname if you want. Pen names work too.How can I contact you?You can contact me on this site directly, or via my form on the Whistle Stop Gallery website. You can even mail me a letter – the address is on the Whistle Stop Gallery Site too. If you’re using the Whistle Stop Gallery form, please remember it’s not a secure form, so don’t put bank or credit card stuff in there. If you’re having trouble getting a hold of me, you can reach out to Indiegogo too – they can get in touch as well.How much will it cost to ship my Perk?It doesn’t. I pay the shipping. If it can be shipped to your address, the shipping's free.Why do some of the Perks only ship to the United States?I can offer better Perks that way. Have an idea of how I can ship Perks internationally without outrageous shipping costs? Contact me and tell me about it!Why do you keep capitalizing Show and Shows?It’s a part of the Whistle Stop Gallery website. It’s divided into Shows, Galleries, Projects, and Proposals. And last but not least the main Site, which displays the randomized quotes. That’s why Site is sometimes capitalized too - it’s the Site section of the Whistle Stop Gallery website. Confused yet?

story:
Apogaea Concalve 2016

Apogaea is Colorado's regional Burning man, a nonprofit organization, that brings together the people who love art, music, and community for one weekend to share.  

This year, we celebrate the idea of Moist and using the battle between Fire and Water, the Apogaea fire conclave will use fire and LED to shower the participants of Apogaea.

2015 was extremely bumpy for the participants of Apo to the point that many people gained a distaste in their mouth for this one thing they used to call home. This year, 2016, we are all working together quite hard to ensure that community is restored and that Apogaea, is once again, a cherished gathering that we can all look forward to. 

Help the conclave rejoice with the community in the Re-Birth of Apo.

We need a little help from our friends:

With your help, the Apogaea Conclave will be able to share their work to the fullest with fellow Apogaeans.

We thank you with full hearts and gratitude, and depending on your donation, have a little something for you in return.

From your five dollar donation to you fifty dollar donation, our performers obtain the opportunity to create atmosphere, to build stage props, to accent with costuming, buy props, and really bring this performance to life. In return, you will receive an awesome perk; body scrubs, body soaks, hula hoops, massage, hand made coloring book, coasters, a photo shoot, and much more!! We really appreciate your thought and effort in assisting us and we want to show our love.

Rebirth

Let's bring our vision of Apogaea's Re-birth to life!

Help us out even more by spreading the word and sharing our campaign.

story:
Brief history of the organization: Arts Solutions is a social enterprise organization dedicated to development of arts and culture. Arts Solutions was established in May 2015 with the mission  of to create a life of prosperity for local artisans and their families in Ghana. Haven been able to develop a video tutorials on Ghanaian cultural rhythms benefiting both local and international music lovers since its establishment.

Organizational structure: The organization is headed by a director, project coordinator and product design/marketing

Artisan’s work place/environment: The crafts are made from private and hired workshops and their sold at the Center for National Culture where local and international visit on daily basis.

The Raw Materials used and where the Raw Materials come from: If hardwoods are used how are they acquired? Are they purchased from dealers authorized by the local forest service? Are replanting programs in place? How are sustainability issues addressed by your group? Please visit the Forest Stewardship Council www.fscus.org, for information on sourcing wood (especially endangered species) from reputable, certified dealers.

Communities’ needs and challenges: The current challenges have to do with a gross lack of technical knowledge among artisans relating to fair trade principles. The local artisans are not finding their share in international handicraft market because their crafts lack technical capabilities needed to meet up international consumer societies. Lacking technical education include: 1. economically disadvantaged in their production, access to market and an online platform to sell their products. Hence lack proper book keeping skills, have no idea of fair price payment, lack sensitization on women economic empowerment and gender equity.

Impact on the artisan group, community and the environment: This will help develop the quality of traditional craft to a standard that is consistent of fair trade principles. This will be an opening to further improving technical and business competence of our currently 15 member artisans in good standing.

Sustainability: Various segments of Ghana’s arts and craft literature in videos tutorials will be created and YouTube will be used as a distribution channels and Google addsense will be created as a sources of income to sustain the project beyond it implementation.

story:
Background to the project and exhibition

The exhibition will present photo documentation of the annual art in nature laboratory, Ars Kozara, which takes place in Kozara National Park, Bosnia and Herzegovina. It will be on display between 21st-27th April 2016 at 5th Base Gallery (23 Heneage Street, London E1 5LJ) and is a collaboration between Tač.ka and Charlotte Whelan (PhD student, UCL), with the help of Dominique Russell and Breana Cronk-Moore (MA Museum Studies, UCL). 

Initiated in 2007 by the art collective Tač.ka, who are from the municipality in which Kozara is located, Ars Kozara invites artists from all over the Former Yugoslavia and further afield to spend 1-2 weeks living and working together in the national park to create artworks that engage technically and conceptually with the space of Kozara. The London exhibition will present photo and video documentation of the project from 2007-2015.

The exhibition presents a rare opportunity in the UK to see some of the work that young artists in Bosnia and Herzegovina are doing. Ars Kozara is not only unique in the Bosnian context but also internationally. As a project that takes place annually at the same site, it represents a prolonged engagement with a specific place rather than a one-off intervention that is common in site-specific projects. The exhibition will demonstrate the evolution of both the project and Kozara as a site transformed into an open-air gallery. It also counteracts common misconceptions of what Bosnian art is or should be, acting as an educational project of sorts for UK audiences.

What we need your support for

Although the costs are relatively minimal, there are costs that as students we can’t afford fully ourselves. Research on and applications for alternative funding sources have been done, but most did not fully fit the concept of the exhibition or the project. And some we are still waiting to hear from. With such small costs to put on the exhibition, crowd funding is, if we can achieve our goal, a more guaranteed form of funding for us and in many ways a more positive one. The main goal is to expose as many people as possible to this unique project from Bosnia and Herzegovina, so crowd sourcing allows us to raise funds as well as spread the word. Ars Kozara always relies on community involvement and hopefully that collaborative approach can continue in the UK with this exhibition.  

The cost of our gallery hire will be £750 and printing the photos and other documentation will be around £400. We would also very much like to invite Tač.ka members to be present at the exhibition. If this is possible, they will talk about the project at the opening event and be available for some private tours over the weekend run. We have found a fund to support the cost of airfare and visas, but we would need some additional for transport, food and accommodation costs (estimated £900). Finally we will need to hire audio-visual equipment for the video works + minor contingency costs (£450).

We would really appreciate any donation you can give to make this happen. If 1000 people donated only £2 we would be at our goal. It would be a great opportunity to share this project with a wider audience and we hope that with your support we can make it happen.

story:
Hello, I am David Schor...

I have been an Internationally Collected Artist for most of the 35 years of my career as a Fine Artist. 

Please visit my website at:  Http://www.EmotionsInArt.com/About

I need your help to find homes for  my animals: Cats, Dogs, Horses,  Wild Animals, and Birds. 

 

  

    About my Animals......

    For many years, beginning in 1980, I created drawings of animals in a very distinctive style which is called "Essential Focus". Briefly, it consists of  creating a piece of art focusing only on the essentials of the emotion. 

   

These drawings are created  with an extremely fine technical pen in black ink, using either minute dots or tiny lines, 

in many cases, I colored the eyes to enhance the emotional impact. 

        I then published the pen and ink drawings as Limited Edition Lithographs, signed and numbered..      

     These Limited Editions became extremely popular and were collected in over ten countries including the U.S.A. Many editions were completely sold out, others partially sold out and other, newer ones, just begun their journey into homes. 

       So what happened....?

        In the 1990's, the internet, namely my website, connected individuals throughout the world with my art, particularly my original impressionistic paintings.  They responded by commissioning me to go on location to create paintings for them. My clients were from England, Norway, Australia, Germany, Italy, France, Germany. Monte Carlo, and throughout the U.S.A. 

     "Crashing Waves in Tahiti"   

     Not a bad thing,!  But, it definitely took me away from my animals and that style of work. I could not spend any time marketing  them, other than to include them on my website. 

     So, there my birds, dogs, felines, etc. languished for many years without homes in the cold, impersonal security of my art vault while I have been traveled with my wife, Olga, throughout  France, Italy, Hawaii, and the U.S.A creating paintings. 

     What is the Project???

    I am asking you to give one or more of my animals a home.   

    You can choose one or more that you want and I will send them to you.  Your donation to the project will enhance your home or office, give my animals a home, and relieve me of a great deal of guilt. You can select the level of your participation. As little as $15 and up to $750.


  ... and here's where you come in....

    I want to make sure you understand that your contribution, at whatever level you choose, will be very appreciated. 

 You will have an opportunity to participate, in a very real way, in allowing this important aspect of my body of artistic work to be enjoyed as it was meant to be.

 Your rewards will arrive no matter what.  I have been a professional Artist for thirty-five years, and have always appreciated each and every client and collector . I'll be taking your support equally seriously. You will also join me on my list of collectors and, if you wish, receive periodic Newsletters concerning my art.

     ...so what are the rewards???

      Interested in contributing? Fantastic! I love to have you on board, and my animals will love being in your home!

   So please choose your  level of contribution and Lithograph(s) or original drawing, click onto the appropriate Perk from the list, and  complete ALL necessary information.

    All Perks will be shipped, unframed and unmatted in a USPS  tube, within three weeks, after the campaign ends.

      Please contact me if you have any questions at: DoRealArt@Gmail.com

           I need your help. Please do                             something right now....

   My animals are being held captive in my Art Vault and they need  to have a home in which to be enjoyed.

   It hurts me to think of all of that art of mine not doing what they were created to do....make life a bit more enjoyable for people. It really does bother me.  You can help!

  Please select a Perk from those listed and click onto that Perk. I will email you to ask which of the Limited Edition Lithographs you would like me to send to you. 

I will also include a sincerely felt thank you for your help. You are doing a good thing and I appreciate it. 

        What else can you do?.....

        Please forward this information to all of your friends. My animals would love to live with them too!!

     Your choices among my Animals:

Set #1 Cats: 

All in this set are signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number. 



"Amazed Cat"   #1

***************************************

"Two Cats   #2

***************************************

Set #2 Dogs and Horses: 

All in this set are  signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number. 

"Three Pups"  #3

**************************************

************************************

*****************************

****************************************

Set #3 Wildlife: 

All in this set are signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number.

Hello, I am David Schor...I have been an Internationally Collected Artist for most of the 35 years of my career as a Fine Artist. Please visit my website at:  Http://www.EmotionsInArt.com/AboutI need your help to find homes for  my animals: Cats, Dogs, Horses,  Wild Animals, and Birds.        About my Animals......    For many years, beginning in 1980, I created drawings of animals in a very distinctive style which is called "Essential Focus". Briefly, it consists of  creating a piece of art focusing only on the essentials of the emotion.    These drawings are created  with an extremely fine technical pen in black ink, using either minute dots or tiny lines, in many cases, I colored the eyes to enhance the emotional impact.         I then published the pen and ink drawings as Limited Edition Lithographs, signed and numbered..           These Limited Editions became extremely popular and were collected in over ten countries including the U.S.A. Many editions were completely sold out, others partially sold out and other, newer ones, just begun their journey into homes.        So what happened....?        In the 1990's, the internet, namely my website, connected individuals throughout the world with my art, particularly my original impressionistic paintings.  They responded by commissioning me to go on location to create paintings for them. My clients were from England, Norway, Australia, Germany, Italy, France, Germany. Monte Carlo, and throughout the U.S.A.      "Crashing Waves in Tahiti"        Not a bad thing,!  But, it definitely took me away from my animals and that style of work. I could not spend any time marketing  them, other than to include them on my website.      So, there my birds, dogs, felines, etc. languished for many years without homes in the cold, impersonal security of my art vault while I have been traveled with my wife, Olga, throughout  France, Italy, Hawaii, and the U.S.A creating paintings.      What is the Project???    I am asking you to give one or more of my animals a home.       You can choose one or more that you want and I will send them to you.  Your donation to the project will enhance your home or office, give my animals a home, and relieve me of a great deal of guilt. You can select the level of your participation. As little as $15 and up to $750.  ... and here's where you come in....
    I want to make sure you understand that your contribution, at whatever level you choose, will be very appreciated. 
 You will have an opportunity to participate, in a very real way, in allowing this important aspect of my body of artistic work to be enjoyed as it was meant to be. Your rewards will arrive no matter what.  I have been a professional Artist for thirty-five years, and have always appreciated each and every client and collector . I'll be taking your support equally seriously. You will also join me on my list of collectors and, if you wish, receive periodic Newsletters concerning my art.     ...so what are the rewards???      Interested in contributing? Fantastic! I love to have you on board, and my animals will love being in your home!   So please choose your  level of contribution and Lithograph(s) or original drawing, click onto the appropriate Perk from the list, and  complete ALL necessary information.    All Perks will be shipped, unframed and unmatted in a USPS  tube, within three weeks, after the campaign ends.      Please contact me if you have any questions at: DoRealArt@Gmail.com           I need your help. Please do                             something right now....   My animals are being held captive in my Art Vault and they need  to have a home in which to be enjoyed.   It hurts me to think of all of that art of mine not doing what they were created to do....make life a bit more enjoyable for people. It really does bother me.  You can help!  Please select a Perk from those listed and click onto that Perk. I will email you to ask which of the Limited Edition Lithographs you would like me to send to you. I will also include a sincerely felt thank you for your help. You are doing a good thing and I appreciate it.         What else can you do?.....        Please forward this information to all of your friends. My animals would love to live with them too!!     Your choices among my Animals:Set #1 Cats: All in this set are signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number. "Amazed Cat"   #1***************************************"Two Cats   #2***************************************Set #2 Dogs and Horses: All in this set are  signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number. "Three Pups"  #3**************************************"Husky"  #4************************************"Dalmatian"  #5*****************************"Horse Running"  #6****************************************Set #3 Wildlife: 
All in this set are signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number. "Two Deer"  #7**********************************"Falcon"  #8**********************************"Gentle Giraffe"  #9**********************************"Grumpy Koala"  #10**********************************"Leopard Descending a Tree"  #11**********************************"Owl on a Limb"  #12**********************************"Panther Stare"  #13**********************************"Pelican"  #14**********************************"Shark"  #15**********************************"Squirrel "  #16**********************************"Zebra "  #17**********************************"Public Opinion"  #18***************************************Set #4 Cats and Dogs:Rarer with less remaining: All in this set are signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request each by name and number. "Adoration"  #19**********************************"Sweetness"  #20**********************************"Green Eyed Tom"  #21***************************************Set #5 Larger : All in this set are on bond paper, signed and numbered by me, on paper 17"x 21" with an image size of 15"x 18". Please request each by name and number. "Arabian"  #22**********************************"Contentment in a Cat" on parchment #23**********************************"Eagle Flight" #24**********************************"Falcon Attack" #25**********************************"Full Stare of Deer" #26**********************************"Siamese 2" #27****************************************Set #6 Very Rare: 
The few remaining in this edition are signed and numbered by me, on paper 13"x 17" with an image size of 11"x 16". Please request by name and number.
"Three Kittens" #28

story:
Sea Walls: Murals for Oceans is a ground-breaking street art project created by PangeaSeed to bring the beauty and the plight of the world’s oceans into streets around the globe. By collaborating with internationally renowned artists, we create large-scale murals that focus attention on pressing environmental issues the oceans are facing.

In collaboration with our friends at 1xRUN we are embarking on our biggest Sea Walls project yet. We’ve invited some of today’s biggest names in contemporary street art to join us on our first-ever Sea Walls expedition.

The mission of the expedition is to offer these artists the opportunity to swim with and study endangered whale sharks and oceanic manta rays off the coast of the island of Isla Mujeres, Mexico from July 20-28, 2014. Inspired by their interactions with these majestic giants in the wild, the artists will create a series of large-scale public murals on the island to help educate and raise greatly needed awareness within the local and tourist communities for the plight of these animals and the oceans. The murals will also highlight the benefits of ecotourism and long-term sustainability of natural resources.

Sea Walls: Murals for Oceans is a new approach to ocean conservation, marrying art and activism. The Sea Walls expedition will make a large impact and gain global media attention – with your help.


You can help us reach our project budget of $25,000 USD to cover all project expenses.

In return for your support, we are offering you an awesome selection of exciting perks to fit any budget.

  • Buy Art, Save Sharks! - purchase artwork from the PangeaSeed archive sale on 1xRUN.com

  • Spread the word! - Use social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.) to amplify this project and issues affecting our oceans.

  • Visit PangeaSeed.org, become a monthly donor, buy art and follow us on social media (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, etc.)


Your contribution will help cover flights, accommodations, paint, equipment (ladders, scaffolding, brushes, etc.), boat charters, food, film production and permits for the participating artists and expedition team members.

If you help us exceed our funding goal, any additional funds will be used toward the post-production quality of the final documentary film and the art exhibition to highlight the project, in collaboration with FIFTY24MX Gallery in Mexico City.

Your money will not be used to cover any compensation for employees of PangeaSeed, 1xRUN, or artists. Everyone involved, including the artists, are donating their time and talent because this is a project we all believe has significant merit.

Thank you for helping us make this expedition a reality! Your support is bringing us one step closer to accomplishing our goal to protect key marine animals and sustain our seas.


Both the whale sharks and the oceanic manta ray are listed as species threatened with extinction on the IUCN Red List of Endangered Species due to destructive global fishing practices and the unregulated trade. Despite the protection efforts of several countries, these animals are considered highly lucrative for the Asian shark fin trade and the growing mega-aquarium trade both adding pressures on their already vulnerable populations.

Completely harmless to people, whale sharks and manta rays are some of the largest wild animals one will ever be able to experience up close.

  • 71% of Earth is covered by oceans and are home to 2.3 million species.

  • 70% of the oxygen we breathe comes from the ocean, making it the life-support system of the planet.

  • Oceans regulate weather and provide food and employment for over 2.5 billion people globally.

  • Less than 1%(!) of the world’s oceans are protected (compared to 15% of land).

  • Global fish stocks are predicted to be in full collapse by mid-century if our consumption and destructive fishing habits do not change.

  • Up to 100 million sharks are killed annually for the global shark fin trade.

  • Plastic waste kills up to 1 million sea birds, 100,000 sea mammals and countless fish each year.

  • 70% of the world’s fisheries are overexploited or depleted.

  • The world’s coral reefs are predicted to be dead by mid-century.


PangeaSeed is an international non-profit organization who collaborates with members of the art, science, and environmental activist communities.  PangeaSeed is dedicated to raising public awareness and education surrounding the conservation and preservation of oceans and marine species in peril.

At PangeaSeed, a picture is worth more than just a thousand words. – We believe that art, design and new media can transcend cultural and linguistic boundaries inspiring positive global change.

PangeaSeed collaborates with today’s most influential creative minds to help give the oceans the voice they so desperately need.

Website: PangeaSeed.org




1xRUN is the premier online destination for exclusive one of a kind artwork in any and all forms. Working with leading and emerging artists from around the world, 1xRUN is focused on bringing limited-edition time released artwork to collectors across the globe. Here at 1xRUN, our artists are a special breed and so are our customers. We strive to offer a one of a kind product that suits both and is unlike anything else in the marketplace.

Website: 1xRUN.com

story:
UPDATE 2:

Anyone is more than welcome to join us for the burn or at any point during the week, thats why we are bringing it out, because we want to share it

The main reason we are asking for help with the base expenses is so we can upgrade the costume for the bus to transform it into a SR-71 stealth jet
With:
  • A gnarly nose cone!
  • Overhead Wing Shade Structure! 
  • Jet Engines on the back! 
  • Fire Cannons!
  • New Lighting!
3d Modeling/Sketches to come!

Short Summary

My name is Coyoti, I am a community organizer and multimedia artist.

I am asking for the help of my friends, family, and art supporters to help us bring the Blackbird to Burning Man 2014.

The Blackbird was built in 2012.  That amazing summer we brought the bus out to Burning Man and back for the first time. 
Since then we have taken the bus to many festivals, and have made a long trail of amazing memories. This year, the desert is calling us back again.
This year, we need your help.
Cost Breakdown is as follows
$2500 (appx) in Diesel for the Journey West
 $2637 for maintenance shop costs before we leave
$1800 Generator Rental for the Week
$400 Diesel Generator Fuel
$7337.00
We are not asking for a free ride, we are just asking with the help of the great burden of cost associated with operating an art car on the playa.
The people riding out on the bus to the burn cover some of the cost but not close to all of the expenses.
None of our personal expenses are included in this breakdown
We want badly to bring the bus back to the playa and share with you. 
Our time bringing people on art tours and playing music for people are some of the happiest memories of our lives.
Bringing an art car to the playa is a labor of love, we spend a majority of our time working on the car, or in my case driving dead sober at 5 mph while everyone parties on the roof. At the end of the day it is honestly a sacrifice, obligation and responsibility. We love doing it! 
We love this bus and we built it to share it. 
Thank you for your support. 

What We Need & What You Get


  • We need $5000 to assist in buying fuel for the cross country journey, replacing our lighting, and purchasing materials for converting the bus into a stealth jet. 
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, whatever money we raise will be attributed to our fuel cost first, then to lighting and materials.
  • By donating to our project, we will be most honored to reward you with custom Blackbird gear and special privileges on the playa to enjoy the fruits of the project you helped make a reality 


Impact

  • The Blackbird is a shining example and representative of the East Coast. 
  • We are, to our knowledge, the ONLY East Coast Class 1 Sound Car at the burn to make the drive all the way across the country.
  • Having the Blackbird at Burning Man shows to the rest of the country that there ARE incredible things happening on the east coast and that our influence in the national artistic landscape is on the rise.

Risks & Challenges

  • Our Deadline to leave on August 16th
  • There is lots to be done in that time
  • We have a schedule and workplan for getting everything done in time and our help would be extremely appreciated in getting us out there.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Inquire on the Blackbird Facebook Page about potentially riding out with us to the burn! 
    www.facebook.com/theblackbirdsquadron
  • Come Out and see us at the burn and party with us!
  • Stop in and help us set up at the burn!
  • PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN ON YOUR FACEBOOK AND TWITTER PAGES!!

THANK YOU SO SO MUCH!!!!!!

**Although our contributors are guaranteed certain perks, The Blackbird has always (and will always) be shared with the community in its entirety and remain radically inclusive.**
