story:
The campaign it's over but the journey just begun. You can still claim the perks by donating the amount directly into my PayPal account, e-mail adress: e.alinamoda@gmail.com

Until April, the 20th 2014, I can still deliver the following perks*:

- 10 E - A digital portrait of you.  You will need to send me a photo of you at artsywheels@gmail.com. The portrait will be ready in no more than 2 weeks  from the moment you dens me your photo. Here you can see the online gallery of those who claimed the perk during the campaign.

- 45 E - Creative CV. We discuss all the details on mail, artsywheelsgmail.com

- 150 E - Original painting for Art Lovers. Only 10 pieces available! Each one unique! You have to send me your home adress at artsywheels@gmail.com

* for details please scroll down :)


I leave at the end of May. But there are perks* that I can deliver during my journey and/ or once I reach Indonesia:

20 E - Personal Handwritten postcard in English sent from the journey

30 E - Personal Handwritten letter perk (it may contain little doodles), written in English, just for you

50 E - An original sketch from the trip

500 E - A time capsule 

* for details please scroll down :)

After donating please write me at e.alinamoda@gmail.com or artsywheels@gmail.com, sending me your home adress.


You can follow my journey on Facebook, Twitter or Artsy Wheels blog.

Thank you!

                    -  "Where do you see yourself 5 years from now?"

                    -  "On the road, so I have no idea"

Not knowing is, for me, overwhelmingly exciting. How can life surprise you if you know what are you looking for? This is a manifest for life as a journey: not knowing, expecting the unexpected, failure, making mistake, but also the light is so much brighter.

                        Let's revive the art of storytelling!


I’ve applied for the Darmasiswa Indonesian Scholarship. If I get accepted, it starts in September 2014. The scholarship doesn’t cover the trip from the applicant’s home country to the place of study. So I’ve started thinking: „Wouldn’t it be great to cycle all the distance to Indonesia?”

I’m really confident in my chances so I've begun planning my trip anyway. I leave in April and I have only 4 months to reach Indonesia.

                                  

This is the final route, after some sleepless nights over Google Earth and mapping bike routes on the web.


Clearly it wouldn't be doable only by bike... just in four months and not without your help :)

14 158 km in total


7263 km on bike


Quite the adventure, huh?  :) But the real journey isn't about numbers, it's about those moments that cannot be accounted, bad or good.

How is going to be cycling solo as a female so many kilometers? It's going to be crazy, chaotic at times, overwhelmingly beautiful at other times. Being on the road makes you live in the moment, and I know no other more liberating feeling.

Camping, finding shelter, food is a daily struggle but the people encountered, the scenery are well worth it. On bike  you travel at a pace slow enough to allow you to experience what you see, but fast enough to get you somewhere and the greatest thing about it: you can stop whenever wherever.

To my knowledge I'd be the first Romanian woman cycling solo such a distance.  I like to believe that my trip would be an inspiration to other women to push outside their comfort zone and challenge themselves.


I am a dreamer by heart and a maker by hands, always wondering, often wandering. And that is why I decided to document my trip through drawings.  Let's revive the art of storytelling!

"Photography is an immediate reaction, drawing is a meditation."

Henri Cartier-Brensson

In the summer of 2012 I’ve learned to bike by myself, at 26 years old, in the park, with a children bicycle. I’m a mignon (not evil though) and I felt that I’m safe only if I can stop the bike by putting my feet on the grund. Soon after that I was already bate in the hectic traffic of Bucharest. It was not long and I started to volunteer in cyclotouring projects and marking offroad cycling routes.

And this is Nelu, a 26er hardtail bike with V-brakes, named after my father.

If you have any question please leave a comment or send me an e-mail at artsywheels@gmail.com

10 000 E it's quite a large amount. But every beginning requires an investment. Almost 50 % will be spent on cyclotouring gear: for camping, bike equipment like panniers and racks, electronic equipment like GPS bike computer and satellite communication device. I have studdied my fair share of cyclotouring blogs to make the best choices.

If it lasts and keeps you safe, then it doesn't come cheap.

Visas are any traveler's nightmare. To be able to reach Indonesia by September, I need to apply for visas before leaving. In order to smooth the process I’ll use the services of local travel agencies. It smoothes the process, but also increases the expenses.

This is an ideal budget. Even if I don't get fully funded, I'm determined to start my journey, once I gather the minimum of 6000 E.

Let's revive the art of storytelling!

This is a flexible funding campaign.  Most of the perks are deliverable before I start the journey. If for whatever reason I am not able to deliver your perk, your money will be refunded.

Whatever the perk you choose, lots of love and an e-mail as proof of my gratitude.


2 E - For each perk I will get a tattoo of one line (0,5/0.1" cm). If all 5000 perks are exhausted than I'll have a 5000 lines tattoo. You are, literally, going to be a line on my skin :). For this special perk I'm going to work with another artist that will come up with the design.


5 E - Your name on the blog is not enough? What if I write your name also on my  bike flag? Your name will be waving in the wind across twelve countries


10 E - A digital portrait of you/ of one of your friends/ of your pet ecc. done by me. I will need a photo of the subject for this. Being a flexible campaign you will receive your portrait before the campaign ends, no later than 2 weeks after you send me the picture.


20 E - Thoughts from another country, maybe another continent, handwritten only for you! Personal Handwritten postcard in English sent from the journey. You can choose the country from where you want your postcard to be sent.


30 E - If you want more written words choose the Personal Handwritten letter perk (it may contain little doodles), written in English, just for you. You can choose the country from where you want your letter to be sent.



*,** - travelling on bike can get messy. If for whatever reason I am not able to send you a post card or letter from the country of your choosing, than you'll be notified and you can choose . You will be notified as soon as possible, via e-mail, after I mail them to you. Each post card/ letter is written especially for you. As proof I'll be posting pictures/ paragraph on the blog (with your previous consent)

.

45 E - Creative CV - Aren't you bored of the typical CV written in Word? If you are the creative type but have no skills in any graphic design software, then this is the perk for you. Together we'll come up with the best sollution for yor CV to trully represent you! You'll receive it in the digital format you need.

Because it's a flexible campaign I'll start working on your CV as soon as we establish all the details. Delivery in maximum a month.

                                             my own CV as sample


50 E - An original sketch from the trip.

It all starts end ends with you! Thanks to you I 'll make the journey and I'll have the chance to doodle. Don't worry. The sketches will be more advanced than a stickman :).

60 E - Sketchbook inspired by Homage to the square of Joseph Alber  – 50 pg; square format 5"x5"/ 12x12 cm; Canson paper 90g/m²; shipping included.

This journey is about creativity. It is my journey in the realm of color perception. Each sketchbook is entirely done by (my) hand: the cover is painted, the  sheets are hand cutted and everything is hand bounded. *

* if you love sketchbooks but you're not really fond of the Homage to square idea, you can choose one of these sketchbooks

70 E - A white t-shirt digitally printed with a doodle of you or a sketch from the trip; shipping included;

Details on fabric and available sizez here. Check what size fits you best.

For the family package (1 man, 1 woman, 1 child) contribute 180 E.

Wouldn't be nice to get the family package with a doodle of the entire family? The more, the merrier! For each additional Tshirt you contribute  50 E more.Shipping still included.


80 E - Do you have an idea of a drawing but you can't put it on paper? With this perk we'll come up together with your desired illustration. Your custom drawing will be done using digital tools like Photoshop, Illustrator or Sketchbook. You'll receive it in digital format, the sizes you need and agree upon.

Because it's a flexible campaign I'll start working on the drawing as soon as we establish all the details. It will be finished in maximum a month.


150 E - Original painting for Art Lovers. Only 10 pieces available! Each one unique!

Dimensions (Height x Width): 70 x 50 cm/ 27.5″ x 19.6″

Technique used: tempera, coloured pencils on paper 120 g/m²

Shipping included. The painting will be shipped between two cardboard slices, marked “Fragile shipment”

If you want to see the pictures enlarged please check out the online gallery on my blog.


500 E - A time capsule

Do you know what a time capsule is? Well a time capsule is a historic cache of memorabilia specific to a time, people or place, placed with the intention that it will be opened or accessed at a future date.

The container is water proof. All items included in the time capsule are things gathered along the way and non rotting, but also items as personal notes, drawings ecc.

You (and only you) will reveceive a GPS code of where your time capsule is burried. I’m using inReach satellite communicator to embed location coordinates. Please take into consideration that it has an accuracy of +/− 5 meters. This is why I’m going to bury the time capsule near an easy to spot landmark (like an unusual tree or rock) and you’ll receive also a photo of the landmark.

All time capsules are burried in remotely unpopulated places, but you should still  be aware that in time it’s possible for someone else to discover your time capsule. So the sooner you go hunting for your time capsule the greater the chances your 500 E are well spent.

Upon request I can e-mail you also pictures of the content, but I think it's more exciting to discover it by yourself.


1300 E - all of the above perks :)



Most of the perks will be delivered before I start my journey, some of them even before the campaign ends.

I will be traveling solo. Setbacks can arise. The blog will be updated as soons as it is possible.

You can not take this kind of journey without even considering you may not get to end it. I'll communicate constantly with someone back home and, if this does happen, your money will be fully refunded for the perks non deliverable.

You can also be a supporter by spreading the word about this campaign. You can use the Indiegogo share tools to do so. Any share is greatly appreciated.

If you love the campaign but none of the perks catched your attention and interest maybe this other artsy stuff made by me would.


All being said hope you'll take this journey with me. If you do have any question left unanswered, please feel free to write me at artsywheels@gmail.com
story_txt:
The campaign it's over but the journey just begun. You can still claim the perks by donating the amount directly into my PayPal account, e-mail adress: e.alinamoda@gmail.comUntil April, the 20th 2014, I can still deliver the following perks*:- 10 E - A digital portrait of you.  You will need to send me a photo of you at artsywheels@gmail.com. The portrait will be ready in no more than 2 weeks  from the moment you dens me your photo. Here you can see the online gallery of those who claimed the perk during the campaign.- 45 E - Creative CV. We discuss all the details on mail, artsywheelsgmail.com- 150 E - Original painting for Art Lovers. Only 10 pieces available! Each one unique! You have to send me your home adress at artsywheels@gmail.com* for details please scroll down :) I leave at the end of May. But there are perks* that I can deliver during my journey and/ or once I reach Indonesia:20 E - Personal Handwritten postcard in English sent from the journey30 E - Personal Handwritten letter perk (it may contain little doodles), written in English, just for you50 E - An original sketch from the
trip500 E - A time capsule * for details please scroll down :)After donating please write me at e.alinamoda@gmail.com or artsywheels@gmail.com, sending me your home adress.You can follow my journey on Facebook, Twitter or Artsy Wheels blog. Thank you!
                    - 
"Where do you see yourself 5 years from
now?"
                    - 
"On the road, so I have no idea" 

Not knowing is, for me, overwhelmingly
exciting. How can life surprise you if you know what are you looking for? This
is a manifest for life as a journey: not knowing, expecting the unexpected,
failure, making mistake, but also the light is so much brighter.                        Let's revive the art of storytelling!
 
I’ve applied for the Darmasiswa Indonesian Scholarship. If I get accepted, it starts in September 2014. The scholarship doesn’t cover the trip
from the applicant’s home country to the place of study. So I’ve started
thinking: „Wouldn’t it be great to cycle all the
distance to Indonesia?” 

I’m really confident in my chances so I've begun planning my trip anyway. I leave in April and I have only 4 months to reach Indonesia. 
                                   This is the final route, after some sleepless nights over Google Earth and mapping bike routes on the web.Clearly it wouldn't be
doable only by bike... just in four months and not without your help :)14 158 km in total7263 km on bikeQuite the adventure, huh?  :) But the real journey isn't about numbers, it's about those moments that cannot be accounted, bad or good.How is going to be cycling solo as a female so many kilometers? It's going to be  crazy, chaotic at times, overwhelmingly beautiful at other times. Being on the road makes you live in the moment, and I know no other more liberating feeling.Camping, finding shelter, food is a daily struggle but the people encountered, the scenery are well worth it. On bike  you travel at a pace slow enough to allow you to experience 
what you see, but fast enough to get you somewhere and the greatest 
thing about it: you can stop whenever wherever.To my knowledge I'd be the first Romanian woman cycling solo such a 
distance.  I like to believe that my trip would be an inspiration to 
other women to 
push outside their comfort zone and challenge themselves.I am a dreamer by heart
and a maker by hands, always wondering, often wandering. And
that is why I decided to document my trip through drawings.  Let's revive the art of storytelling!
"Photography is an immediate reaction, drawing is
a meditation." 
Henri Cartier-Brensson
In the summer of 2012 I’ve
learned to bike by myself, at 26 years old, in the park, with a children bicycle. I’m a mignon
(not evil though) and I felt that I’m safe only if I can stop the bike by
putting my feet on the grund. Soon after that I was already bate in the hectic
traffic of Bucharest. It was not long and I started to volunteer in cyclotouring projects and marking offroad cycling routes. And this is Nelu, a 26er hardtail bike with V-brakes, named after my father. If you have any question please leave a comment or send me an e-mail at artsywheels@gmail.com10 000 E it's quite a large amount. But every beginning requires an investment. Almost 50 % will be spent on cyclotouring gear: for camping, bike equipment like panniers and racks, electronic equipment like GPS bike computer and satellite communication device. I have studdied my fair share of cyclotouring blogs to make the best choices. If it lasts and keeps you safe, then it doesn't come cheap. Visas are any traveler's nightmare. To be able to reach Indonesia by September, I need to apply for visas before leaving. In order to smooth the process I’ll use the services of local travel agencies. It smoothes the process, but also increases the expenses.This is an ideal budget. Even if I don't get fully funded, I'm determined to start my journey, once I gather the minimum of 6000 E.Let's revive the art of storytelling!This is a flexible funding campaign.  Most of the perks are deliverable before I start the journey. If for whatever reason I am not able to deliver your perk, your money will be refunded.Whatever the perk you choose, lots of love and an e-mail as proof of my gratitude.2 E - For each perk I will get a tattoo of one line (0,5/0.1" cm). If all 5000 perks are exhausted than I'll have a 5000 lines tattoo. You are, literally, going to be a line on my skin :). For this special perk I'm going to work with another artist that will come up with the design. 5 E - Your name on the blog
is not enough? What if I write your name also on my  bike flag? Your name will be waving in the
wind across twelve countries10 E - A digital portrait of you/ of one of your friends/
of your pet ecc. done by me. I will need a photo of the subject for this. Being a flexible campaign you will receive your portrait before the campaign ends, no later than 2 weeks after you send me the picture.20 E - Thoughts from another country, maybe another continent, handwritten only for you! Personal Handwritten postcard in English sent from the journey. You can choose the country from where you want your postcard to be sent.30 E - If you want more written words choose the Personal Handwritten letter perk (it may contain little doodles), written in English, just for you. You can choose the country from where you want your letter to be sent.
*,** - travelling on bike can get messy. If for whatever reason I am not able to send you a post card or letter from the country of your choosing, than you'll be notified and you can choose . You will be notified  as soon as possible, via e-mail, after I mail them to you. Each post card/ letter is written especially for you. As proof I'll be posting pictures/ paragraph on the blog (with your previous consent)
.
45 E - Creative CV - Aren't you bored of the typical CV 
written in Word? If you are the creative type but have no skills in any 
graphic design software, then this is the perk for you. Together we'll 
come up with the best sollution for yor CV to trully represent you! 
You'll receive it in the digital format you need.Because it's a 
flexible campaign I'll start working on your CV as soon as we establish 
all the details. Delivery in maximum a month.                                             my own CV as sample50 E - An original sketch from the
trip. It all starts end ends with you! Thanks to you I 'll make the journey and I'll have the chance to doodle. Don't worry. The sketches will be more advanced than a stickman :). 
60 E - Sketchbook
inspired by Homage to the square of Joseph Alber  – 50 pg; square format 5"x5"/ 12x12 cm; Canson paper 90g/m²; shipping included. This
journey is about creativity. It is my journey in the realm of color perception.
Each sketchbook is entirely done by (my) hand: the cover is painted, the  sheets are hand cutted and everything is hand bounded. *
* if you love sketchbooks but you're not really fond of the Homage to square idea, you can choose one of these sketchbooks
70 E - A white t-shirt digitally printed with a doodle of you or a sketch
from the trip; shipping included; Details on fabric and available sizez here. Check what size fits you best.For the family package (1 man, 1 woman, 1 child) contribute 180 E. Wouldn't be nice to get the family package 
with a doodle of the entire family? The more, the merrier! For each 
additional Tshirt you contribute  50 E more.Shipping still included.80 E - Do you have an idea of a drawing but you can't put it on paper? With this perk we'll come up together with your desired illustration. Your custom drawing will be done using digital tools like Photoshop, Illustrator or Sketchbook. You'll receive it in digital format, the sizes you need and agree upon.Because it's a flexible campaign I'll start working on the drawing as soon as we establish all the details. story:
************************************************************************** 

WE MADE IT! THANKS TO YOUR OVERWHELMING SUPPORT, THE AURA™ BREATHALYZER IS NOW IN PRODUCTION!

Although our Indiegogo campaign has come to an end, please note that we are now taking pre-orders directly on our website! Please visit us at www.aurabreathalyzer.com for further details.

$75,000+:  All of our backers who ordered an AURA unit will receive 2 official AURA filters for FREE!  [Congratulations! This STRETCH GOAL has been reached]

**************************************************************************


OUR STORY

Meet the AURA team. Learn how you can help.


The AURA™ Breathalyzer by Ho International Design, Inc.

Sleek, innovative product design delivers a unique fashionable alternative and transcends stigma.

The AURA™ Breathalyzer is a hand-held breath alcohol screening device that utilizes electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology to analyze the oxidation of ethanol within human breath samples. This device is intended to provide an estimate of a test subject’s blood alcohol concentration (BAC), based on the analysis of that subject’s breath sample. 

Unprecedented style, Inspired by Chic Fashion.

Being constantly exposed to the L.A./Hollywood nightlife scene, we at Ho International Design Inc. (HIDI) are well aware that image and public perception have historically deterred the public and widespread use of personal breathalyzers.

TO OVERCOME THIS OBSTACLE, we leveraged our background in fashion and product design to create a chic, groundbreaking breathalyzer specifically designed to reshape the world’s perception of responsible celebration. 

Precision.

In developing the AURA™, we understood that matching its breathtaking aesthetics with precise technology was an absolute must. We firmly believe that the critical decision to operate a vehicle after alcohol consumption should only be aided by the best available technology for the everyday consumer.

As such, every AURA™ unit integrates FUEL CELL sensor technology. Compared to less expensive semiconductor oxide sensors, fuel cell sensors are far and beyond the more outstanding technology, and are used in most POLICE hand-held alcohol screening devices and most COURT-ISSUED vehicle ignition-interlock systems.

FUEL CELL SENSOR TECHNOLOGY

Learn why YOU should invest in it.

All too often, we make the critical mistake of self-determining our ability to safely operate a vehicle after recent alcohol consumption. While the current blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limit of 0.08% is common knowledge (within the USA), most of us fail to realize that one’s BAC cannot be accurately estimated without the aid of a professional breathalyzer. The fact is there are just TOO MANY VARIABLES affecting a person’s BAC (i.e. age, weight, gender, ethnicity, liver function, amount of food digested, other drugs/medication) for any of us to know with certainty where we stand at any moment in time, if we were to only rely on generic BAC Charts from the DMV. Fortunately, the use of fuel cell breathalyzers helps reduce guesswork and provides otherwise unattainable information.

While semiconductor oxide sensors have demonstrated the ability to detect the presence of ethyl alcohol (“ethanol”) in a person’s body, fuel cell sensors have proven to provide much more accurate estimates of ethanol within a person’s breath. As such, we believe that settling for second-tier semiconductor sensor technology is a poor investment. The difference in accuracy and consistency between the two types of sensors is drastic and could make all the difference in your future. 

COMPARE THE AURA™ TO THE COMPETITION

[CLICK HERE to search Amazon.com for fuel cell breathalyzers]


QUICK. PRECISE. EASY TO USE.

Peace of mind … in seconds.

  1. Press and hold the “on” button for 3 seconds. Your last reading will appear.
  2. Press the “on” button again, and wait for the sensor’s countdown: “05...04...03...02...01...”
  3. Blow forcefully into the device for 5 seconds when AURA™ flashes “BLOW”.
  4. Your current BAC level will be revealed in just seconds.


Miscellaneous

Product Highlights

  • Electrochemical FUEL CELL sensor technology – the same technology found in hand-held alcohol screening devices used by LAW ENFORCEMENT and in COURT-ISSUED ignition interlock systems for cars – ensures precise BAC measurements
  • Unique halo-inspired design embodies the protective aura and peace of mind only professional breathalyzers can offer
  • Ergonomic shape facilitates one-handed use and convenient storage within coin pockets and clutches
  • Sleek, scratch-resistant polycarbonate screen with eye-catching OLED display, including 6 color theme options
  • Precision-brushed stainless steel back plate provides exceptional durability, along with a luxurious look and feel

Product Specifications/Dimensions

  • Color: Glossy Black (front screen) and Stainless Steel Silver (back-plate)
  • Price: $230 USD (Projected MSRP)
  • Size & Weight:
  •   Diameter:  52.0 mm (2.04 inches)
  •   Depth/Height: 15.2 mm (0.60 inches)
  •   Weight: 54 grams (or 1.9 ounces)
  • Materials:  Stainless Steel (back-plate); Scratch-resistant Plastic (front screen)
  • Display:  White OLED, 96x94 pixels (includes 6 color theme options)
  • Sensor Technology:  Electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology; NOTE: This critical component is developed and manufactured within the USA.
  • Sensor Range:  0-0.300% BAC or 0-3g/L BAC or 0-1.5mg/L BrAC
  • Sensor Accuracy: +/- 0.01% BAC @ 0.08% BAC (pending further tests)
  • Battery:  Lithium, DC3.7V 90mA/H
  • Battery life: 100 uses per charge (rechargeable)
  • Power/Charger:  Micro-USB, DC5V 50mA
  • External button:  One universal button (On/Off plus options)
  • Language:  English
  • In the box:  AURA™ Breathalyzer, Official suede pouch, Micro-USB charging cord, 2 Official filters (mouthpieces), Official documentation (User's manual, QuickStart guide, etc.)

One-Year Limited Warranty (subject to change)

Ho International Design, Inc.’s warranty obligations for this product are limited to the following:

Ho International Design, Inc. (“HIDI”) warrants the AURA™ breathalyzer to be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal and instructed use. This warranty will be applicable for One (1) Year from the date of retail purchase (“warranty period”), and will only apply to the original end-user purchaser of the product and will not be transferable, or enforceable by, any subsequent owner. In the event of a defect, malfunction, or failure of the product to conform with this warranty, the original purchaser may submit a claim (a brief explanation of the problem) and return the defective product with evidence of purchase. If the claim is received within the warranty period and deemed to be valid by HIDI, HIDI will either (1) repair a defective product covered under this warranty, (2) replace it at no cost with an equivalent unit, or (3) refund the purchase price of the product. When a refund is granted, the product for which the refund is provided must be returned to HIDI and becomes the property of HIDI. This Limited Warranty will not cover ordinary wear and tear, and will be void if the product has been subjected to misuse, abuse, neglect, accident, or tampering. It will also be void if the product is modified in any way. It will not cover normal periodic calibrations, which is included within our consideration of "normal and instructed use".

Disclaimers

The AURA™ Breathalyzer is a hand-held breath alcohol screening device that utilizes electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology to analyze the oxidation of ethanol within human breath samples. This device is intended to provide an estimate of a test subject’s blood alcohol concentration (BAC), based on the analysis of that subject’s breath sample.

IMPORTANT – MUST READ

1. While there exists a direct correlation between alcohol in the breath and alcohol in the blood, this correlation is imperfect, and varies based on environmental factors (e.g., air quality, wind, humidity, and temperature) and health conditions of the test subject. As such, the exact BAC level of a test subject CANNOT be determined by breath alcohol screening devices, including the AURA™ Breathalyzer. This device is NOT intended to provide the test subject’s exact BAC level.

2. A BAC reading below 0.08% from this device does not suggest or imply that the test subject cannot, or will not, be charged with driving under the influence (DUI) of alcohol. A person may be charged with DUI even with BAC levels under 0.08%. The creators of this device do not condone or support any level of drinking and driving. The presence of alcohol in the blood impairs judgment, decreases physical or mental performance, and delays reaction times, which can impair your ability to respond to an emergency. As such, driving with any alcohol in your blood is unsafe, and puts you at risk of a DUI.

3. Any act or failure to act based on a reading from this product shall be at the test subject’s or user’s own risk. Ho International Design, Inc. (HIDI) assumes no responsibility for consequences to or of test subjects who use this product and later are shown to have been under the influence of alcohol or to have had their judgment or any mental or bodily function impaired by alcohol. HIDI expressly disclaims any liability for direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages of any nature under any legal theory. HIDI makes no warranties, express or implied, as to the ability of this product to determine whether, or the extent to which, a test subject’s mental or physical functioning, or judgment, may be impaired by alcohol including whether the test subject is intoxicated under any definition of that word. 

About Us

Ho International Design Inc. (HIDI) was founded in 2012 by Christopher Ho and Christopher Surapol, two young entrepreneurs who share a vision of changing perception through design.

Christopher Ho began his higher education at the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA). After a year at UCLA, he transferred to the globally-recognized Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising (FIDM) to pursue his true passion as a designer and visionary. In addition to an Associate's degree from FIDM, his background in fashion includes working closely with world-renowned David Chu (founder of Nautica clothing brand) and at William Rast (Justin Timberlake's clothing brand). It was at the latter where he met and learned from Trish Rae, former designer for William Rast and current denim designer for 7 For All Mankind. Together, Chris and Trish created the groundbreaking AURA design you see today.

Christopher Surapol completed his Bachelor's degree in Economics from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) and earned his Master's degree in Accounting from the University of Southern California (USC). He is a certified public accountant (CPA) and a former employee of Deloitte & Touche LLP, one of the world's largest "Big 4" accounting firms. After several years of developing his expertise in business and accounting at Deloitte, he joined HIDI to help turn the AURA idea into a reality.

Risks and Challenges

We have identified the following risks and challenges, and have included below our plans to overcome them.

CREATING AWARENESS: We truly believe we have an outstanding product. We are confident that someone looking to invest in a personal breathalyzer for themselves or others will choose ours over the competition. However, the real challenge is getting people to understand/admit the benefits of purchasing a personal breathalyzer. Many people unknowingly put their futures at risk because they don’t have access to the otherwise unattainable information gained from the use of breathalyzers. We are hopeful that our innovative product design will increase overall awareness about the importance of protecting themselves and others via personal breathalyzers in general.

EXPERIENCE: Being young entrepreneurs, we understand that people may challenge our overall experience and our decision to enter the breathalyzer market. With a background in fashion and design, what do we really know about the breathalyzer market? Well - we have done our DUE DILIGENCE through 3.5 years of extensive research, and more importantly, we have teamed with a group of industry-leading experts in the field of fuel cell sensor technology (over 25 years of experience). Through this combination, we are confident in our collective ability to address shortcomings related to our experience.

PRODUCTION CAPABILITY: The AURA™ is already very far along in the production process. We have arrangements in place with our manufacturers, suppliers, and our assembly team who are capable and ready for mass production. As soon as we reach our funding goal, we will be able to give them the "green light" to begin our first production run.

QUALITY CONTROL: We recognize the importance of quality control in meeting customer expectations. We have been working very closely with our manufacturing and assembly teams to identify and propose solutions for product shortcomings/challenges. If successfully funded, we will be directly involved with overseeing the manufacturing process to ensure quality control.

USER ERROR/MISUSE: We are aware of certain risks/challenges that we will not be able prevent, such as user error (i.e. user does not blow forcefully or long enough), product misuse (i.e. users fail to wait the suggested 15-20 minutes from last sip before use), or failure to calibrate the AURA™ as needed. To mitigate these risks, we will include clear instructions and disclaimers in various areas to reduce user error, prevent product misuse, and communicate the importance of timely calibration.

Estimated Timeline

  • October 2013: End of funding period. 1st production run begins.
  • November 2013: 1st production run completed, and assembly of 1st production run units begins; 2nd production run begins (if demand exists).
  • December 2013: Assembly of 1st production run completed, and such units are mailed out to backers.
  • February 2014: 2nd production run completed, and assembly of 2nd production run units begins.
  • March 2014: Assembly of 2nd production run completed, and such units are mailed out to backers.

Video Credits

***A very special THANK YOU! to Chip McAllister and his team at PeopleStar Filmworks for producing our team video. Please ask us directly or visit http://www.peoplestar.com to learn more about what PeopleStar can do for you!***


Frequently Asked Questions

Q: What is the CALIBRATION PROCESS like, and how much does it cost?

A: We suggest that the AURA™ be calibrated after 500 uses, or once per year, whichever comes first. Like all breathalyzers, accuracy can only be maintained through timely professional calibration. We will offer this service for approximately $25, while including complimentary replacement of the polycarbonate screen and polishing of the stainless steel back plate, so that your unit comes back looking as sleek and stylish as it was intended. 

Q: Where will I need to ship my AURA unit for recalibration?

A: Before the unit is delivered, we will provide the proper addresses for our recalibration/service centers. We plan to finalize the logistics prior to our delivery dates (December). 

Q: Will any OFFICIAL FILTERS be included with each purchase? What will they look like?

A: Yes, we will include 2 complimentary filters (mouthpieces) for each AURA™ unit you order. Additional filters (mouthpieces) will be available for purchase as accessories.

Q: Are filters necessary or is it a matter of personal preference? Are filters disposable or can they be cleaned and reused?

A: The decision to use a filter (mouthpiece) generally depends on whether or not you will be sharing the AURA™ with friends/family. Even then, it is a matter of personal preference. Some people are more hygiene-conscious than others, and as such, we have provided a solution. Our filters can easily be cleaned and reused.

Q: What does the OFFICIAL POUCH look like?

A: Please see the "Gallery" tab, where we have added 2 photos of our samples per your request. Note that the final product will look much nicer as the material used will be Suede, as opposed to Velvet (shown for sample purposes only).

Q: I am an INTERNATIONAL FUNDER, but I forgot to add the extra $30 in shipping costs to my contribution amount. What should I do next?

A: Please make an additional (and separate) contribution of $30 per unit, if you forgot to include it in your original contribution amount. As long as the name on the credit card/PayPal account is the same for both contributions, we will be able to track total payments from each backer. If total payment is satisfied, we will ship your order with no delays. If total payment is not complete (missing $30), your order may be delayed until the shipping costs are advanced to us.

Q: BATTERY LIFE: How long will the unit last between charges, assuming you don't use it? How many uses before I have to recharge it?

A: Assuming you don't use it, the unit should last you one month, to be conservative. We have units that have lasted us up to 2-3 months. If you do use it, the unit should last approximately 100 uses before you need to charge it again.

Q: How does the AURA™ Breathalyzer measure up to the Breathometer (TM), which was just featured on the popular TV show "Shark Tank"? What are the notable differences?

A: Noteworthy strengths of the AURA™ Breathalyzer:

1. Unrivaled Design: The AURA™ is incredibly sleek, fashionable, professional, and it is an entirely standalone product; it does not require a smartphone for power or function. It is discreet not only because of its small size, but also largely due to its unique ability to assimilate with other electronic devices and fashion accessories. 

Breathalyzers have never been designed by (or for) those with an eye for luxury and fashion. We believe those who understand and appreciate the value of creative, fashionable design are willing to place a premium on innovation, attention to detail, brand image/lifestyle, and exceptional customer service.

2. Superior Technology: The AURA™ integrates law-enforcement grade, electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology. At a pre-order price of $49, it didn't come as a surprise that the Breathometer (TM) uses second tier, low-cost semiconductor technology. The difference in accuracy and consistency is significant. We believe that compromise should never be an option when it comes to life-changing decisions.

3. Less Frequent Calibration & Exceptional Service: The suggested number of uses before calibration is 500 for the AURA™, compared to 250 uses for the Breathometer (TM). Calibration services (excluding shipping costs) are typically significant ($15-25, nearly 50% of the cost of a Breathometer), so you definitely want to minimize the frequency of calibration. 

For AURA™ owners, when you send in your device for calibration, we will also polish the stainless steel backplate and replace your screen to ensure that your unit comes back looking as sleek and stylish as it was intended to be, at NO additional cost to you.

4. Superior Power Source: The AURA™ is rechargeable (via Micro USB) after approximately 100 uses, while the Breathometer (TM) requires AAA batteries, which must be repurchased every 75 uses. 

5. Wider Detection Range: The AURA™ detection range extends from 0.000% to 0.300%, compared to 0.00% to 0.20% for the Breathometer (TM).

NOTE: Information regarding Breathometer (TM) was taken directly from their website at http://breathometer.com/tech-specs)

Q: Why would you need this after trying it 1-2 times? Can't one remember that you're only allowed 1-3 drinks?

A: 1. In a perfect world, everyone would stick to this simple rule: "If you've had anything to drink at all, simply don't drink and drive." In the real world, however, people will continue to drink and they will continue to drive. The fact is there are just TOO MANY VARIABLES affecting a person’s BAC (i.e. age, weight, gender, ethnicity, liver function, amount of food digested, other drugs/medication) for any of us to know with certainty whether we are under/over the limit. Fortunately, the use of fuel cell breathalyzers virtually eliminates guesswork and allows you to make an informed decision before getting behind the wheel.

2. Professional breathalyzers do more than just determine whether you are under/over the 0.08% BAC limit, they provide a precise reading. Users can use that information to learn about how alcohol affects their body, how the aforementioned variables can affect their BAC, how their BAC compares to other people under similar conditions, and more. 

3. Almost everyone knows that driving with a BAC of 0.08% or higher will result in an automatic DUI or DWI. However, most people are surprised to find that, in many states/provinces/countries, you can be arrested for DUI or DWI while under the hard limit of 0.08%, if you are found to be significantly "impaired" [you cannot operate a vehicle as safely as if you were sober]. 

4. There is a reason why the breathalyzer market is valued in the hundreds of millions (USD). For more information, check out: http://wintergreenresearch.com/reports/breath_analyzer.htm

5. We understand our product, along with any breathalyzer, is not a perfect preventative measure to counteract drunk driving. We know that not everyone will agree with our approach and many will think it is "ineffective" in terms of % of lives saved per use/sale. However, our founders would like to point out and reiterate the fact that even one life saved is a tremendous and worthwhile success. To us, that is immeasurable. 

Much more than professional breathalyzer, AURA™ provides a fashionable alternative to existing models with the unique ability to remove negative stigma. By changing perception through design, AURA's mission is to promote preventative measures against drunk driving and life-changing DUI offenses.


*** Please do not hesitate to reach out to INFO@AURABREATHALYZER.COM for any questions you might have. This is the FASTEST and BEST way to reach us! We have found that some comments are not processed correctly and have led to delayed responses. We will work hard to continuously add to this FAQ section as needed. Thank you so much for your continued interest in AURA. ***
story_txt:
************************************************************************** 
WE MADE IT! THANKS TO YOUR OVERWHELMING SUPPORT, THE 
AURA™ BREATHALYZER IS NOW IN PRODUCTION!

Although our Indiegogo campaign has come to an end, please note that we are now taking pre-orders directly on our website! Please visit us at www.aurabreathalyzer.com for further details.
$75,000+:  All of our backers who ordered an AURA unit will receive 2 official AURA filters for FREE!  [Congratulations! This STRETCH GOAL has been reached]

**************************************************************************




OUR STORY
Meet the AURA
team. Learn how you can help.





The AURA™
Breathalyzer by Ho International Design,
Inc. 

Sleek,
innovative product design delivers a unique fashionable alternative and
transcends stigma.
The AURA™ Breathalyzer is a hand-held breath alcohol screening device
that utilizes electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology to analyze the
oxidation of ethanol within human breath samples. This device is intended to
provide an estimate of a test subject’s blood alcohol concentration (BAC),
based on the analysis of that subject’s breath sample. 
Unprecedented
style, Inspired by Chic Fashion.
Being constantly exposed to the L.A./Hollywood nightlife
scene, we at Ho International Design Inc. (HIDI) are well aware that image and public perception have historically deterred the public and widespread
use of personal breathalyzers.
TO OVERCOME THIS OBSTACLE, we leveraged our background in fashion
and product design to create a chic, groundbreaking breathalyzer
specifically designed to reshape the world’s perception of responsible
celebration. 
Precision.
In developing the 
AURA™, we understood that matching its
breathtaking aesthetics with precise technology was an absolute
must. We firmly believe that the critical decision to operate a vehicle after
alcohol consumption should only be aided by the best available technology for
the everyday consumer.
As such, every

AURA™ unit integrates FUEL CELL sensor technology. Compared to less expensive semiconductor oxide sensors, fuel cell
sensors are far and beyond the more outstanding technology, and are used in most POLICE hand-held alcohol screening devices and most
COURT-ISSUED vehicle ignition-interlock
systems.


FUEL CELL
SENSOR TECHNOLOGY



Learn why YOU should invest in it.

All too often, we make the critical mistake of self-determining our
ability to safely operate a vehicle after recent alcohol consumption. While the
current blood alcohol concentration (BAC) limit of 0.08% is common knowledge
(within the USA), most of us fail to realize that one’s BAC cannot be accurately
estimated without the aid of a professional breathalyzer. The fact is there are just TOO MANY VARIABLES affecting a person’s
BAC (i.e. age, weight, gender, ethnicity, liver function, amount of food
digested, other drugs/medication) for any of us to know with certainty 
where we stand at any
moment in time, if we were to only rely on generic BAC Charts from the DMV. Fortunately, the use of fuel cell
breathalyzers helps reduce guesswork and provides otherwise unattainable information. 
While semiconductor oxide sensors have demonstrated the ability to detect
the presence of ethyl alcohol
(“ethanol”) in a person’s body, fuel cell sensors have proven to provide much more accurate estimates of
ethanol within a person’s breath. As such, we believe that settling for second-tier
semiconductor sensor technology is a poor investment. The difference in
accuracy and consistency between the two types of sensors is drastic and could make all the
difference in your future. 
COMPARE THE

AURA™ TO THE COMPETITION 
[CLICK HERE to search Amazon.com for fuel cell
breathalyzers]




QUICK. PRECISE. EASY
TO USE.
Peace of mind
… in seconds.

Press and hold the “on” button for 3 seconds.
     Your last reading will appear.
Press the “on” button again, and wait for the
     sensor’s countdown: “05...04...03...02...01...”
Blow forcefully into the device for 5 seconds
     when AURA™ flashes “BLOW”.
Your current BAC level will be revealed in just
     seconds.


Miscellaneous
Product Highlights

Electrochemical FUEL
     CELL sensor technology – the same technology found in hand-held alcohol screening devices
     used by LAW ENFORCEMENT and in COURT-ISSUED ignition interlock systems for
     cars – ensures precise BAC measurements
Unique halo-inspired
     design embodies the protective aura and peace of mind only professional breathalyzers
     can offer 
Ergonomic shape
     facilitates one-handed use and convenient storage within coin pockets and
     clutches
Sleek,
     scratch-resistant polycarbonate screen with eye-catching OLED display,
     including 6 color theme options 
Precision-brushed
     stainless steel back plate provides exceptional durability, along with a
     luxurious look and feel 

Product
Specifications/Dimensions

Color: Glossy Black
     (front screen) and Stainless Steel Silver (back-plate)
Price: $230 USD
     (Projected MSRP)
Size & Weight:
  Diameter: 
     52.0 mm (2.04 inches)
  Depth/Height:
     15.2 mm (0.60 inches)
  Weight: 54 grams
     (or 1.9 ounces) 
Materials: 
     Stainless Steel (back-plate); Scratch-resistant Plastic (front screen)
Display:  White OLED, 96x94 pixels (includes 6 color theme options)
Sensor Technology:  Electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology; NOTE: This critical component is developed and manufactured within the USA.
Sensor Range:  0-0.300% BAC or 0-3g/L BAC or 0-1.5mg/L BrAC
Sensor Accuracy: +/- 0.01% BAC @ 0.08% BAC (pending further tests)
Battery:  Lithium,
     DC3.7V 90mA/H
Battery life:
100 uses per charge (rechargeable)
Power/Charger: 
     Micro-USB, DC5V 50mA
External button: 
     One universal button (On/Off plus options)
Language:  English
In the box:  AURA™ Breathalyzer, Official suede pouch, Micro-USB charging cord, 2 Official filters (mouthpieces), Official documentation (User's manual, QuickStart
     guide, etc.)

One-Year Limited Warranty (subject to change)


Ho International Design, Inc.’s warranty
obligations for this product are limited to the following: 
Ho International Design, Inc. (“HIDI”) warrants the AURA™
breathalyzer to be free from defects in materials and workmanship under normal
and instructed use. This warranty will be applicable for One (1) Year from the
date of retail purchase (“warranty period”), and will only apply to the
original end-user purchaser of the product and will not be transferable, or enforceable by, any subsequent owner. In the event of a defect, malfunction, or failure of the product to
conform with this warranty, the original purchaser may submit a claim (a brief
explanation of the problem) and return the defective product with evidence of
purchase. If the claim is received
within the warranty period and deemed to be valid by HIDI, HIDI will either (1) repair a defective product covered under this warranty, (2) replace
it at no cost with an equivalent unit, or (3) refund the purchase price of the
product. When a refund is granted, the
product for which the refund is provided must be returned to HIDI and becomes
the property of HIDI. This Limited Warranty will not cover
ordinary wear and tear, and will be void if the product has been subjected to
misuse, abuse, neglect, accident, or tampering. It will also be void if the
product is modified in any way. It will not cover normal periodic calibrations,
which is included within our consideration of "normal and instructed
use".

Disclaimers



The AURA™ Breathalyzer is a hand-held breath alcohol screening device
that utilizes electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology to analyze the
oxidation of ethanol within human breath samples. This device is intended to
provide an estimate of a test subject’s blood alcohol concentration (BAC),
based on the analysis of that subject’s breath sample. 
IMPORTANT – MUST READ
1. While there exists a
direct correlation between alcohol in the breath and alcohol in the blood, this
correlation is imperfect, and varies based on environmental factors (e.g., air
quality, wind, humidity, and temperature) and health conditions of the test
subject. As such, the exact BAC level of a test subject CANNOT be determined by
breath alcohol screening devices, including the AURA™ Breathalyzer. This device is NOT intended to provide the test
subject’s exact BAC level. 
2. A BAC reading below 0.08%
from this device does not suggest or imply that the test subject cannot, or
will not, be charged with driving under the influence (DUI) of alcohol. A
person may be charged with DUI even with BAC levels under 0.08%. The creators
of this device do not condone or support any level of drinking and driving. The
presence of alcohol in the blood impairs judgment, decreases physical or mental
performance, and delays reaction times, which can impair your ability to
respond to an emergency. As such, driving with any alcohol in your blood is
unsafe, and puts you at risk of a DUI. 
3. Any act or failure to act
based on a reading from this product shall be at the test subject’s or user’s
own risk. Ho International Design, Inc. (HIDI) assumes no responsibility for
consequences to or of test subjects who use this product and later are shown to
have been under the influence of alcohol or to have had their judgment or any
mental or bodily function impaired by alcohol. HIDI expressly disclaims any
liability for direct, indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages
of any nature under any legal theory. HIDI makes no warranties, express or
implied, as to the ability of this product to determine whether, or the extent
to which, a test subject’s mental or physical functioning, or judgment, may be
impaired by alcohol including whether the test subject is intoxicated under any
definition of that word. 


About Us
Ho International Design Inc. (HIDI) was founded in 2012 by
Christopher Ho and Christopher Surapol, two young entrepreneurs who share a
vision of changing perception through design. 
Christopher Ho began his higher education at the University of
California, Los Angeles (UCLA). After a year at UCLA, he transferred to the
globally-recognized Fashion Institute of Design and Merchandising (FIDM) to
pursue his true passion as a designer and visionary. In addition to an
Associate's degree from FIDM, his background in fashion includes working
closely with world-renowned David Chu (founder of Nautica clothing brand) and
at William Rast (Justin Timberlake's clothing brand). It was at the latter
where he met and learned from Trish Rae, former designer for William Rast and
current denim designer for 7 For All Mankind. Together, Chris and Trish created
the groundbreaking AURA design you see today.
Christopher Surapol completed his Bachelor's degree in Economics
from the University of California, Los Angeles (UCLA) and earned his Master's
degree in Accounting from the University of Southern California (USC). He is a
certified public accountant (CPA) and a former employee of Deloitte & Touche
LLP, one of the world's largest "Big 4" accounting firms. After
several years of developing his expertise in business and accounting at
Deloitte, he joined HIDI to help turn the AURA idea into a reality.
Risks and Challenges
We have identified the following risks and challenges, and have
included below our plans to overcome them.CREATING AWARENESS: 
We truly believe we
have an outstanding product. We are confident that someone looking to invest in
a personal breathalyzer for themselves or others will choose ours over the
competition. However, the real challenge is getting people to understand/admit
the benefits of purchasing a personal breathalyzer. Many people unknowingly put
their futures at risk because they don’t have access to the otherwise
unattainable information gained from the use of breathalyzers. We are hopeful
that our innovative product design will increase overall awareness about the
importance of protecting themselves and others via personal breathalyzers in
general.EXPERIENCE: Being young entrepreneurs, we understand that people
may challenge our overall experience and our decision to enter the breathalyzer
market. With a background in fashion and design, what do we really know about
the breathalyzer market? Well - we have done our DUE DILIGENCE through 3.5
years of extensive research, and more importantly, we have teamed with a group
of industry-leading experts in the field of fuel cell sensor technology (over
25 years of experience). Through this combination, we are confident in our
collective ability to address shortcomings related to our experience.

PRODUCTION CAPABILITY: The AURA™ is already very far along in the production process. We have
arrangements in place with our manufacturers, suppliers, and our assembly team
who are capable and ready for mass production. As soon as we reach our funding
goal, we will be able to give them the "green light" to begin our
first production run.

QUALITY CONTROL: We recognize the importance of quality control in
meeting customer expectations. We have been working very closely with our
manufacturing and assembly teams to identify and propose solutions for product
shortcomings/challenges. If successfully funded, we will be directly involved
with overseeing the manufacturing process to ensure quality control.
USER ERROR/MISUSE: 
We are aware of certain
risks/challenges that we will not be able prevent, such as user error (i.e.
user does not blow forcefully or long enough), product misuse (i.e. users fail
to wait the suggested 15-20 minutes from last sip before use), or failure to
calibrate the AURA™ as needed. To
mitigate these risks, we will include clear instructions and disclaimers in
various areas to reduce user error, prevent product misuse, and communicate the
importance of timely calibration.
Estimated Timeline

October 2013: End of
     funding period. 1st production run begins. 
November 2013: 1st
     production run completed, and assembly
     of 1st production run units begins; 2nd production run begins (if demand
     exists). 
December 2013: Assembly
     of 1st production run completed, and such units are mailed out to backers.
February 2014: 2nd
     production run completed, and assembly
     of 2nd production run units begins.
March 2014: Assembly of
     2nd production run completed, and such units are mailed out to backers.

Video Credits
***A very special THANK YOU! to Chip McAllister and his team at PeopleStar Filmworks for producing our team video. Please ask us directly or visit http://www.peoplestar.com to learn more about what PeopleStar can do for you!***


Frequently Asked Questions
Q: What is the CALIBRATION PROCESS like, and how much does it cost?


A: We suggest that the AURA™ be calibrated after 500 uses, or
once per year, whichever comes first. Like all breathalyzers, accuracy can only
be maintained through timely professional calibration. We will offer this
service for approximately $25, while including complimentary replacement of the
polycarbonate screen and polishing of the stainless steel back plate, so that
your unit comes back looking as sleek and stylish as it was intended. 
Q: Where will I need to ship my AURA unit for recalibration?


A: Before the unit is
delivered, we will provide the proper addresses for our recalibration/service
centers. We plan to finalize the logistics prior to our delivery dates (December). 
Q: Will any OFFICIAL FILTERS be included with each purchase? What will they look like?


A: Yes, we will include 2
complimentary filters (mouthpieces) for each AURA™ unit you order. Additional filters (mouthpieces) will be
available for purchase as accessories.
Q: Are filters necessary or is it a matter of personal preference? Are filters disposable or can they be cleaned and reused?

A: The decision to use a
filter (mouthpiece) generally depends on whether or not you will be sharing the
AURA™ with friends/family. Even
then, it is a matter of personal preference. Some people are more
hygiene-conscious than others, and as such, we have provided a solution. Our
filters can easily be cleaned and reused.

Q: What does the OFFICIAL POUCH look like?
A: Please see the "Gallery" tab, where we have added 2 photos of our samples per your request. Note that the final product will look much nicer as the material used will be Suede, as opposed to Velvet (shown for sample purposes only).
Q: I am an INTERNATIONAL FUNDER, but I forgot to add the extra $30 in shipping costs to my contribution amount. What should I do next?
A: Please make an additional (and separate) contribution of $30 per unit, if you
forgot to include it in your original contribution amount. As long as the name
on the credit card/PayPal account is the same for both contributions, we will
be able to track total payments from each backer. If total payment is
satisfied, we will ship your order with no delays. If total payment is not
complete (missing $30), your order may be delayed until the shipping costs are
advanced to us.

Q: BATTERY LIFE: How long will the unit last between charges, assuming you don't use it? How many uses before I have to recharge it?
A: Assuming you don't use it, the unit should last you one month, to be 
conservative. We have units that have lasted us up to 2-3 months. If you do use it, the unit should last approximately 100
 uses before you need to charge it again.

Q: How does the AURA™ Breathalyzer measure up to the Breathometer (TM), which was just featured on the popular TV show "Shark Tank"? What are the notable differences?
A: Noteworthy strengths of the AURA™ Breathalyzer:

1. Unrivaled Design: The AURA™ is incredibly sleek, fashionable, professional, and it is an entirely standalone product; it does not require a smartphone for power or function. It is discreet not only because of its small size, but also largely due to its unique ability to assimilate with other electronic devices and fashion accessories. 
Breathalyzers have never been designed by (or for) those with an eye for luxury and fashion. We believe those who understand and appreciate the value of creative, fashionable design are willing to place a premium on innovation, attention to detail, brand image/lifestyle, and exceptional customer service.
2. Superior Technology: The AURA™ integrates law-enforcement grade, electrochemical fuel cell sensor technology. At a pre-order price of $49, it didn't come as a surprise that the Breathometer (TM) uses second tier, low-cost semiconductor technology. The difference in accuracy and consistency is significant. We believe that compromise should never be an option when it comes to life-changing decisions.
3. Less Frequent Calibration & Exceptional Service: The suggested number of uses before calibration is 500 for the AURA™, compared to 250 uses for the Breathometer (TM). Calibration services (excluding shipping costs) are typically significant ($15-25, nearly 50% of the cost of a Breathometer), so you definitely want to minimize the frequency of calibration. 
For AURA™ owners, when you send in your device for calibration, we will also polish the stainless steel backplate and replace your screen to ensure that your unit comes back looking as sleek and stylish as it was intended to be, at NO additional cost to you.
4. Superior Power Source: The AURA™ is rechargeable (via Micro USB) after approximately 100 uses, while the Breathometer (TM) requires AAA batteries, which must be repurchased every 75 uses. 
5. Wider Detection Range: The AURA™ detection range extends from 0.000% to 0.300%, compared to 0.00% to 0.20% for the Breathometer (TM).
NOTE: Information regarding Breathometer (TM) was taken directly from their website at http://breathometer.com/tech-specs)

Q: Why would you need this after trying it 1-2 times? Can't one remember that you're only allowed 1-3 drinks?
A: 1. In a perfect world, everyone would stick to this simple rule: "If you've had anything to drink at all, simply don't drink and drive." In the real world, however, people will continue to drink and they will continue to drive. The fact is there are just TOO MANY VARIABLES affecting a person’s BAC (i.e. age, weight, gender, ethnicity, liver function, amount of food digested, other drugs/medication) for any of us to know with certainty whether we are under/over the limit. Fortunately, the use of fuel cell breathalyzers virtually eliminates guesswork and allows you to make an informed decision before getting behind the wheel.
2. Professional breathalyzers do more than just determine whether you are under/over the 0.08% BAC limit, they provide a precise reading. Users can use that information to learn about how alcohol affects their body, how the aforementioned variables can affect their BAC, how their BAC compares to other people under similar conditions, and more. 
3. Almost everyone knows that driving with a BAC of 0.08% or higher will result in an automatic DUI or DWI. However, most people are surprised to find that, in many states/provinces/countries, you can be arrested for DUI or DWI while under the hard limit of 0.08%, if you are found to be significantly "impaired" [you cannot operate a vehicle as safely as if you were sober]. 
4. There is a reason why the breathalyzer market is valued in the hundreds of millions (USD). For more information, check out: http://wintergreenresearch.com/reports/breath_analyzer.htm
5. We understand our product, along with any breathalyzer, is not a perfect preventative measure to counteract drunk driving. We know that not everyone will agree with our approach and many will think it is "ineffective" in terms of % of lives saved per use/sale. However, our founders would like to point out and reiterate the fact that even one life saved is a tremendous and worthwhile success. To us, that is immeasurable. 
Much more than professional breathalyzer, AURA™ provides a fashionable alternative to existing models with the unique ability to remove negative stigma. By changing perception through design, AURA's mission is to promote preventative measures against drunk driving and life-changing DUI offenses.

*** Please do not hesitate to reach out to INFO@AURABREATHALYZER.COM for any questions you might have. This is the FASTEST and BEST way to reach us! We have found that some comments are not processed correctly and have led to delayed responses. We will work hard to continuously add to this FAQ section as needed. Thank you so much for your continued interest in AURA. ***

story:
Welcome 

  • My name is Tammie Bowden and I am a motivated and inspired independent artist looking to expand my medium into the world of design starting with a simple clothing and fabric business of my own.  Nothing too flashy here folks...just a foot in the door towards getting my work seen on fabrics for manchester and bedding and on clothing such as t-shirts, tank tops, hoodies, track pants and tops, caps and underwear .  I have had some interest from some successful designers who already have clothing ranges of their own but I just dont have the funds to come up with the samples that they want to see before they will give me a start and after having raised five children whilst scratching a living from home, I have decided that its my time to shine!!
  • I have recently begun designing tattoos for people and thought I would expand that into tattoo styled designs for those people who cant quite bring themselves to put a tattoo on their body and like to mix up their artwork.  I am also in the process of designing a couple of character based ranges to cater to the ranges of some of the designers who are already expressing an interest.
  • The magnitude of this endeavour is perceptual.  To some, what I am wanting to do will be redefining and transcendental as they set their own style.  To others it may just be a passing phase.  For myself and my family however, this will be the start of a long yearned for journey as I launch myself full time into doing something that I am really passionate about and my children get to see that dreams really can come true!!
  • Once established I hope to be able to offer other struggling artists the opportunity to bring their designing dreams to life also both with me and on their own via scholarships and grants.   

What We Need & What You Get


  • I am hoping for $10,000 to enable me to obtain copyrighting, purchase design equipment so that I can continue to produce new and better drawings.  
  • I also want to be able to purchase a stockpile of my initial range so that I have them ready to send out when people order them as currently I am having to order as I get the numbers which leaves some people waiting too long, potentially affecting customer service.  
  • I need to have samples made up for designers who have expressed interest in having me design ranges exclusively for them and this means small numbers of each design which costs more to produce but which must be done if I want my work to be considered.  
  • I then need the funds to be able to post or freight these samples to their destinations.
  • Finally I need to be able to advertise what I do and what I have to offer and so I need to have a budget for that.
  • In return for your support I am happy to provide you with clothing and original artworks that are appropriate to your level of pledge or even with a Spiritual Tarot Reading if you are that way inclined as I have been working successfully in that industry for over 15 years and have satisfied clients all over the world.  
  • If I dont reach my goal I still plan to do all of the things that I have outlined above with whatever monies I do raise and will continue to work towards making my dreams into a reality.  
  • IF I DO REACH MY GOAL I ALSO PLAN TO DESIGN AND DONATE 20 TINY GROW SUITS TO THE NICU WARD OF PRINCESS MARGARET HOSPITAL IN PERTH, WESTERN AUSTRALIA, WHERE MY GORGEOUS NEPHEW HUDSON WAS BORN AT 23 WEEKS GESTATION, 7 YEARS AGO AND ONCE SALES ARE UP AND RUNNING, A PERCENTAGE OF ALL PROFITS WILL GO TO SUPPORT YOUTH DEPRESSION!!
  • Pledgers will see my products being advertised and coming out into the market place and if I am able to land a contract with one of the companies I am pitching to then they will be informed about that too.  I will try to keep track of anyone who donates to let them know how things are going and they will belong to a "club" that will receive ongoing limited edition products, samples and perks that other people dont get just for having believed in me when all of this was not much more than a dream!!  This is in addition to receiving their perks for donating.

The Impact

Funding any kind of an art project is too often an uphill climb and for women especially it is no picnic.  I want all women and girls around the world (not to mention my own daughters and sisters and nieces) to see that these things can be done however and to empower other women my age (almost 44) to keep on following their dreams and showing what they can do even when much of the world at large considers them to be over the hill.  It is not a pipe dream.  I can do it...with your help. :)  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you arent able to make a pledge but think what I am doing is worthwhile please do your bit towards making things happen by sharing my campaign link with others.  Dont forget to make good use of Indiegogo promotional tools and thank you so much for your support!!
