My name is Tammie Bowden and I am a motivated and inspired independent artist looking to expand my medium into the world of design starting with a simple clothing and fabric business of my own.  Nothing too flashy here folks...just a foot in the door towards getting my work seen on fabrics for manchester and bedding and on clothing such as t-shirts, tank tops, hoodies, track pants and tops, caps and underwear .  I have had some interest from some successful designers who already have clothing ranges of their own but I just dont have the funds to come up with the samples that they want to see before they will give me a start and after having raised five children whilst scratching a living from home, I have decided that its my time to shine!!
I have recently begun designing tattoos for people and thought I would expand that into tattoo styled designs for those people who cant quite bring themselves to put a tattoo on their body and like to mix up their artwork.  I am also in the process of designing a couple of character based ranges to cater to the ranges of some of the designers who are already expressing an interest.
The magnitude of this endeavour is perceptual.  To some, what I am wanting to do will be redefining and transcendental as they set their own style.  To others it may just be a passing phase.  For myself and my family however, this will be the start of a long yearned for journey as I launch myself full time into doing something that I am really passionate about and my children get to see that dreams really can come true!!
Once established I hope to be able to offer other struggling artists the opportunity to bring their designing dreams to life also both with me and on their own via scholarships and grants.   



What We Need & What You Get


I am hoping for $10,000 to enable me to obtain copyrighting, purchase design equipment so that I can continue to produce new and better drawings.  
I also want to be able to purchase a stockpile of my initial range so that I have them ready to send out when people order them as currently I am having to order as I get the numbers which leaves some people waiting too long, potentially affecting customer service.  
I need to have samples made up for designers who have expressed interest in having me design ranges exclusively for them and this means small numbers of each design which costs more to produce but which must be done if I want my work to be considered.  
I then need the funds to be able to post or freight these samples to their destinations.
Finally I need to be able to advertise what I do and what I have to offer and so I need to have a budget for that.
In return for your support I am happy to provide you with clothing and original artworks that are appropriate to your level of pledge or even with a Spiritual Tarot Reading if you are that way inclined as I have been working successfully in that industry for over 15 years and have satisfied clients all over the world.  
If I dont reach my goal I still plan to do all of the things that I have outlined above with whatever monies I do raise and will continue to work towards making my dreams into a reality.  
IF I DO REACH MY GOAL I ALSO PLAN TO DESIGN AND DONATE 20 TINY GROW SUITS TO THE NICU WARD OF PRINCESS MARGARET HOSPITAL IN PERTH, WESTERN AUSTRALIA, WHERE MY GORGEOUS NEPHEW HUDSON WAS BORN AT 23 WEEKS GESTATION, 7 YEARS AGO AND ONCE SALES ARE UP AND RUNNING, A PERCENTAGE OF ALL PROFITS WILL GO TO SUPPORT YOUTH DEPRESSION!!
Pledgers will see my products being advertised and coming out into the market place and if I am able to land a contract with one of the companies I am pitching to then they will be informed about that too.  I will try to keep track of anyone who donates to let them know how things are going and they will belong to a "club" that will receive ongoing limited edition products, samples and perks that other people dont get just for having believed in me when all of this was not much more than a dream!!  This is in addition to receiving their perks for donating.


The Impact
Funding any kind of an art project is too often an uphill climb and for women especially it is no picnic.  I want all women and girls around the world (not to mention my own daughters and sisters and nieces) to see that these things can be done however and to empower other women my age (almost 44) to keep on following their dreams and showing what they can do even when much of the world at large considers them to be over the hill.  It is not a pipe dream.  I can do it...with your help. :)  


Other Ways You Can Help
If you arent able to make a pledge but think what I am doing is worthwhile please do your bit towards making things happen by sharing my campaign link with others.  Dont forget to make good use of Indiegogo promotional tools and thank you so much for your support!!

story:
The Wild Galleries and Festival Show Grounds


ABOUT US:

My name is Dale Lessard owner of The Wild Galleries and Festival Show Grounds.  I have been passionately involved in the Arts and Crafts for over 25 Years.  When I first became involved in this business I was a certified Master Framer.  I began to delve into buying, framing and selling the works of many true artists from around the country. Starting with framing in my home, shortly afterwards I began hitting the road at Arts and Craft Festivals all over the country.  I developed several long term relationships with artist and craftsmen from coast to coast and it was an honor to be asked by so many of them to frame and sell their works. Years later I opened a very successful Art Gallery on Lake Okoboji in North-western Iowa where I continued buying, framing and selling true art.

I longed to return to my home state of Minnesota and decided to search for my dream. In the process of looking for another location to have a boutique styled Art Gallery, I was looking at a storefront in a little town just 30 minutes North of the Minneapolis St.Paul (Twin Cities Metro Area) called Isanti.  The real estate company handling the property was just 3 miles south of town. I went in to negotiate terms on the store-front property and explained my desires to the agent. The agent then mentioned that the very building we were sitting in and the surrounding 12 acres was up for sale.  I had to pinch myself as I looked around at the beautiful 4000 sq ft custom built home that had been transformed into a real estate office... and the surrounding wooded grounds and prairie land was spectacular.  I could see there would be a lot of work in cleaning up the storm fallen trees and overgrowth but I could literally see my dream coming true.

After a a couple of short months, investing a vast majority of my savings, I was now the proud owner of this place.  By December of 2012 I opened the doors to what is now fondly known as "The Wild Galleries".  With my history in the arts and crafts world and my involvement in festival shows around the country... the potential of this property and what it can mean to not just me, but to my fellow artists and craftsmen, the local community and surrounding region was within my ability to create.  I have begun the journey of what I have always dreamed of for years...  


WHAT ARE WE TRYING TO DO HERE:

One of the most profound things I learned over the years is the love these people have in pouring out their hearts and souls as they produce magnificent works of art and crafts, and no matter where I would go they were just as dedicated to creating things that people will cherish for life and pass those creations on to their loved ones.  They are truly gifted and talented people who add so much beauty to our culture... it is not an easy life at times, but a rewarding one when they persevere through the hard times.

There is one thing that I have witnessed and experienced over the years that really upsets me the most... That is something that is being lost and has become a cancer that is eating up many professional artisans.  It is being done at an alarming rate that has affected not only the artists and craftsmen, but also is a complete injustice to the consumer.  Many festivals have been infiltrated by those who think it is okay to take your hard earned dollars by selling you something that is deemed an art or craft product, but really was mass produced and most often made in a foreign country. When art lovers search out to buy genuine arts and crafts, the last thing they want is to be taken advantage of by someone with an ulterior motive and purchase something far less valuable than something that is authentically hand-made and of intrinsic value. 

The Wild Galleries is not such a place.  We screen every artisan that wants to be a part of what we are doing here before they are offered a presence within the galleries or festivals or both.  Their work must be original, created by their hand and must be of artistic quality and value.  After 25 years in this profession we know what to look for.  We redirect the phony (Buy Sell) artists to sell their wares in flea markets.

The goal of The Wild Galleries and Festival Showgrounds is to bring back to the Arts and Crafts World what is being lost.  We are a place where genuine artist and craftsmen can come to share with our community, our region and to the world, their passionate love of what they produce. A place they can call home.  A place where the art lover can come and find what they are looking for... true arts and crafts.  In the near future, a place where those interested in learning how to create works of art with their own hands, while partaking in educational programs that are under development, such as ceramics, stain-glass, painting, and drawing classes etc... 


WHAT DO WE HOPE TO ACCOMPLISH WITH YOUR SUPPORT:

Not only do we have a vision for the Artisans and Consumers, we want this to be a place that is vital to the local and surrounding communities as well. We have begun clearing out the storm-fallen trees and overgrowth within many lanes of towering pines which is only about 40% completed.  Our goal is to remain conscious of the resident wildlife that traverse in and out of the bordering Athens State Wildlife Management Area, in how we continue clearing what is left.  There will be plenty of woodland areas that will remain untouched and conducive to the local deer, small game, birds and waterfowl populations.   Your support will help us to maintain the entire grounds in a "Park Like" setting that will make this a "Premier Arts and Crafts Festival Show Grounds" and Community happenings place. 

We are inviting local area schools to bring their performing arts such as dramas,plays, musicals and concerts to our showgrounds stage area during our "Summer Theaters". We are also organizing the local and regional farmers to bring their produce to our Thursdays Farmers Market during the harvest seasons.  Another goal of ours is to provide all of the amenities for those desiring to be joined together in marriage.  What an ideal place to host weddings.


Current Community Support:

Several members of the the Athens Township Board have personally toured the Wild Galleries and attended the 3 Art Festivals held our first year in business. We received high praises from the leaders of our community with comments such as "Great Job, we love what you are doing here..!", and "Thank you for bringing this kind of place to our community...!" and "What a beautiful place you have started here...!"

The Athens Township Board also unanimously approved our permits for the Gallery, the Art Festival Show Grounds and our plans for adding on to the Gallery facility, an "Internet Cafe" styled Coffee Shop. 


What We Need

The contributions generated from this Indiegogo Funding Campaign will be applied in a descending order of the following items

1.  Rental of Bobcat and Wood Chipper for clearing out the remaining festival area plan, this include hiring extra laborers to our staff of 3.

$ 7,500.00 


2.  Updated Signage facing the highway

$ 5,000.00 Lit sign  -  $ 20,000.00 Electronic Sign portion


3.  22x40 Portable Stage System

$ 20,000.00 new $15,000.00 used or we build


4.  Industrial Grade Tractor, with Mower and Plow Attachments

$21,650.00- 30,000.00 with attachments - We have small riding mower now but it takes almost 2 days to mow the entire grounds.


5.  Deepwell, Pump-house and Irrigation System (Entire Property) including electric lines

$ 25,000.00


6.  Restroom and Shower Building - (Campground Area)

$ 5,000.00


7.  Portable Full Service Gourmet Food Kitchen

$ 30,000.00 new $ 20,000.00 used


8.  7 - Screen-in Wooden Gazebos

$ 8,400.00


Any extra contributions above and beyond this campaign will be applied to the construction of the "Internet Cafe" styled Coffee Shop, further beautification of the show grounds, and for advertising. 

.

What You Get - (Perks)

$ 25.00 Contribution Range

_______________________________________________________________________

$ 50.00 Contribution Range

______________________________________________________________________

$100.00 Contribution Range

 

________________________________________________________

$250.00 Contribution Range

_______________________________________________________________________

$ 750.00 Contribution Range

______________________________________________________________________

$ 2500.00 Contribution Range

______________________________________________________________________

$ 5000.00 or Greater Contribution Range



The Impact

With our current level of business, including the three art festivals, we have depleted our operating funds to a dangerously low level (we need to replenish this). With regard to a new festival ground, it usually takes about three years for one to become established. We hoped to shorten that some by hosting three shows the first year, which we have done. The Galleries are beautiful and fully open for business, the festival show grounds are 40% cleared.  At this pace we would have to "Boot-strap" this next phase over the next 5-7 years.   

Our goal in soliciting your contribution through our Indiegogo funding campaign, is to:

1. Secure the Gallery and Grounds financially. 

2. To continue the monumental task of finishing off these projects by next Spring. 

This will have a major impact in helping struggling artist now rather than 5-7 years from now.  It will accelerate the ability to use the property for Summer Theaters, Farmers Markets, Weddings and other Community Events that will boost the local economy now and the economic revenue generated by the communities uses of the property will sustain the improvements being asked for in this campaign.  

This is our Passion, Profession and Full-Time Endeavor.  We will do what ever it takes to make this place thrive and become one of the most beautiful Festival Show Grounds in the state of Minnesota.


Three ways you can support our campaign

  • Make a contribution
  • Tell others about us
  • Spread the word on all of your social media

We truly appreciate you taking the time to support this project, the artists and the surrounding communities, and us at "The Wild Galleries and Festival Show-grounds" can not thank you enough...!!!

Check out the Updates Tab above to see the latest video posted... Take a tour of the Inside of "The Wild Galleries" and see some scenes from our Art Festivals.

story:
10 Hours LEFT!!    Thank you to everyone who has helped out!

 

From Sea to See

Not-for-profit organization Terra Nova Art Foundation is raising money to mount an exhibition of the work of Newfoundland artists Peter Wilkins and Will Gill at the most celebrated international art exhibition in the world: The 2013 Venice Biennale. We were overjoyed to receive word in late February that our application to exhibit work was successful. Since then we have been working hard to raise money and figure out the myriad of logistical details to make this happen. It has been a wild two months.

Newfoundland, Canada is one of the most magical places in the world – an island in the North Atlantic home to a wonderfully distinct people, a vast wilderness and the most easterly point of land in all of North America. The ocean brings us icebergs in the spring and humpback whales in the summer. Imagine. It is an inspiring place to make art. Making an art career here has its challenges however due mainly to the small population base, that’s why we are looking beyond our borders to allow our artists to share what they do with the world and at the same time allowing our artists to see what is happening in artistic communities elsewhere. This is how your support will make a huge difference to that end: Will and Peters work will be exposed to the hundreds of curators, collectors, writers and art professionals that attend this event every two years. They will have a chance to meet some of the most recognized artists practicing in the world today. Artists from at least 89 countries participate in the Biennale and attendance figures routinely top 400,000 over the 5 month course of the exhibition.

Time is of the essence. The exhibition opens on the Grand Canal on May 29th, 2013 and runs until early November.

Will Gill is a multi disciplinary artist who works in sculpture, painting, photography and video. His work can be viewed at www.williamgill.ca

Peter Wilkins is an artist who works primarily in photography and video. His work can be viewed at www.wilkins.ws

The Terra Nova Art Foundation is a registered not-for-profit organization based in St John's Newfoundland. It was formed in 2012 with the sole purpose of showcasing Newfoundland and Labrador artists on the international stage. More about the foundation can be found at www.tnaf.ca

What are our costs?

This is an ambitious project but we feel it is hugely important and we are deeply committed to it. The cost of mounting an exhibition in one of the worlds most expensive cities is daunting to say the least. The cost of renting our gallery space for a 5 month period on the Grand Canal (Galleria Ca’ Rezzonico) and the considerable cost of the entrance and marketing fee to The Venice Biennale Organizers will exceed 100,000 Canadian Dollars. Over and above that there is the cost of crating and shipping the work to Italy, staffing the gallery for a 5 month period, printing a small brochure, costs of the opening reception, flights and accommodations for the curators of the exhibition and the artists. There are potentially more unforeseen costs. No matter which way you look at it, its super expensive, but we know it is a project that we will be reaping the rewards from for many years to come.

We have managed to raise approximately two thirds of our costs. One of our challenges has been that the Terra Nova Art Foundation does not yet have charitable status. We are currently not-for-profit status. That has hindered donations somewhat because we cannot issue charitable tax receipts. But in a short period we have still managed to raise a good deal of money mainly through private donations and small grants. WE ARE ALMOST THERE! Your help will make the difference down the stretch!

Your donation will help towards the most sizeable expense we have : the rental of the gallery space. Any money raised over and above the goal of the campaign will help to offset the out-of-pocket expenses that the artists will incur like their flights, accommodations and shipping of work.

All funds (partial or full) that are generated from this campaign will go directly to The Terra Nova Art Foundation with the sole purpose of exhibiting Will and Peters work at The Venice Biennale.

Please have a look at some of the awesome perks up for offer. In the gallery section you will find images of the photographic works for the 125$, 250$ and 1000$ categories.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not all people can help out financially but we would greatly appreciate it if you could spread the word about what we are trying to do, either through social media or good ol' word of mouth.

There are also lots of great sharing tools that Indiegogo has available to take advantage of!

Thank you sooooo much for browsing our page, we truly appreciate the time you have taken to learn about our project!

Have a wonderful day.

story:

We still need your contributions. Ecstasy of a Cripple Part II: WE ARE THE CURE

"WE ARE THE CURE" is the second collaboration between model/poet/mystic Jocelyn Woods and photographer/artist Thomas Dodd. We will be creating a series of images that promote the dynamic empowerment of authentic self-expression, in its capacity to catalyze a cure that reveals incorruptible wholeness.

"Anaïs Nin meets Teresa of Avila."

--Fiona Daly, psychotherapist and Tantric facilitator

"Jocelyn Woods is a Mystical Erotic Visionary. Once you have glimpsed her rapturous art and divine poetry, you will be changed forever!"

--Kama Keshish, erotic revolutionary

"This looks as if it belongs in the Sistine Chapel..."

-- Kim Waldrep Evon, artist

Jocelyn Woods is 27 year-old a model/poet/mystic from Cambridge, Vermont, born with a severe, rare and atypical neuromuscular disease. Unable to stand or walk, she is ignited with a ceaseless passion to share her unusual "ecstasy" with her brothers and sisters. Thomas Dodd is an Atlanta-based artist/photographer who creates painterly photographs in the traditions of the Old Masters, often portraying the bardic juxtaposition of life and death. Jocelyn and Thomas began their convergence in 2012, releasing Part I of Ecstasy of a Cripple: the Resurrection of Passion, a series of images geared towards shattering limiting paradigms surrounding disability, sexuality and immortality. Part II: WE ARE THE CURE shall reunite them this summer of 2013.

Ecstasy and Incorruptibility: the Love Affair

 

"Ecstasy of a Cripple" © 2013 Thomas Dodd

While her experiences of ecstatic union with the divine have been compared to Saint Teresa of Avila, Jocelyn says that "Unhindered by the heavy chains of belief systems which deny and condemn the body as a corrupt condition of sin allows one to enter a rapture beyond the iconic saintly portrayals eulogized in history. To realize the body and soul are but inseparable components, facilitates the alchemical recipe of resurrected immortal flesh. Resurrection is not the product of conditions, but the removal of belief that imposes the conditions of decay and strife, rendering us re-membered of our natural state. It is a passionate love affair, both intensely ferocious--untamed, even feral--and the silence of a peace that passeth understanding, which characterizes incorruptible matter."

Jocelyn's proposition of immortality may seem preposterously outlandish, a hysterical fancy of offset wits, yet it is this very "mad lucidity" that Jocelyn says facilitates the breakthrough from linear mind to effortless genius. Deeply inspired by the leading mystic of the world, Almine, whom Jocelyn describes as "a teacher whom is not the Other, but speaks as though from within my infinite self in a way that I cannot help but overwhelmingly recognize as the Voice of the Mother," she studies the esoteric science behind immortal mastery, and along with her fellow students, is a living example of the miracles thereof. With such testimonies ranging from food and breath being "optional, but not required to survive" to transcriptions from ancient Lemurian, Atlantean and other records, Almine and her students frequently report raptures that go beyond ordinary comprehension.

"Ascension" © 2013 Thomas Dodd

Yet it is not in anecdotal reports or research alone that Jocelyn bases her firey summoning to her brothers and sisters, but from actual experiences facilitated--ironically enough--by exploration of her neuromuscular disease. In a recent interview with David Bollt, CEO of ModelSociety.com, she says:

To hang suspended between life and death can at first be interpreted as a sensation of indescribable heaviness and tension. I have been hung there multiple times, in suffering illnesses, and felt as though I was the burden of flesh hungrily craved by two opposite starving worlds.

Yet it became apparent to me that the dilemma of choosing between the land of the dead or the land of the living only remains a crisis so long as we presuppose the law that only one can be chosen of the two.

In reality they are but mirroring dreams. Upon which shall we shine the flashlight of awareness? It was in beholding the unreality of both dreams that I made the lucid decision to combine two disintegrated parts into remembered wholeness: only then could neither side of the mirror claim me as currency. In the resolution of soul and body one becomes a resurrected being. Upon convalescence from a dangerous respiratory infection I found that the body is most malleable when it is healing. Furthermore, in releasing identification with either the soul or body as disintegrate and tyrannical isolated segments (inaccurate bifurcation causing distortion and externalization), it is remembered as an incorruptible, fluidly renewing field, contrary to the belief that matter is immutable solidity.

It was the sensation of this fluidity that inspired me to begin using the body as an artistic medium in itself. When I model, I feel the body shape-shifting to express the emotive attitude or state of consciousness. The body is an absolutely limitless, living work of art that embodies the disrobed self-recognition of divine perfection.

Billions of dollars are ushered into pharmaceutical research, and relatively minuscule attention is invested into enhancing the quality of life of those living with diseases. The message encoded in the manifestation of disease can never be heard this way. Disease is merely an unsung song. Full expression restores incorruptibility. Soul has virtually gone bankrupt in disenfranchised suppression, selling out to the belief systems that promulgate and peddle the artificial reality of perceived solidity and fatalism. At the benefit of a contrived segregation (yielding the illusion of control), soul and body are antagonistically opposed game pawns and Passion has lain dead. Pornography is the result of the core disempowerment of humankind caused by suppression of authentic sexuality. The images for this series were inspired to catalyze Ecstasy of a Cripple Part I: the Resurrection of Passion, the joining of seemingly diametrically opposed poles in fertile embrace. It is the healing of a core schism. We are the cure we have been waiting for.

Art of the God Hormone

"It is in this spaceless space unfettered by the rationale of thinking we know this or that to be an unmovable truth that effortless genius interprets and broadcasts Infinite Intent, revealing our bodies to be fluid, self-regenerative vehicles capable of producing the God Hormone, whose central purpose is the reception and transmission of divine inspiration," which Jocelyn says is the "plenipotentiary, ever-new yet eternal self-unveiling." It is this which takes the central theme of all Jocelyn's art and poetry. In Bollt’s interview, she says, "Beauty is apocalypse. To loose all identity and feel the parts sucked through you like a cosmic-blowing liquid-honey-orgasm. Perplexion is the goop that bardic wonderment is made of. I want to be so enchanted by Art that I loose my mind. All linear constructs dissolve. It is the penultimate orgasm and yet it has no end. It is eternal unveiling. Apokolipsis ad infinitum."

What’s Next and How You Can Help

Ecstasy of a Cripple Part II: WE ARE THE CURE promises to be yet more daring, venturing into unchartered territories of multi-layered erotic-apocalypse, through an extensive series of images trespassing beyond the confines of the matrix. Scheduled to shoot in July 2013, Thomas and Jocelyn will also begin working experimental Short Films which shall feature the dramatic performance of Jocelyn’s poetry, often composed in non-ordinary states of consciousness through a type of automatic writing.

The funds raised from this campaign will directly enable the following:

  • Thomas Dodd's airfare to/from, car rental and lodgings in Vermont during the shoot
  • Make-up artistry and assistance from the talented Leonis Sayfire
  • Complex and often handmade items from vendors and artisans, including(but not limited to):  an antique bridal headdress, a set of custom-made "body armor" accessories from OrganicArmor.com, REMY hair extensions, hand-sculpted vulva pendants, backdrops and set materials, wardrobe (including a custom item from Australian fashion designer Andru Chrisst), props and accessories, etc.
  • Press release distribution and advertisement of the WE ARE THE CURE campaign and resulting artwork. We want the message of these masterpieces reaching far and wide!
  • Perk fulfillment (high quality art prints, canvases, greeting cards,customized printed t-shirts, etc) We want to give you an abundant participation in the making of this art!

Themes will include the New Jerusalem as a state of Self-Sovereignty, "Feral Fecundity", "The Amrita of Immortality", the "Perpetual Flame", "Autopoeisis", "Chariot of Lions" and more.

You are our audience and our co-creators!  Join us in summoning the Muse...  Choose from the exclusive offers on the right hand side, help spread the word and be sure to subscribe to Jocelyn's fan page for updates at http://www.facebook.com/ResurrectionofPassion 

A Message of Empowerment

"Dance of Veils" © 2013 Thomas Dodd

"One of the few if not only person who can actually touch upon the skies and make us all realize that Heaven and Tartarus lies arm in arm within our selves."

--Bruno Cruz, Argentine poet

"By fearlessly sharing a loving message of universal human beauty, Jocelyn is helping create a world where differences in our circumstance, and physical form become far less important than the light we bring into the world. She truly embodies her message, speaking and relating to others in such a way that a sense of divinity dwelling at the heart of our shared humanity is almost impossible to ignore."

--David Bollt, founder and CEO of ModelSociety.com

The long-awaited Temple of the New Jerusalem, of the prophesied Golden Age is HERE and NOW, if we but live centered in the Self-Government of our Sovereignty. We are beings as vast as the cosmos; everything in our reality a mirror of the Self, interpreted through our unique individual perspective. We are the pillars of the Temple. It is time to utilize our ability to manifest our reality. We are the cure we have been waiting for.

Impervious to the mirrors of reflection, I strip myself naked in revelation.

We are told that NMD is a progressive wasting disease that will eventually kill us from respiratory failure. But "Jerry's kids" are growing up, and the dismal predictions used to gain millions of dollars have proven gloriously false. Rather than prostitute myself for the agenda of medical research fundraisers that promise vague future cures while vastly ignoring the needs of those currently living with NMD, I have inaugurated a campaign to recognize and encourage our ingenious ability to pioneer our own cures; cures that unleash full presence and participation in our miraculous physicality. And the biggest cure of all is authentic expression

No longer do our lives have to be dictated by the trends statistics and prescriptions of a systemized matrix when the power is with the people.

The power is with the people. This statement has long been interpreted politically, as people's right to advocate, lobby, protest and fight for their rights. But what true birthright has to be advocated for, fought for in blood and tears, if it is already ours? You cannot liberate somebody who is already free. It is the deflection of focus from a paradigm valuing external dependence and profitable victimhood that convinces us, by our own acquiescence, that we lack what we already have. It is an error of vision to perceive anything as unwhole when the power of authentic expression is our natural and exulted state.

Some may call this a revolution. I behold a revelation. It is in the revealing of our authenticity that we find ceaseless passion, wonderment, zest and enthusiasm for a life that becomes a Living Work of Art.

I do not call for a demonstration. For decades we have resorted to activism, to the blood sweat and tears of protests, marches, sit-ins, rallies and conventions to procure often slow and laborious results that fall millions of light-years short of the need at hand. It is at a point where we must ask ourselves, my brothers and sisters, Do we wish to continue to burn down the walls, or do we wish to rise altogether above them? For all too often, the mechanistics of a programmed society will rebuild the wall again and again with relentless robotic perseverance just moments after you have given half your blood or even your life to burn it down.

Einstein defined insanity as trying the same thing over and over again and expecting different results. Movements spawn counter-movements which cause counter rebellions in a chain of ceaseless pillaging. Who would we rather be: the robots mechanistically rebuilding the walls or the eagle with vision who flies above them?

For the covert operations that surround us, are but the shadows we cast by our own selves every time we believe in the program of lack.

If we choose to be the eagle with vision, who can fly above the thickest and highest walls or barriers ever known to mankind, then sooner or later we shall soar, and in the vision restored by our soaring we will realize that the walls have never truly existed.

"Maiden of the Apocalypse" © 2013 Thomas Dodd

Americans have long said "I have a dream," only to continue in the slumber, that becomes a garish nightmare of hostility that pits brother against brother, sister against sister.

A dream will remain unbalanced on one side of the equation until the eagle vision goes hand in hand with it. We must see the change we wish to see in the world, because an obscured sight is what makes us think it's not there. By what we see, we create our world. To see beneath the appearances and behold the pristine core of innocence and empowerment is to sweep back the curtains to the temple of that stands here, here in the core of your being.

Many young people with neuromuscular diseases feel disenfranchised from their sexuality. These images not only eradicate societal paradigms that view people with disabilities as asexual, childlike or incompetent; it also serves to stimulate a re-evaluation within any individual’s self-perception, to trigger a radical re-claiming of core empowerment.

Join me in celebrating the cure, for we stand on holy groundless being!

Blessings,

Jocelyn

"Rapture" © 2013 Thomas Dodd

"...Genuinely dumbstruck by the beauty...The images say so many things and something different each time I see them. Most importantly they GIVE something, something I find hard to articulate, like a piece of a jigsaw you did not know was missing. I could stare for hours, swimming warm depths of sense and ecstasy."

--Jonathan Husson, Curator

"...So evocative in many ways it peaks my curiosity and seems to beg questions from me that go beyond what I see...Something else beyond Language."

--Darrell Price, Art Admirer

Thomas Dodd, Photographer/Artist

The artwork that Thomas Dodd creates is visionary in scope and dualistic in nature.  Light and darkness, life and death, and beauty and horror exist side by side in his creations.  Mythological and religious themes abound in his work; sometimes with a twisted tongue-in-cheek approach, and at others reverently paying homage to the Old Master traditions that influence his vision.

Although his artwork resembles paintings, it is actually in the realm of photography, but Dodd’s creations are much more than mere manipulated photos.  There is an overall cohesiveness and attention to textures that one does not usually find in most digital art.  His images have an organic feel that never looks assembled or computer-generated and he shuns the commonly used digital “cut and paste“ clichés, preferring instead to assemble his scenery, costumes and models at the time of principal photography.

The images that Thomas creates are basically a visual equivalent of the music he composed in the 1990s.  Mythological themes and their relations to emotions and psychological states continue to be his primary subjects and motivations.

story:
Help send Jorge to danceWEB

I'm a dancer and choreographer living and working in San Francisco, California and Berlin, Germany.

Recently I've been awarded a prestigious scholarship for a 5-week residency this July-August called danceWEB, and it's at the biggest contemporary dance festival in the world: Impulstanz - Vienna International Dance Festival. So you get an idea of how excited I am, out of over 1,000 applicants from 77 different countries, only about 60 slots were given. !  =)

The programme allows me to live with the other danceWEBbers for 5-weeks in Vienna, and I get to take all the workshops and classes, recieve individual mentorship from the super cool choreographer Ivo Dimchev, see all performances for free, and mostly network with other international artists. 

This is the best platform in the world for me to grow both career-wise and artistically...to be influenced by leading people in the field and for me to influence others...and also get/do more work!

 

Raising the Money!

danceWEB covers 2/3 of the programme costs, and I need to raise the other 1/3 plus travel expenses and per diem so I can eat well and get a beer once in a while. 

This means I need to raise $4300 or almost 3300 euro. (In euros this breaks down to 2150 for 1/3 of the programme costs, 225 for travel from Berlin to Vienna, and approximately 25/day x 37 days). 

As a small way to say thank you, I've posted a few perks on the right. (and I hear they have some nice postcards in Vienna... ;)

 

The Impact

Your contribution helps me at a critical point in my development and career as an artist, and I'll be feeling your support directly throughout the festival residency. 

I've dedicated my life to creating art/dance/performance because i believe that this is the best use of the gifts I've been given. I strive endlessly to fulfill their highest potentials for myself, the environment, those people around me, and to contribute to the future. Call it a calling or vocation or sense of duty, I believe that performing and making performance can change the world, and you would be supporting my humble efforts towards this. 

You can find more information about my work on my website (which is still being worked on) at http://jorgedehoyos.com

You can also browse the Gallery Tab above to look at videos of some of my work!

 

Additional Ways You Can Help

$10 still goes a looong way if you can't really give so much more. I've donated during times of being broke, and it still felt like a good practice in detachment and generosity...but if a spritual pitch isn't enough, how about a big PLEASE?

But seriously, another way to support would be to pass this along and ask a friend or family member to consider donating. Most people are glad to help if they know it's going to a good cause...you could tell them that they're supporting the arts and/or a good friend who has an amazing opportunity presented to him. 

Using the Indiegogo "share tools" is huge and it's also easy to send an email or re-post on facebook. This would be a huge help!
story_txt:
Help send Jorge to danceWEB
I'm a dancer and choreographer living and working in San Francisco, California and Berlin, Germany.
Recently I've been awarded a prestigious scholarship for a 5-week residency this July-August called danceWEB, and it's at the biggest contemporary dance festival in the world: Impulstanz - Vienna International Dance Festival. So you get an idea of how excited I am, out of over 1,000 applicants from 77 different countries, only about 60 slots were given. !  =)
The programme allows me to live with the other danceWEBbers for 5-weeks in Vienna, and I get to take all the workshops and classes, recieve individual mentorship from the super cool choreographer Ivo Dimchev, see all performances for free, and mostly network with other international artists. 
This is the best platform in the world for me to grow both career-wise and artistically...to be influenced by leading people in the field and for me to influence others...and also get/do more work!
 
Raising the Money!
danceWEB covers 2/3 of the programme costs, and I need to raise the other 1/3 plus travel expenses and per diem so I can eat well and get a beer once in a while. 
This means I need to raise $4300 or almost 3300 euro. (In euros this breaks down to 2150 for 1/3 of the programme costs, 225 for travel from Berlin to Vienna, and approximately 25/day x 37 days). 
As a small way to say thank you, I've posted a few perks on the right. (and I hear they have some nice postcards in Vienna... ;)

I strive endlessly to fulfill their highest potentials for myself, the environment, those people around me, and to contribute to the future. Call it a calling or vocation or sense of duty, I believe that performing and making performance can change the world, and you would be supporting my humble efforts towards this. 
You can find more information about my work on my website (which is still being worked on) at http://jorgedehoyos.com
You can also browse the Gallery Tab above to look at videos of some of my work!

story:
We designed and created Stampomatica

A desktop mini-press that works with 3D-printed plates.
You can print your letterpress projects at home from any design.


What We Need

We want to be as open as possible so you know exactly what we did so far, where we stand and what still needs to be done. We are asking for your help so we have the funds to:

  • Complete the first manufacture of 100 units
  • Set up a 3D print on demand service to create plates for your design


What You Get

Every contribution is essential, we'll be thankful for any help and we'd like to express our gratitude with:

$1 | The Crew Leader | Stampomatica on-line contributor certificate.

$5 | The Plate Master | File STL 3D-plate special edition + Stampomatica on-line contributor certificate.

$20 | The Hand-Printed Observer | 1 Lino'sType "Stampomatica limited edition" letterpress poster.

$40 | The Crafter Guild | 1 Stampomatica cotton Apron + 1 Laser crafted Pin.

$75 | The Book Collector | 1 Micro-book "Stampomatica Notes".

$135 | The Artisan Papetier | 1 desktop press (businesscard size, with laser engraved caption "Crowd-lover") + 1 Fedrigoni Paper selection (cotton recycled paper 85 x 55mm - 3.30 x 2.16”) + 3D STL file + guide "How to Print your own 3D plates"  + 2 water-based colours + 1 tile + 1 rubber roller.

$240 | The Ink Minister | 1 desktop press (postcard size, with laser engraved caption "Crowd-lover") + 1 Fedrigoni Paper selection (cotton recycled 148 x 105mm - 5.8 x 4.1")  + 3D STL file + guide "How to Print your own 3D plates" + 2 water-based colours + 1 tile + 1 rubber roller.

$500 | The Printmaker | The Printmaker Pack Limited Edition: 2 desktop presses DIY kits (postcard and business card size, both with laser engraved custom caption e.g. 'Your Name') + 1 Fedrigoni Paper selection (mixed dimensions) + Set of two 3D-printed plates + 2 STL file + guide "How to Print your own 3D plates" + 2 water-based colours  + 1 tile + 1 rubber roller + 1 personalised cleaning cloth.

$800 | The Pressman | The Pressman Pack Limited Edition: 2 desktop presses DIY kits (postcard and businesscard size, both with laser engraved custom caption e.g. 'Your Name') + 1 Fedrigoni Paper selection (mixed dimensions) + Set of four 3D-printed plates + 4 STL files + guide "How to Print your own 3D plates" + 2 water-based colours + 2 tiles + 2 rubber rollers + 1 apron + 2 laser crafted pins + 1 personalised cleaning cloth + poster Lino's Type Ltd.Ed.



Short summary

Stampomatica is a project developed by Tecnificio, maker facility & Lino's Type, hand-made letterpress.

Letterpress + Makers = Stampomatica

Lino’s Type is a letterpress workshop in Verona that aims to give a new perspective to Italian letterpress craftsmanship driving the cultural heritage and passion for traditional typography towards a path of creative development. We believe that little things can trigger bigger changes and we are happy to create small paper goods, with a hint of irony. Lino's Type is the dream and work of Nicola Zago, Laura Veronesi e Stefano Schiavo.

Tecnificio is a “maker facility” in Milan: a reality where multidisciplinary projects grow from self-production and evolves into small series. The design synthesis occurs using machines for micro-scale and additive manufacturing, like open-source 3D printers and laser cutters. Tecnificio was founded in 2011 by two italian industrial designers, Patrizia Bolzan and Marcello Pirovano.



The Impact

Letterpress is something else. The feel of a good impression on soft uncoated paper is something precious and special that we certainly want to continue to experience. However letterpress technology is somehow obsolete: the tools and machineries are very fascinating, but the process gets long and sometimes expensive, especially when printing your custom design with plates. We imagined and created the lightest and most essential version of a press. Stampomatica is a laser-cut desktop press that works with two extremely intuitive levers. We are developing the indispensable letterpress kit with all the tools needed to let beginners and fans approach this traditional technique with updated tools and a contemporary spirit.

We aim to simplify the letterpress process to ultimately encourage this and the future generations to experiment and learn this traditional and fun technique.

For the love of letterpress and innovation.


Press

Two months passed since Stampomatica's launch at Maker Faire in Rome and some of the most influential design blog released their press reviews about our project. 

...“at the intersection of antique and innovation is the duo of Stampomatica analog printing machines: two devices which rediscover the charm of traditional printing techniques, while using cutting-edge 3D printing technology for their manufacture. Individual customization allows users to choose the printing plate’s image, the color of the material and ink, and accessories. the small-scale, portable mechanisms work with simple levers and clamps to stamp the desired graphic onto the page, joining the movable type method with the DIY approach”... 

Designboom 10 / 27 / 2013

(!) Stampomatica was selected among the twenty hottest X-mas news by @ElleDecorItaly (December 2013)




Products

We designed and created Stampomatica, a desktop micro-press that works with 3D printed plates. You can create homemade letterpress prints from any design.

Stampomatica is an opensource project.

The two models of micro-press, presented at Maker Faire in Rome (October 2013), won two Jury Prize (Maker of Merit), we led a workshop during Etsy Craft Camp in Milan and participated to The Others exposition in Turin, during Artissima art faire (November 2013).

The idea met great enthusiasm so far and now we’d like to make it available to fans, letterpress teachers, shop owners, educators and makers willing to innovate their production process.

We need almost 15,000 USD to cover the R&D costs and to start the production of the first 100 machines. The first one will ship to Wales to the teacher who plans to use it during her class, fostering the typographic culture among her students.

Stampomatica is available in two different models: a small handy press to print businesscards and a postcard size lever to create stationaries and paper goods like invitations, announcements, coasters and so on.

This project comes from makers’ spirit, from the know-how ad skills of people that work with technology and experience trough manual practice: cutting-edge tools transforming ideas into shapes and finally into tangible things. The results is a clean and linear object, stripped down to its essential and invested with new meanings.


Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution is precious! Help us spread the word using the Indiegogo sharing tools :) Thank you for reading our story!

Patrizia, Laura, Marcello, Nicola & Stefano

Help us spread the word using the Indiegogo sharing tools :) Thank you for reading our story!Patrizia, Laura, Marcello, Nicola & Stefano

story:
So good...

2011 has been so good for Fusebox we almost don't want it to end. The 2011 festival was the largest to date with over 25,000 people enjoying 36 events featuring hundreds of local, national and international artists. We added two full time staffers, and a fall season of programming that included a series of Digestible Feats events, Haircuts by Children, and a Holiday Stroll.

Here's the deal, we know that 2011 will come to an end, and we are ok with that because we are super excited about what Fusebox has planned for 2012.

BUT, we do not want to let 2011 come to an end with out making one last appeal for your financial support. Tis the season for end-of-year-giving, and we know that you must be reading dozens of these appeals. So our request is that you remember Fusebox when making your end of year charitable gifts, and think of us when looking for some last minute gifts for the contemporary-hybrid-art-lover in your life.

to the point...

Your donation (of any size) helps make sure we can savor the flavor of 2011 a little longer and end the year on a solid financial footing. We will parlay our succes from 2011 into 2012 ensuring that this time next year we are saying, "Twenty-eleven who? Twenty-twelve is where its at!"

what we need + what you get...

Gifts of any size are helpful. Just $12.65 pays a monthly phone bill - and a gift of $500 would help commission a new music performance for the 2012 festival. Gifts of all sizes are helpful and appreciated!   

We have some perks to help spark your imagination including t-shirts and highly discounted festival passes. Our only regret is that we cant ship these perks to you before the holidays. But we will get them to you in early January. Promise.

Many heart-felt thanks for your support this year (and next),
 - Team Fusebox

story:
Hello, I'm freelance artist and illustrator Kei! I've spent the last few years of my life traveling to various conventions around the US selling my original artwork and comics.

One of my favorite items to design, and one of my biggest sellers has always been stickers. The downside to getting stickers created with long lasting, professional level vinyls is having to order in bulk. This can lead to six, four, or even just two designs being upwards of $450. This leaves me unable to devote the funds on my own to get a larger thematic set printed in the best quality I can. That's where this Project comes in.

Why Dinosaurs?

Why not, everyone loves them, and there's such a great variety of designs to use! So many I could have easily made a dozen stickers, and filled a little sketchbook with them. If this goes well, maybe you'll see a birds of the world, or famous monsters sticker set next time, who knows?

Instead of spacing out my order of new stickers for 2014 over the whole year, risking earlier designs being sold out by the time the last few are made, I plan to not only get the whole set printed at once and ready to go for the year, I'll also be bringing down the production costs by combining on shipping. Plus giving supporters some fun little exclusive items as a thank you.

Right now the cost of this IndieGoGo project will cover ordering 125 of each sticker design, and both exclusive addon items, with a small amount left over to cover any unseen shipping costs and fees.

All four stickers will be printed on double laminated vinyl, giving them up to five years of outdoor use, and makes them extra durable for indoor things like computer cases, laptops or notebooks. Each design will be printed and die cut at 4 x 4, or 4 x 3 inches, depended on each design's unique shape.


The postcard is heavy stock, with spot gloss. This will be a design exclusive to this IndieGoGo Project. The notepad is 4 x 5 inches, and has 50 sheets of tear away paper. Another exclusive design.


  • PDF Artbook - $3

20 page collection of sketches and design work used in the creation of the stickers, along with a lot of unused dinosaur species in doodle form.

  • Natural Selection - $5

One randomly selected sticker from the base set, (OR any of the stretch goal designs should they be added).

+Two Bonus Stickers

  • Natural Selection Boost - $10

Two randomly selected stickers from the base set, (OR any of the stretch goal designs should they be added). Cool exclusive Postcard  print, plus the PDF artbook.

+Two bonus stickers

  • Triassic Pack - $15

All four stickers from the base set. Cool exclusive Postcard  print, plus the PDF artbook.

+Two bonus stickers

  • Jurassic Pack - $20
All four stickers from the base set. Cool exclusive Postcard  print and mini notepad, plus the PDF artbook.

+Three bonus stickers

+One randomly picked basic sticker in the base set

  • Draw-a-saur - $50

All rewards from Jurassic Pack, along with any stretch reward stickers added later on. Plus I'll draw you one dinosaur or prehistoric animal of your choice on 4 x 5 inch card stock to include with all your swag

+Three bonus stickers

+One randomly picked basic sticker in the base set

  • Design-a-saur - $150

All rewards from Jurassic Pack, along with any stretch reward stickers added later on. Plus you'll get to pick one dinosaur or prehistoric animal of your choice to not only draw on 4 x 5 inch card stock, I'll turn it into a sticker, and you'll get five copies of this sticker on top of all the the other swag.



  • 100 backers -  If we hit 100 or more backers, a bonus 3x3 sticker will be sent to everyone who backed at Triassic Pack and higher.

*This sticker will not be given out as part of the randomly picked designs in either 'Natural Selection' tiers.

  • $1,000 - A new sticker design added. Backers get to vote on this design. Option for a printed copy of the artbook added as a reward level.
  • $1,500 - A second new design added, once again voted on by backers. A second postcard added and given to any level getting the first design.
  • ???? - More?

US shipping is already factored into all pricing, and overseas shipping is covered in some tiers as well! $6 extra is required on some international packs that require larger, heavier mailers to send out. These tiers will mention the addditional shipping.

Turn around from Project end should run quickly, the stickers are formatted and ready to submit, I'm only at the whims of turn around time for printing, and packing. We're looking at early to mid February for completion.

story:
It is difficult to simply describe my sister, to explain all the wonderful things she has done in this world, and the people she has touched. She was truly an angel - she lived to brighten people's days. 

Healey passed on June 7th, 2014. She set  goals before her bone marrow transplant. She realized she was an artist at heart, and through her writing and artwork she wanted to leave an imprint on the world. 

She would always talk about publishing once she got healthy. She never got a chance, so I am making this account to give her that chance, to spread her art as her legacy. 

We found a short story that Healey wrote a little over a year ago. It is a beautiful tale of a girl finding her independence and inner light and becoming a woman. When I read it after she passed, my heart swelled. One day I thought, I want to read this story to my kids. I just knew I had to get this story illustrated and published. 

I am creating this IndieGogo account to raise money to get this story illustrated and published. And once we get this published, maybe we can work to compile her other words and art, put them all on paper, and give it to the world. 

If you would like to get a little preview of Healey's words, you are welcome to read her blog. 

http://deepthoughtsbyhealey.wordpress.com/

What We Need

We are looking to create a 32-page children's book with 12 illustrations. 

I am new to the self-publishing world. The biggest initial cost will be to find someone who can channel Healey's vision onto paper. It will be a difficult task. Finding the right illustrator is important, and could cost $2,000-$4,000. 

We will also need help in editing and layout, and I expect that to cost about $500-$1000. 

Any leftover money will go towards future publications of Healey's artwork and writing. 

Because Indiegogo takes a higher percentage of the money if we do not meet our goal, I am setting my expectations low. Please don't hesitate to donate more because the goal has been met. This project can cost up to $7,000, and any future project may cost as much.

The Perks

With a $25 donation, you will receive one of five Healey Mandala Postcards.

                                    

With a $75 donation, you will receive all five of the Healey Mandala Postcards. 
With a $50 donation, you will receive an "Art by Healey" t-shirt OR a "Flower Power" tote bag. 

With a $100 donation, you will receive one of the first copies of the published book, along with all five Mandala Postcards. 

With a $200 donation, you will receive a limited edition 11.5" x 17.5" poster print. Only ten of each design will be made. You will also receive all 5 Mandala Postacards and a copy of the book!

With a $500 donation, you will receive all five Mandala Postcards, a t-shirt, all 3 limited edition posters, and a copy of the published book. Not to mention a whole lot of gratitude!

The Impact

The number one goal from this project is to create a physical legacy of Healey's spirit. She has touched so many of our lives - I think it would be special if we, her friends and family, could hold a piece of her imagination. 

And if we make any profit from Healey's work, the proceeds will go towards helping our mom. Our mother dedicated the last five years to helping Healey get healthy, and Healey had planned to take care of her after her recovery. Our mom sacrificed a lot, and I think that if Healey's art could help my mom just a little bit, Healey would smile. 


Risks & Challenges

Publishing a book will be an incredible challenge for me at this time in my life, as I will be starting my second year of medical school. I would appreciate any advice, help, or resources that will help this project move forward. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word to friends and family! The more people that know of this project the better. 

We have really appreciated all the kindness and love that has been sent our way since Healey's passing. We still do!
story_txt:
It is difficult
to simply describe my sister, to explain all the wonderful things she has done
in this world, and the people she has touched. She was truly an angel - she
lived to brighten people's days. 
Healey
passed on June 7th, 2014. She set  goals before her bone marrow
transplant. She realized she was an artist at heart, and through her writing
and artwork she wanted to leave an imprint on the world. 
She
would always talk about publishing once she got healthy. She never got a
chance, so I am making this account to give her that chance, to spread her art
as her legacy. 
We
found a short story that Healey wrote a little over a year ago. It is a
beautiful tale of a girl finding her independence and inner light and becoming
a woman. When I read it after she passed, my heart swelled. One day I thought,
I want to read this story to my kids. I just knew I had to get this story
illustrated and published. 
I
am creating this IndieGogo account to raise money to get this story illustrated
and published. And once we get this published, maybe we can work to compile her
other words and art, put them all on paper, and give it to the world. 
If
you would like to get a little preview of Healey's words, you are welcome to read
her blog. 
http://deepthoughtsbyhealey.wordpress.com/  What We Need

are looking to create a 32-page children's book with 12 illustrations.

story:
Short Summary

Hi all, most of you know me by my real name but we'll leave that for the real world. Let's have a look what has been happening in Miss Turkish Delight's glittery world recently (and before; I'll make as juicy as possible to read I promise). 

Well it's all started by accident to be honest; I bumped into a lady I hardly knew (she is one of my best friends now), she asks me to join their burlesque troupe 'Les Hot Culottes'. This happened exactly 6 weeks after my husband left me (for an older woman, shock!) and I said why not! 2 years and 5 months later I am a free woman and one of the finalist!!! (Hollywood should turn this into a movie and burlesque should be reccomended by HSE for women who are little under the weather, best thing ever happened to me) 

Since then we have been very active, many local appereances (inc 2 Galway Fringe Show and RTE2 filming). I have started dancing solo in July 2013 and I took my first solo ever 'My love Goes Boom Boom' (which is a balloon act to Betty Hutton's It's Oh So Quiet; no Bjork isn't the original) to 3rd International Dublin Burlesque Festival in November. And now Miss Burlesque! 

Miss Burlesque Ireland is in it's first year in Ireland. It has been going on as a regular event in Australia since 2009. The event will take place on 19th July in Button Factory, Dublin. You can check all the finalists on their website missburlesqueinternational.

I am a neo burlesque performer, which means my acts have a comedy aspects and a story line. For the competition we are asked to produce classic, neo and unique act each; which will be a good a challenge for me because I have never done classic burlesque.

There comes the help of yourself!!! I need all the financial help I can get; not just for the costumes/look but also for travelling/over night stay expenses and improve my 'flapper girl' skills. There are atleast 3-4 dates before the actual event that I would need to travel to Dublin; photoshoots, meetings etc. I have to prepare 3 costumes and ofcourse I want them to look as suited to the acts I am doing as possible. I also need to cover the expenses for the 'Elegant Gown Parade'. I want to do my best dancing that charleston on the night; I am hoping to take a few private lessons.

I am the only performer from Galway and I want to represent Galway as  good as I can. Help this 'adopted' Galway Girl achieve her dream. You'll see where your cash went on the night; there will be many photos and recordings of each act.

What We Need & What You Get

I need as much help as I can get. You'll be rewarded with a kiss or kiss and slice of my very famous tiramisu or a kiss, slice of tiramisu and a show at my house (i might throw in cocktail each too) after 19 july. Depending how much yoyos you would like to donate for this sparkly cause.

If I don't reach my goal, everything raised will still be used just for Miss Burlesque related expenses.


The Impact

With your help I should be able attend all the dates I am asked to attend; finish my costumes and polish my charleston skills. 

I believe this is a very big step in my burlesque career, I want to improve and do my best for the future projects and learn more skills. So I can entertain people for many more years to come.


Risks & Challenges

Worst comes to worse I won't be able to attend all the meetings and I'll have unfinished costumes. Ofcourse i hope to avoid that at any costs.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share and tell people about this project. If you cannot contribute it's ok; wish me goodluck and light a candle for me :P

story:
Beûgle est une revue urbaine alternative qui est très fière de promouvoire le bilinguisme de notre region ainsi qu'explorer les enjeux d'un rapprochement non-censuré ou descriminatoire de l'anglais, le chiac, l'Acadien et le français. 

-------------------

Beûgle is an alternative, urban magazine proud to promote our region's bilingualism while also exploring a non-censured and non-discriminatory reconciliation of English, Chiac, Acadian and French langagues.

story:
We are the companion, family and friends of the late Spanish painter Luis Vicente Pascual Cervera. Luis studied at the most avant-garde and anti-fascist art school in Spain – ‘La Massana’ in Barcelona. He lived and worked in Italy for 22 years, but never exhibited here. Over the past two years, we have been working to organize an exhibition that will present his paintings and create a record of his work in an extensive catalogue.
WHO WAS/IS LUIS CERVERA?
Spirit of light, spirit of the air
Not without edges
Rebel
Generous and amusing friend
Infuriating friend
Brilliant mind
Anxious soul
Source of great love and joy
Volatile
Dream-weaver
Old before his time
Child
Sounds contradictory? He was/is. More than rare, he was unique.

Luis believed in painting. His work is expressive and hard. At times it is extracted wholly from within himself, at times abstracted from something figurative. He painted energy – contrasting forces – an impetus and then something that restrained it. And a succession of layers – at times hidden and at others revealed. Strong, deep colors, selected with absolute precision. Through the years, he completed six cycles of paintings and many drawings. When he died he had been working on a series on the Place de la Concorde in Paris. He was fascinated by the contrast between its neoclassical elegance now and its bloody history as the site of the guillotine and the Terror during the French revolution. The month before his death, he had finally scheduled two exhibitions in Italy, one in Arezzo and one in Genoa. Unfortunately, he became too ill to carry out either. We hope this retrospective will be the first of many in Italy and in the rest of the world.

From a journal entry by Luis: “How I’ve desired this moment, in which the apprehension is a small memory, just enough to keep you awake and vigilant. What a beautiful moment!” (from the Spanish).
WHAT WE NEED To fund rental of the exhibition space and the lighting (it’s a social space, not a typical gallery), an opening reception worthy of Luis, a set of limited edition prints and, above all, the exhibition catalogue.
THE DIFFERENCE YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL MAKE Luis affected almost everyone he knew very deeply. He won’t be forgotten. But this first exhibition and catalogue will make the difference between Luis’ art having vanished without a trace – to be stored in some warehouse – or taking its first step towards becoming known in the world.
THE ORGANIZERS Luis’ companion – who is overseeing the exhibition and catalogue together with a close friend of Luis' and the cultural association Accademia degli Inutili – is  an artist who has installed exhibitions internationally and participated in the preparation of many catalogues. We have confirmation from the exhibition space and  printer, and the Italian  critic and curator, Luca Arnaudi, is writing the essay on Luis’ work for the catalogue. Another of Luis' closest friends is a painter, printmaker and professor of art, who will help in the preparation of the prints. Numerous others, among family and friends, offer various forms of art world expertise as well.

story:
Thank you for your time. We hope our campaign inspires you to invest in the work. We love it, we're committed to it, and we hope to see you there. 


ABOUT THE PROJECT

The Nature of Now is a group exhibition. The collection of works serve as new tapestry; a multi-sensory experience of aesthetic thread woven together to create a lyrical story. Suspended between dissonant views of naturalism, existential thought, and mythology, the show is a labyrinthian journey focused on the impasse of nature and man.

(Monstrous Feminine by Shana Robbins)


(The Swamp by Anne Senstad, Sound by JG Thirlwell)

Anne Senstad, Shana Robbins, Brandon Ballengee, and Genevieve Belleveau will exhibit and perform a series of works over a three month period in New Orleans and surrounding areas. The concept probes at-risk culture and ecology, specifically that of Louisiana in connection to it’s own nativity. By examining the systemic order of nature and interpreting the ecological implications of human modification, the work becomes a platform for discussing and bringing awareness to issues surrounding ecological sustainability and the threat it poses to a disappearing land.


(Committed by Brandon Ballengee)

Through collaboration with local musicians, chefs, performers and storytellers the exhibition is often a live event, promoting community through interaction with art. A few collaborators we are proud to include: The Mosquito Supper Club, Matthew Holdren Designs, Marion Spencer, Angel Chen, Nicole Gruter, Rougaroux Sugarshine,and Bring Your Own Stories, Inc.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding for art production and operating expenses. We also need funding for technical equipment and marketing, though most of our promotions will be grass-roots. Any additional funding will go to the artists, as everyone is donating their work and time to the creation of the show. We offering hand-made objects, music and limited edition archival photographic prints (signed by the artist)  in exchange for your good faith in our project.

Risks & Challenges

We are delighted to have fiscal sponsorship through 501c3 organization              Press-Street; all donations are tax-deductible. In addition, we have the generosity of two commercials sponsors, but we will not be able to complete the exhibition without covering our production and operational expenses. Please support our project today!
