story:
Ann Rosenthal and Steffi Domike have been collaborating with Ruth Fauman Fichman, PhD over the past three years on an interdisciplinary project about migration, extinction, and survival. Now we are asking for your help to produce a community-based exhibition and catalog.

Our Project

Moving Targets parallels the 2014 centenary of the extinction of the passenger pigeon with the coerced migrations of our mothers’ families. One hundred years ago, in the wake of the pogroms, Ann’s mother and Steffi’s grandfather fled the Ukraine to begin new lives in North America. Within a decade of their arrival, the uniquely American passenger pigeon was hunted to extinction.

The highways, trains, ships and telegraphs that made it possible for millions of Jews to flee across land and sea made it equally possible for a hungry American population to track and plunder passenger pigeon nesting sites. To make sense of the contradictions of these concurrent narratives, we look at where these two worlds overlap, and ask why some communities, whether human or animal, have been targeted for extinction.

Moving Targets is comprised of three sections: Flight and Nesting conveys the story of the passenger pigeon (shown below at Brushwood Center at Ryerson Woods near Chicago):

Flight and Landings is about our families’ migrations (shown below at Duquesne University, Pittsburgh):

and the Passenger Pigeon Portrait Gallery features 14 artists, each representing a state within the bird’s former nesting range (shown below at University of Michigan, School of Natural Resources and the Environment). See the individual artists' works in the Gallery section of this site (link at top of page).

While texts, including Joel Greenberg’s A Feathered River Across the Sky (2014), provided a basis for understanding the pigeons, there was no comparable source about our own families. Dr. Ruth Fauman-Fichman worked with us to research our family histories and create four posters that interpret the Jewish Ukrainian Diaspora. 

What We Need & What You Get

With your help, our catalog of the four 2014 showings of Moving Targets will be launched at Christine Frechard Gallery in Pittsburgh on August 29. (Below: catalog page spread mockup.)

The project will be featured in the gallery during September, and we will hold a community workshop on cultural migrations. The catalog will serve as a lasting record of the project and will include reproductions of the artworks and six essays by prominent historians, scientists, and artists.

We need to raise $7500 which will cover costs for:

  • catalog photography and design
  • printing and supplies for the exhibition and workshop
  • exhibition reception
  • publicity and outreach for the exhibition and workshop
  • honoraria and a catalog for each of the included essayists
  • a catalog for each of the Portrait Gallery artists

We have seven unique perks to accommodate any budget! These include greeting cards (blank inside) with images of Moving Targets artwork; pigeon flock silk scarves; pigeon pie aprons; catalogs; and museum-quality, frameable, art prints. Mix and match the perks to get the products you want!  For example, for $75 (combining the Squab and Flock perks) you will get a greeting card pack and a scarf. In addition, for contributions of $50 or more, we will send you 8.5" x 11" reproductions of our posters recounting the history of the Jews in the Ukraine as an additional perk!

Thanks & Other Ways You Can Help

Once you've made your contribution, please help us spread the word by sharing this link with your colleagues, friends, and family: http://igg.me/at/movingtargets Thank you so much for supporting Moving Targets!


For more information see the project website: http://www.atrart.net/moving-targets

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

Heya!

I'm Joe. or JWMHP.

I'm an ex-Barista, now Woodworker, Mixtaper, and aspiring Poet. And sometimes I'm a gentleman. 

What I'd like to do is take a break from the Feast and Famine of (sub)Contracting and sit here at my desk and write down all the Highly Incredible things that i think about when the saws are blazing.

Since 1999 or so, (and moreso throughout hospital stays during 2000), I've been picking away at poems and letters trying to find my voice. I think that in the last couple years, I've found it. I have some things I need to get off my chest (they're not 'Moobs', they're "Mreasts" and they're badges of wisdom).

It's been a long journey, 60lbs (and counting), a metric tonne of Ballentine's empties, some mean things uttered loudly in the night, and lots of little gifts spread around Vancouver.

...I think what I have to say, if I can say it correctly, has some value. I've no illusion that it's anything new, mind you... just... uniquely me.

So Here it Goes:

I'm Adopted. Among a handful of other really mind-bending Experiences and Transgressions, (both positive and negative), having a pair of unbelievably solid Parents for 36 years doesn't necessarily guarantee that One True feeling of Wholeness.

I joked to a couple friends last Weekend, that I wanted to Make just enough Viable Art to become visible enough that My Birth Mother might Find Me... My Real Mom prepared all the papers Years ago on my behalf, and Being the complacent, patient procrastinator I Am, I never did fill out those papers let alone send them off. Frankly Some Ghost from 36 Years ago hasn't until now, been worth the $100 it costs to register your name in an active search Database...

Anyway. Enough about that for now.

I have a touch of the OCD and compulsively make what the Kids call 'Mixtapes' to process through my thoughts and feelings whenever I feel it necessary. I've been making one every day since July 1st, having been given the gift of pure Joy by a few folks from a Vancouver Arts Magazine called SadMag... More than a little appropriate if you read on...

Now It's August 4th, and I have just completed the Outline to the Creative Non-Fiction novel you, if you choose to do so, will be helping to finance for my goal of a December completion so (you guessed it) When I engineer a way to get both my Mom and my Dad in this year's "secret" Santa draw... I won't have to waste the $75 dollar value ceiling, and instead I can invest in some paraphernalia to maybe try and quit smoking for Real. Again...

Your help with some cashish would maybe tie up the remainder of my personal therapy, cover some bills, and allow me to make-good on several IOUs i have with friends.

If you're curious what a Mixtape in the 21st century looks like, you can visit a database of my first Phase: clemhill.blogspot.ca  ...or the more Loose, Canonizeable Second Phase: poachingperfection.blogspot.ca XO

What I Need & What You Get

I'm hoping for 13 large. It's an arbitrary number, but i Think it's a modest enough amount for the next 6 months' work, and I like the number 13. It doesn't cost much to live in the country and to write a big book. I just have to make sure the rent's paid and the dog's fed. The rest I can handle.

As mentioned above, I'm a woodworker. Most people who know me, know I would rather make a gift for a person than make something for money to buy smokes.

While I'm writing, I would love to make you little treats. Things like Trophies, Cribbage Boards, Chess Boards, Soap Dishes, Mixtapes, Wood Art for your walls, and Knick-Knacks for your windowsills. Mementos of our time together.

If it happens that I don't achieve my monetary goals through this platform, well... I'll take what I do get and pay what rent I can, buy the dog slightly cheaper food, and quit smoking. AGAIN. It's no big deal, really. I'll find another way. I just reeeeaally want to be able to take a bit of a break from making things I'm not always passionate about, and make (for a while at least) things I'm really excited about. And then SHARE them!

The Impact

As I mentioned: The Idea here (write a book/share presents) isn't at all a new notion. That's I think why this platform exists. I have at least two friends who've been able to release masterpieces of music through this route.

So the "Impact" here, in my opinion, is kind of allegorical (?) for, well... For at least a half dozen folks I know. The other 200 or so probably had this kind of personal growth and Oneness figured out Years Ago.
We're all unique little snowflakes with dreams and cold, intricate refractions of light inside of us. ...So my contribution to world with this moldy idea? Just to fortify the fortress of my unbroken heart, focus the voices in my ears to say something valuable, and share in the waging of this battle against lonliness.

Trust me. I think it might be awesome.

Risks & Challenges

I am BiPolar. I do take some medications. Sometimes I take a little too much of the wrong ones. I'm almost completely over the worst parts for now. The love of a good person, a close family, a small group of very supportive friends, and an oxford comma have vowed to help me not lose the plot again.

I've spent the the first 3 weeks of July seeming to Go Off the Rails, and the last week Floundering off the tracks altogether. True Story. So many calls, rides, tears, and taunts from friends and loved ones who -- not out of doubt or malice (as I sometimes think they do) but -- out of plain-old Love and Care... As mentioned above somewhere, I think the Clarity I've felt since about Mid July has merged into a community feeling of trust that I Am Okay. I was never completely sure, but I am Now.

After all, As I told a friend a ways back, It's not up to us to hold onto and box together our brothers' and friends' terrors and dreams, but to Trust them as long and as far as we can, and then Swoop in to Put the pieces back together if Shit Really goes Pear-Shaped...

With your trust and help I can relieve the people I really love dearly of some of the financial support. (and I can even pay them back! whoa)

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Nobody I know has any money. I never worry about it until someone else asks me for some. So if money's not your thing... If you're Rich in Love but Poor in cash, well... Share my desire to make everyone presents while writing a little something to share with you later. I'll be here, spooning with my beautiful Dog. XO

    PS: As of this night, August 4th, there are 28 Days Left in the Campaign. This is going to sound like a bit of a joke (and if you know me, it is), but that's the length of time taken for A) Sandra Bullock to get through Rehab, and B) Cillian Murphy to wake up and find England overrun by fierce, red-eyed Zombies. So... Thanks for giving us some more time together by reading right to the end here. XO

story:
Who am I and What is Art Basel?

My name is Chaz Well, I am a senior painting major at the University of Hartford Art School graduating in the spring.  My paintings are a mix of abstract expressionism and street art, and I also take it to the third dimension and make sculptures.  To see  pictures my work and personality check out my instagram and follow: @chazwellz.  
I have recently applied to intern for a WEEK at the Bass Museum to work Art Basel Miami, which is one of the BIGGEST art festivals in the world (the other one is in Hong Kong), and I was one of five that got accepted!  All the major contemporary artists, gallery owners, museums, collectors, and art works from all around the world WILL BE HERE!  For more information about it check out www.artbasel.com

EVERY PENNY COUNTS!

I hate to ask for money like this, but the school doesn't pay for my flight and hotel which in total comes to around $850 ($470 for the hotel/$380 for the flight there and back).  Food is also on my own when I get there and my money has been going to art supplies to finish assignments for school.

SO I WANT TO GIVE BACK TO YOU!!!!

Each level of donation will get a special prize, the more you donate the better the art you get! 

The Impact

My goal is to be one of these artists one day SHOWING work there.  Interning and BEING THERE IS HUGGGGEEEEE!!!!!  This will give me a chance to meet all these people that can help my art career entirely, and I want to share my knowledge and what I will be learning to other students so they can benefit as well. So help me make my dreams come true and in return I will give you a piece of me.

story:
Welcome to the

INTERNATIONAL DANCE 4 POSITIVITY-LIVING BREATHING COLOR WHEEL-(HUMAN COLOR WHEEL)

My name is Patricia AIshah.  I want to THANK YOU for taking a few minutes to check out my art project. 

I am asking you today to support my project financially and share your support with like minded friends who see the value in creating an INTERNATIONAL pARTICIPATORY work of art with a message of POSITIVITY for all to share.  Whether you have $5.00 or 500.00 to donate, please consider joining my efforts.

The concept is very simple.  To create a giant Living Breathing Color Wheel Dance 4 Positivity by giving away 111 beautiful Silk Veils to perfectly great strangers from all over the world at 11:11 AM in the Black Rock Desert of NV. 

With an attendance of over 50,000 people from all 7 continents, I am certain to have an overabundance of eager pARTicipants to BE THE ART !!!  These veils will be gifted to all the pARTicipants with the idea that they will take them out to the world and SHARE the experience, spreading the POSITIVITY around the world.

MISSION STATEMENT:   

  • Through dancing with intention, put the term POSITIVITY into the forefront of our consciousness
  • To create a HUMAN COLOR WHEEL, a Living Breathing Work of art where both the art and the artists are made from everyday people, people who may have never thought of themselves as an artist or performer
  • Create a more positive outlook within the hearts and souls of individuals
  • Encourage these individuals to travel & share this positivity with the intention of expanding the experience above and beyond our local communities into an ever growing spiral that will eventually encompass all of Earth and bathe our limitless Universe in a more positive light.
I am budgeting $23.00 each for 111 veils.  This will cover my cost and for the veils, the incientives AND incomes taxes I will need to pay as this is not yet set up as a non profit.

If you donate a minimum of $25.00 or more we will send you a hand signed limited edition postcard COMPLETE with playa dust from the playa at Burning Man.  (I am especially thinking of all of you who cannot make it the the Burn this year.)

For your $50.00 Donation you will receive an authentic International Dance 4 Positivity – Living Breathing Color Wheel Veil, and the limited editon postcard

For $250.00 or more you will receive your very own set of 6 International Dance 4 Positivity – Living Breathing Color Wheel Veils, and the limited edition postcard so you can start your very own color wheel right at home

So please donate what you can… & PLEASE SHARE this project with all your friends and family.  With your help and generous donations we will certainly share the  POSITIVITY not only at Burning Man but world wide.

And if by chance we do not make our goal we still have the event.  We will use the money to purchase as many veils as we can and send our as far an wide as possible.

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR TIME, ENERGY and GENOUS DONATIONS!  You are helping to make a lot of dreams come true!

I would like to close by reading to you a poem that I wrote for the Dance 4 Positivity – Living Breathing Color Wheel.  It is an invocation for reading before each dance.

Young â˜¼ Old â˜¼ Woman â˜¼ Man
Black â˜¼ White â˜¼ Red â˜¼ Yellow â˜¼ Blue
And everything in between…

As we gather here,
in this moment in time
Let us experience
Love * Peace * Happiness * Joy
And everything positive
We could hope for…
And make it real
within our heart & soul

Let all troubles dissipate,
leave them behind
As we set ourselves in motion
Let the wind & the light
& the love of the Universe
Unwind

And carry us to a place far far away
A place within
Where our fires are set aglow
Burning hot, burning Bright
Like the shining stars
We are meant to be…
Like we already are…

and like the veils,

And the Color of our Skin

Black, white, red, yellow and blue
And every color in between…
Let us celebrate our Uniqueness
And Together as we unite
in a Human Wheel of Color,
Let us celebrate
our Oneness

And as we lift our veils high to the sky
And reveal our true selves
Let our positivity
Expand and grow
Until with abundance
it overflows…

So when we part
And go our separate ways
We will spread this positivity
And let it grow,
and glow
And keep it real
In our heart and soul
Now, this moment
and throughout eternity

May the spirit of POSITIVITY
guide your heart, mind & actions…
-Patricia “Aishah from Hercules"

I also want to give special thanks to all my family, friends, dance brothers and sisters and PERFECTLY GREAT STRANGERS who have supported and encouraged me throughout the life of this project.  THANK YOU AGAIN!

Dance4positivity@yahoo.com

http://www.meetup.com/SF-Bay-Area-DANCE-4-POSITIVITY-LIVING-BREATHING-COLORWHEEL

https://www.facebook.com/PatriciaAishah

 

!!! Volunteers needed.  Please contact me for more information. 

THANK YOU... and hope to see you on the Playa!!!

story:
Short Summary

Quick Note:100% of your funds backing, will go towards product purchase on my online clothing store launch as an option for you(please save your receipts)!

I believe in empowering women with reawakening their divine goddess through the artistic talent i express through my loving clothing designs. I believe in sharing my artistic expression of love, so I can hug women through my clothing. When you wear my goddess wear, im really hugging you. If your a man, thank me for beautifying your view all around the world. :-)

My story began as an artist. I joined a community of spiritual festivals where creativity was booming, like burning man, lightning in a bottle and coachella. From there i took my artistic creativity and started designing through the medium of clothing. As I awakened my higher self, i had a desire of awakening the divine femenin goddes through dressing women, with my loving divine creative wear. To the divine feminine of the world, i want to say, i love you, your reawakening of the divine goddess is important to me, your joy your beauty your fun in wearing my divine diva goddess clothing, is what I live for and its my mission in this lifetime, so enjoy, and thank you for your support, woman or man! Thank you!

More about me: North Hollywood, is where i live. I was born in the Dominican Republic, im latina, i speak spanish and english. Mother is dominican, father is english. I am an artist at heart.


The Impact

  • My project is valuable to the world because its medicine to awaken consciousness of the divine goddess. It just happens to be expressed with clothing.

Risks & Challenges

Possible obstacles are finding the right production company to create the clothing, however i am quite confident that from refferals i can find a great manufacturing company for my inventory. I already have plenty of contact that are guiding me to the right trustable people.
I am an online marketing newbie, however I have a coach and consultant specializing in this field so i dont lose money in marketing cost due to lack of experience.

story:
About Me

I’m a 3D and motion design artist, currently involved in Four Plus which is a small design collective, with a strong branding, web design, 2D and 3D motion graphics expertise. Learn more about our team, studio and portfolio at Four Plus. You can watch our showreel here

About The Project

Thanks so much for checking out my project. The concept is very simple and comes from my love to create nice motion graphics. The idea is to create different logo animations for different people. It is applicable for both people and companies, as simple as that. Each contributor will receive a unique, custom made and professionally animated motion graphic of their logo. It could be a personal logo or a logo of their business, presentation, band, brand, blog, etc. Pretty much anything (nothing obscene or inappropriate though).
Then, all the animations will be brought together in one big showreel. The scale of the project could be pretty huge, depending on the number of contributors.

About The Shorts

Upon successful funding transfer, I'll reach out to each contributor in order to get detailed information about their logo and company or idea behind the logo. Please note the perk levels carefully. Let’s face it, $125 is really, really cheap for motion graphics. The animation will be 5- 10 seconds long and revisions based on contributor’s feedback won’t be included in those lower levels of funding. There are higher levels with more options. However, I am absolutely committed to design unique and quality animations that serve the needs of the contributors. I will not produce anything that I wouldn't be proud of as an artist. If you have any questions about the animation process, just let me know.
I want to let everyone know that the time spent on each individual animation may be limited and it varies between 1- 4 days, depending on the perk level.
In order to make everything clear I will contact every contributor and establish a deadline for their animation. However, creating high quality animations in a limited amount of time probably won't be easy, but I'm excited to push my inspiration and creativity to new limits.

About The Funding

Overall, you can think of it this way - contributors get a unique, custom made animation of their logo, while I get the opportunity to do what I love to do - creating nice and creative motion graphics. I hope that the project will be interesting for you and I will do my best to make all my contributors happy and satisfied with the final result of my work.

story:
----------------------------------------------

version française ci-dessous

----------------------------------------------

Short Summary

With your help, the Independent Media Arts Alliance (IMAA) will launch an inaugural National Media Arts Prize in June 2014 that will recognize Canadian independent media artists.

We are looking to establish a prize similar to those existing in other arts sectors.  Arts prizes national in scope exist for litterature, visual arts, music, theatre, but there are no prizes that honour the independent media arts exclusively. These cash awards are valued anywhere from 10K – 50K.

What is Independent Media Art? 

The term media arts applies to all forms of time-related or interactive art works that are created by the recording of sounds, visual images, or use new technologies. These art works are creative expressions and encompass the fields of film, audio, video and computer, digital, electronic art. 

It’s exhibited everywhere from art galleries to movie theatres, on the web, in public space and even on cell phones. As technology progresses artists are eager to use new tools to reflect the world around them. Even Salvador Dali who is best known as a surrealist painter experimented in film in the early part of the 20th century. In the 1960’s, video technology was introduced and since then media art has grown to include digital and electronic media. Independent means that the artist initiates and is the driving force behind the work and maintains complete creative control over the work. Media art is all around us.

Independent media artists deliver thought-provoking works, and are continuously challenging our underlying perceptions. Media Artists dedicate their lives to the field; by choosing to maintain complete creative control over their work they make sacrifices, pool resources from a number of sources including their own financial contributions to realize their productions.

As it stands, this critical aspect of the creative process is so crucial as we live in an increasingly commercialized world dominated by mainstream media. Independent media artists contribute to the democratic process by giving voice to individuals within a diverse society. By supporting independent media artists and recognizing their valuable contribution to our everyday lives, we further diversity of vision in artistic expression, technology and social consciousness.

It is important that the winner is selected by a jury of peers, given the nature of independent media art, we feel that a committee of fellow media artists and professionals in the field will be the best people to assess the quality of achievement in terms of creativity, innovation and impact within the sector. 

The IMAA is a member-driven non-profit organization with charitable status working to advance and strengthen the media arts sector in Canada. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our objective is to raise a minimum of 20 000$ to launch this inaugural prize.

The ultimate goal is to award a mid-career artist with a significant cash prize to acknowledge their contributions to the sector and to the cultural community.  Funds raised through this initiative will also be used to promote the artist and the prize by creating a video, purchasing ad space, publishing press releases, and covering travel expenses for the winning artist to attend the National Media Arts Conference taking place in June 2014 where they will be presented with the prize at an award ceremony.

In exchange for your support, we can offer some perks to KiloByte Sponsors, MegaByte Sponsors, GigaByte Sponsors, TeraByte Sponsors, PetaByte Sponsors, ExaByte Sponsors and ZettaByte Sponsors.

If you, or your company wishes to fund the full prize and in an ongoing way, then we could even name the prize after you! In that case, it is best to contact the IMAA directly to develop the prize and the benefits together: (514) 522-8240 www.imaa.ca

The Impact

By establishing a prize like this, we put the spotlight on media artists and their contribution to Canadian society and culture. This prize will encourage many young artists to enter into this dynamic field and empower individuals and communities. We hope to introduce this art form to a larger audience and engage people in this exciting field. Ultimately, we hope to increase visibility of media artists in Canada and abroad, put Canada on the international map for the amazing media art that is being produced here.  Our goal is to strengthen the media arts in Canada and everywhere in the world!

With your help, we want to continue supporting the talented and integral media artists of our nation, but we need the support of the larger community to get this project off the ground!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways you can help:

  • Help us get the word out! Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and/or any other social media platform you have access too – your friends just might just have the means to donate towards our cause. Use our Indiegogo share tools to spread the love! 
  • Send us words of support! We will share your testimonials on our Indiegogo page as well as on our social networks.
  • Donate your artwork! We can add them to our perks and build incentive for funders to contribute to our cause.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Résumé

Avec votre aide, l'Alliance des arts médiatiques indépendants (AAMI) souhaite inaugurer le prix des arts médiatiques en juin 2014 qui reconnaîtra les artistes canadiens en arts médiatiques.

Nous cherchons à établir un prix similaire à ceux existant dans les autres secteurs culturels. Les prix en arts de portée nationale existent pour les arts d'écriture, arts visuels, pour la musique, le théâtre, mais il n'existe pas de prix qui rende hommage aux arts médiatiques exclusivement. Ces récompenses sont généralement évaluées autour de 10K - 50K.

Que représentent les arts médiatiques indépendants ?

Le terme arts médiatiques s'applique à toutes les formes d'œuvres d'art liées au temps ou intéractives qui sont créés par l'enregistrement de sons, d'images visuelles, ou par l’utilisation de nouvelles technologies. Ces œuvres d'art sont des expressions créatives qui englobent les domaines du cinéma, de l’audio, de la vidéo et de l’informatique, du numérique, de l'art électronique. 

Exposé partout, des galeries d'art aux salles de cinéma, sur le web, dans l'espace public et même sur les téléphones cellulaires. En même temps que la technologie progresse les artistes sont prêts à utiliser de nouveaux outils afin de refléter le monde qui les entoure. Même Salvador Dali qui est surtout connu comme peintre surréaliste a expérimenté avec le film au début du 20e siècle. Dans les années 1960, la technologie vidéo a été introduite et, depuis, l'art des médias a augmenté pour inclure les médias numériques et électroniques. Indépendant signifie que l'artiste initie et est la force motrice derrière l'œuvre, il maintient un contrôle créatif complet sur son travail. L'art médiatique est tout autour de nous.

Les artistes indépendants en arts médiatiques consacrent leur vie à leur art en continuellement remettant en question nos perceptions sous-jacentes. Les artistes en arts médiatiques consacrent leur vie à ce champ; en choisissant de maintenir un contrôle créatif complet sur leur travail ils font des sacrifices, puisent des ressources à partir d'un certain nombre de sources, y compris en utilisant leurs propres contributions financières pour réaliser leurs productions.

Tel qu'il est, cet aspect critique du processus de création est si importante car nous vivons dans un monde de plus en plus commercialisé dominée par les médias traditionnels. Les artistes indépendants contribuent au processus démocratique en donnant la parole à des individus au sein d'une société diversifiée. En soutenant les artistes indépendants et en reconnaissant leur précieuse contribution à notre vie quotidienne, nous créons de la diversité au sein de l'expression artistique, de la technologie et de la conscience sociale.

Il est important que le lauréat soit choisi par un jury de pairs, compte tenu de la nature des arts médiatiques indépendants, nous pensons qu'un comité d'artistes et de professionnels du milieu seront les mieux placés pour évaluer la qualité des réalisations en termes de créativité, d'innovation et d'impact pour le secteur.

L'AAMI est une organisation à but non lucrative dirigée par ses membres qui s'emploie à promouvoir et à renforcer le secteur des arts médiatiques au Canada.

Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Notre objectif est de recueillir un minimum de 20 000 $ pour développer ce prix.

L'objectif final est d'attribuer à un artiste en milieu de carrière une bourse importante pour reconnaître sa contribution au secteur et à la communauté culturelle. Les fonds recueillis grâce à cette initiative serviront également à promouvoir l'artiste et le prix en créant une vidéo, l'achat d'espace publicitaire, la publication de communiqués de presse, et couvrira les frais de voyage de l'artiste lauréat pour assister et être présenté lors de l'inauguration de ce prix à la conférence nationale des arts médiatiques qui aura lieu en juin 2014.

En échange de votre soutien, nous pouvons vous offrir certains avantages qui seront attribués aux sponsors KiloByte, MegaByte, GigaByte, TeraByte, PetaByte, ExaByte and ZettaByte.

Si vous, ou votre entreprise souhaitez financer le prix dans son ensemble et de façon continue, nous pouvons nommer le prix en fonction de vos besoins ! Dans ce cas, il est préférable de contacter directement l'AAMI pour développer le prix et les prestations : (514) 522-8240 www.imaa.ca

L’impact

En établissant un prix comme celui-ci, nous avons mis l'accent sur les artistes médiatiques et à leurs contributions envers la société canadienne et sa culture. Ce prix encourage de nombreux jeunes artistes à entrer dans ce domaine dynamique et à l'autonomisation des individus et des communautés. Nous espérons faire découvrir cette forme d'art à un public plus large et engager les audiences dans ce domaine passionnant. En fin de compte, nous espérons accroître la visibilité des artistes en arts médiatiques au Canada et à l'étranger, positionner le Canada sur la scène internationale de l'art médiatique qui se produit ici. Notre objectif est de renforcer les arts médiatiques au Canada et partout dans le monde !

Avec votre aide, nous voulons continuer à soutenir les artistes talentueux de notre nation, nous avons besoin du soutien d'une communauté pour réaliser ce projet !

Autres moyens de nous aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, voici quelques idées pour nous faire part de votre soutien:

  • Faites passer le message ! Partagez notre campagne IndieGoGo avec vos amis sur Facebook, Twitter, Instagram et/ou toute autre plateforme de médias sociaux dont vous avez accès - vos amis pourraient bien avoir les moyens de faire un don à notre cause. Utilisez nos outils IndieGoGo pour répandre l'idée !
  • Ecrivez-nous ! Vos témoignages seront partagés sur notre page IndieGoGo ainsi que sur nos réseaux sociaux.
  • Faîtes-un don en oeuvre d'art ! Nous pouvons ajouter vos oeuvres aux gains et inciter les bailleurs de fonds à contribuer à notre cause.

 ------------

Bénéfices :

KiloByte Sponsors (25$) Nous avons besoin de vous pour faire vivre ce prix. Nous serons éternellement reconnaissant de ce soutien - chaque dollar compte !

MegaByte Sponsors (100$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Megabyte» sur notre site internet. Votre contribution aidera à rehausser le profil du secteur ! Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.

GigaByte Sponsors (200$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Gigabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet et sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014. Votre contribution servira à reconnaître l'importance du travail d'un artiste en arts médiatiques ! Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.

TeraByte Sponsors (500$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Terabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet, sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014 et sur notre annonce publicitaire. Votre don aura un impact direct sur la capacité de l'artiste lauréat à créer de nouvelles oeuvres, à stimuler sa carrière, à rehausser le profil du secteur ! Vous recevrez deux billets gratuits pour assister à notre gala à Halifax et recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.

PetaByte Sponsors (1000$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Petabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet et sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014. Votre contribution servira à reconnaître l'importance du travail d'un artiste en arts médiatiques ! Vous recevrez une photo encadrée et autographiée du lauréat avec le prix. Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.

ExaByte Sponsors(2500$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Exabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet et sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014. Vous serez également présenté en annonce d’un quart de page de notre programme. Votre don permettra d'accroître considérablement la valeur du prix et contribuera à reconnaître l'importance du secteur, et renforcer la carrière d'un artiste en arts médiatiques ! Vous recevrez une photo encadrée te autographiée du lauréat avec le prix. Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.

ZettaByte Sponsors (5000$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Zettabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet, sur notre page de sponsors et sur notre annonce publicitaire sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014, vous serez mentionné et remercié dans toutes les communiqués de presse et sur les réseaux sociaux, vous recevrez quatre billets gratuits pour assister à notre gala à Halifax. Votre soutien permettra à un artiste en arts médiatiques de créer de nouvelles œuvres, de stimuler sa carrière, de rehausser le profil du secteur et à construire un monde meilleur. Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.
story_txt:
----------------------------------------------
version française ci-dessous
----------------------------------------------
Short Summary
With your help, the Independent Media Arts Alliance (IMAA) will launch an inaugural National Media Arts Prize in June 2014 that will recognize Canadian independent media artists.
We are looking to establish a prize similar to those existing in other arts sectors.  Arts prizes national in scope exist for litterature, visual arts, music, theatre, but there are no prizes that honour the independent media arts exclusively. These cash awards are valued anywhere from 10K – 50K.
What is Independent Media Art? 
The term media arts applies to all forms of time-related or interactive art works that are created by the recording of sounds, visual images, or use new technologies. These art works are creative expressions and encompass the fields of film, audio, video and computer, digital, electronic art. 
It’s exhibited everywhere from art galleries to movie theatres, on the web, in public space and even on cell phones. As technology progresses artists are eager to use new tools to reflect the world around them. Even Salvador Dali who is best known as a surrealist painter experimented in film in the early part of the 20th century. In the 1960’s, video technology was introduced and since then media art has grown to include digital and electronic media. Independent means that the artist initiates and is the driving force behind the work and maintains complete creative control over the work. Media art is all around us.
Independent media artists deliver thought-provoking works, and are continuously challenging our underlying perceptions. Media Artists dedicate their lives to the field; by choosing to maintain complete creative control over their work they make sacrifices, pool resources from a number of sources including their own financial contributions to realize their productions.
As it stands, this critical aspect of the creative process is so crucial as we live in an increasingly commercialized world dominated by mainstream media. Independent media artists contribute to the democratic process by giving voice to individuals within a diverse society. By supporting independent media artists and recognizing their valuable contribution to our everyday lives, we further diversity of vision in artistic expression, technology and social consciousness.
It is important that the winner is selected by a jury of peers, given the nature of independent media art, we feel that a committee of fellow media artists and professionals in the field will be the best people to assess the quality of achievement in terms of creativity, innovation and impact within the sector. 
The IMAA is a member-driven non-profit organization with charitable status working to advance and strengthen the media arts sector in Canada. 
What We Need & What You Get


Our objective is to raise a minimum of 20 000$ to launch this inaugural prize.
The ultimate goal is to award a mid-career artist with a significant cash prize to acknowledge their contributions to the sector and to the cultural community.  Funds raised through this initiative will also be used to promote the artist and the prize by creating a video, purchasing ad space, publishing press releases, and covering travel expenses for the winning artist to attend the National Media Arts Conference taking place in June 2014 where they will be presented with the prize at an award ceremony.
In exchange for your support, we can offer some perks to KiloByte Sponsors, MegaByte Sponsors, GigaByte Sponsors, TeraByte Sponsors, PetaByte Sponsors, ExaByte Sponsors and ZettaByte Sponsors.
If you, or your company wishes to fund the full prize and in an ongoing way, then we could even name the prize after you! In that case, it is best to contact the IMAA directly to develop the prize and the benefits together: (514) 522-8240 www.imaa.ca
The Impact


By establishing a prize like this, we put the spotlight on media artists and their contribution to Canadian society and culture. This prize will encourage many young artists to enter into this dynamic field and empower individuals and communities. We hope to introduce this art form to a larger audience and engage people in this exciting field. Ultimately, we hope to increase visibility of media artists in Canada and abroad, put Canada on the international map for the amazing media art that is being produced here.  Our goal is to strengthen the media arts in Canada and everywhere in the world!
With your help, we want to continue supporting the talented and integral media artists of our nation, but we need the support of the larger community to get this project off the ground!

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can’t contribute financially, there are other ways you can help:


Help us get the word out! Share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and/or any other social media platform you have access too – your friends just might just have the means to donate towards our cause. Use our Indiegogo share tools to spread the love! 

Send us words of support! We will share your testimonials on our Indiegogo page as well as on our social networks.

Donate your artwork! We can add them to our perks and build incentive for funders to contribute to our cause.
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Résumé
Avec votre aide, l'Alliance des arts médiatiques indépendants (AAMI) souhaite inaugurer le prix des arts médiatiques en juin 2014 qui reconnaîtra les artistes canadiens en arts médiatiques.
Nous cherchons à établir un prix similaire à ceux existant dans les autres secteurs culturels. Les prix en arts de portée nationale existent pour les arts d'écriture, arts visuels, pour la musique, le théâtre, mais il n'existe pas de prix qui rende hommage aux arts médiatiques exclusivement. Ces récompenses sont généralement évaluées autour de 10K - 50K.
Que représentent les arts médiatiques indépendants ?
Le terme arts médiatiques s'applique à toutes les formes d'œuvres d'art liées au temps ou intéractives qui sont créés par l'enregistrement de sons, d'images visuelles, ou par l’utilisation de nouvelles technologies. Ces œuvres d'art sont des expressions créatives qui englobent les domaines du cinéma, de l’audio, de la vidéo et de l’informatique, du numérique, de l'art électronique. 
Exposé partout, des galeries d'art aux salles de cinéma, sur le web, dans l'espace public et même sur les téléphones cellulaires. En même temps que la technologie progresse les artistes sont prêts à utiliser de nouveaux outils afin de refléter le monde qui les entoure. Même Salvador Dali qui est surtout connu comme peintre surréaliste a expérimenté avec le film au début du 20e siècle. Dans les années 1960, la technologie vidéo a été introduite et, depuis, l'art des médias a augmenté pour inclure les médias numériques et électroniques. Indépendant signifie que l'artiste initie et est la force motrice derrière l'œuvre, il maintient un contrôle créatif complet sur son travail. L'art médiatique est tout autour de nous.
Les artistes indépendants en arts médiatiques consacrent leur vie à leur art en continuellement remettant en question nos perceptions sous-jacentes. Les artistes en arts médiatiques consacrent leur vie à ce champ; en choisissant de maintenir un contrôle créatif complet sur leur travail ils font des sacrifices, puisent des ressources à partir d'un certain nombre de sources, y compris en utilisant leurs propres contributions financières pour réaliser leurs productions.
Tel qu'il est, cet aspect critique du processus de création est si importante car nous vivons dans un monde de plus en plus commercialisé dominée par les médias traditionnels. Les artistes indépendants contribuent au processus démocratique en donnant la parole à des individus au sein d'une société diversifiée. En soutenant les artistes indépendants et en reconnaissant leur précieuse contribution à notre vie quotidienne, nous créons de la diversité au sein de l'expression artistique, de la technologie et de la conscience sociale.
Il est important que le lauréat soit choisi par un jury de pairs, compte tenu de la nature des arts médiatiques indépendants, nous pensons qu'un comité d'artistes et de professionnels du milieu seront les mieux placés pour évaluer la qualité des réalisations en termes de créativité, d'innovation et d'impact pour le secteur.L'AAMI est une organisation à but non lucrative dirigée par ses membres qui s'emploie à promouvoir et à renforcer le secteur des arts médiatiques au Canada.
Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez
 Notre objectif est de recueillir un minimum de 20 000 $ pour développer ce prix.L'objectif final est d'attribuer à un artiste en milieu de carrière une bourse importante pour reconnaître sa contribution au secteur et à la communauté culturelle. Les fonds recueillis grâce à cette initiative serviront également à promouvoir l'artiste et le prix en créant une vidéo, l'achat d'espace publicitaire, la publication de communiqués de presse, et couvrira les frais de voyage de l'artiste lauréat pour assister et être présenté lors de l'inauguration de ce prix à la conférence nationale des arts médiatiques qui aura lieu en juin 2014. 
En échange de votre soutien, nous pouvons vous offrir certains avantages qui seront attribués aux sponsors KiloByte, MegaByte, GigaByte, TeraByte, PetaByte, ExaByte and ZettaByte.
Si vous, ou votre entreprise souhaitez financer le prix dans son ensemble et de façon continue, nous pouvons nommer le prix en fonction de vos besoins ! Dans ce cas, il est préférable de contacter directement l'AAMI pour développer le prix et les prestations : (514) 522-8240 www.imaa.ca
L’impact
En établissant un prix comme celui-ci, nous avons mis l'accent sur les artistes médiatiques et à leurs contributions envers la société canadienne et sa culture. Ce prix encourage de nombreux jeunes artistes à entrer dans ce domaine dynamique et à l'autonomisation des individus et des communautés. Nous espérons faire découvrir cette forme d'art à un public plus large et engager les audiences dans ce domaine passionnant. En fin de compte, nous espérons accroître la visibilité des artistes en arts médiatiques au Canada et à l'étranger, positionner le Canada sur la scène internationale de l'art médiatique qui se produit ici. Notre objectif est de renforcer les arts médiatiques au Canada et partout dans le monde ! Avec votre aide, nous voulons continuer à soutenir les artistes talentueux de notre nation, nous avons besoin du soutien d'une communauté pour réaliser ce projet !
Autres moyens de nous aider
Si vous ne pouvez pas contribuer financièrement, voici quelques idées pour nous faire part de votre soutien:


Faites passer le message ! Partagez notre campagne IndieGoGo avec vos amis sur Facebook, Twitter, Instagram et/ou toute autre plateforme de médias sociaux dont vous avez accès - vos amis pourraient bien avoir les moyens de faire un don à notre cause. Utilisez nos outils IndieGoGo pour répandre l'idée !

Ecrivez-nous ! Vos témoignages seront partagés sur notre page IndieGoGo ainsi que sur nos réseaux sociaux.

Faîtes-un don en oeuvre d'art ! Nous pouvons ajouter vos oeuvres aux gains et inciter les bailleurs de fonds à contribuer à notre cause.
 ------------
Bénéfices :
KiloByte Sponsors (25$) Nous avons besoin de vous pour faire vivre ce prix. Nous serons éternellement reconnaissant de ce soutien - chaque dollar compte !
MegaByte Sponsors (100$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Megabyte» sur notre site internet. Votre contribution aidera à rehausser le profil du secteur ! Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.
GigaByte Sponsors (200$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Gigabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet et sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014. Votre contribution servira à reconnaître l'importance du travail d'un artiste en arts médiatiques ! Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.
TeraByte Sponsors (500$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Terabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet, sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014 et sur notre annonce publicitaire. Votre don aura un impact direct sur la capacité de l'artiste lauréat à créer de nouvelles oeuvres, à stimuler sa carrière, à rehausser le profil du secteur ! Vous recevrez deux billets gratuits pour assister à notre gala à Halifax et recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.
PetaByte Sponsors (1000$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Petabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet et sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014. Votre contribution servira à reconnaître l'importance du travail d'un artiste en arts médiatiques ! Vous recevrez une photo encadrée et autographiée du lauréat avec le prix. Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.
ExaByte Sponsors(2500$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Exabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet et sur notre page de sponsors sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014. Vous serez également présenté en annonce d’un quart de page de notre programme. Votre don permettra d'accroître considérablement la valeur du prix et contribuera à reconnaître l'importance du secteur, et renforcer la carrière d'un artiste en arts médiatiques ! Vous recevrez une photo encadrée te autographiée du lauréat avec le prix. Vous recevrez un reçu d'impôt pour don de bienfaisance.
ZettaByte Sponsors (5000$) Vous serez répertorié comme «sponsor Zettabyte» à la fois sur notre site internet, sur notre page de sponsors et sur notre annonce publicitaire sur le programme de la conférence Tidal Force en 2014, vous serez mentionné et remercié dans toutes les communiqués de presse et sur les réseaux sociaux, vous recevrez quatre billets gratuits pour assister à notre gala à Halifax. Votre soutien permettra à un artiste en arts médiatiques de créer de nouvelles œuvres, de stimuler sa carrière, de rehausser le profil du secteur et à construire un monde meilleur. story:
It's not over yet! Exciting Stretch goals:

Woo-hoo!  We did it!  We reached our target!  HUGE THANKS to everyone who has been supporting this campaign!

As if this all wasn't exciting enough, there's more! 

The target of $800, barely covers the costs. 

Let's Hit $1700: I can invest in better equipment for better sound, a better performance, better recordings, better everything, which the performers can in turn use for their own marketing and promotion. 

By raising $3000, the performers can count on receiving compensation that truly values their skills, their time and their hard work.  The performers in this show have agreed to do this for a fraction of what they would normally be paid - a fraction of what they deserve too - because they believe in creating community, in bringing people together, in sharing art and making the world more beautiful.  In turn, you can support them, so tell your friends because anyone can be part of this project and global community of storytelling and art!

------------------------------------------------

The Story Behind the Stories

Hello.  I am creating a show that is a blend of storytelling and visual art.  A show that not only entertains and brings people together but also values the art and act of creation by paying the artists who make it happen.  Three tellers – myself, Tim Ereneta, and Pam Faro – will regale you with daring and thrilling tales of gods, heroes, adventure, and delight.  Magician Keith Boudreau will dazzle, amaze and befuddle.  Simultaneously, local Berkeley artist Salma Arastu will draw illustrations as she listens to the stories, in a spontaneous act of creativity and a coming together of storytelling and visual art.  Wednesday, September 25th – mark your calendars for awesomeness!

This show is the first of many and is one step on a larger path towards the creation of a storytelling coffee shop: Kaleidoscope – coffee that tells a story.  I’ve worked in and been in love with coffee for nearly ten years, reveling in the way coffee brings people together and in the joy of a high-quality, lovingly-made cup of deliciousness.  About a year and half ago, I discovered storytelling, and I fell in love again.  At the time, Kaleidoscope Coffee was my small coffee roasting company in Phoenix, which I rebranded to bring together my two loves: coffee and stories.  Roughly seven month ago, I relocated from Phoenix to El Cerrito, here in the SF Bay Area, and thus began my journey towards opening a coffee shop that will feature and support storytelling, music and visual art.

Even though I do not yet have my own space, while I work towards that, I can promote art and storytelling in the community while also building an audience for future events – events that pay the artists involved.  This event does that.  Your support makes it possible.

Making it Happen – funding for the arts

As a backer, your money goes directly to paying the artists and covering the costs of production.  The target goal of $700 covers all expenses and pays each artist a nominal fee.  Roughly half goes to covering the costs associated with providing the rewards to you the backer.  The remainder goes directly to paying the artists.  If I do not reach the goal, I will myself contribute the necessary funds so that I can provide them at least minimal compensation not only for their time during the show but also for the numerous hours of research and preparation that goes into telling a quality story at a professional level.

The exciting idea of exceeding the target goal of $700 has far reaching implications! The Village Shops and Gallery, a local art gallery in El Ceritto, has generously donated their space in support of this event. Additional funds would allow me to provide them with a monetary Thank You in keeping with my mission of a holistic support of the arts and local business. Exceeding the target goal of $700 means that I can pay the artists a more fair amount as well as pay myself.  I am one the storytellers for this event and have invested hours of my own time to organize it.  Nonetheless, I feel self-conscious asking for funds to pay myself as well.  One of my primary goals, both personally and professionally, is to provide a space where art is truly valued.  So.  Here I am. Asking for your help.

You now have the opportunity to participate in this groundbreaking, unique event – creating community, hanging out with your friends, hearing some stimulating and entertaining stories, and seeing some great art, both spontaneously created and already on display within the gallery!  Woot!

Rewards!!  Yay!

Most of the rewards are fairly straight-forward, but here’s a few words about some of the details.

Thanks! – If I could give you a real hug, I totally would, but I want you to know: super-duper thanks! From the bottom of my heart!  And I want the world to know too, so I’m gonna tell them on my handy-dandy Kaleidoscope Facebook Page.  The excitement doesn’t end there – I’ll also mention you on my Kaleidoscope website after the show!

A Larger Community – If you live in the area, this is your ticket into the show!  If you don't, I sure wish you could be here in person, but you can still be part of the show.  I’ll send you a url so that you can watch the show live from the comfort of your own home.  Invite some friends, make some popcorn, and enjoy!  The campaign ends September 24th, and the show is September 26th at 7:30 – “doors” at 7.  This gives a couple days for you to receive the instructions and ask questions so that it can all go smoothly!

An Ongoing Connection – Relive the memories after watching the show.  A few days after the show, I’ll send you a link so that you can digitally download an audio recording and listen to the stories anytime you want!

The Pick-Me-Up and The All-Nighter – Many of you have missed my freshly roasted coffee since I relocated from Phoenix to El Cerrito.  This is for you and anyone else looking for some really good coffee in the morning.  I’m not roasting anymore, so since I moved out here, I’ve been hunting around, trying different local roasters, and let me tell you: there’s a lot of good ones!  Highwire Coffee does an excellent job with their roasts – balanced and with a lot of variety in their selections.  If you sign up for either of these rewards, I will make sure you receive at least two different kinds of coffee so that you can experience this goodness and diversity yourself!

Art in the Moment – Prints of the illustrations created during the show will be high-quality 11x14 giclée prints.  After the show, I will send out surveys with images of the illustrations so that you can choose which one you would like to receive as a print.  To receive additional prints, add $50 to your contribution.

Big Thanks! To you and everyone!  Thanks for exploring this fun idea with me.  Thanks for contributing what you are able.  If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can still be a big help by spreading the word among your friends, sharing an enthusiasm for art and artists everywhere. Thanks for being part of a community.  This is only the beginning!

funds would allow me to provide them with a monetary Thank You in keeping with
my mission of a holistic support of the arts and local business. Exceeding the target goal of $700 means that I
can pay the artists a more fair amount as well as pay myself.  I am one the storytellers for this event and
have invested hours of my own time to organize it.  Nonetheless, I feel self-conscious asking for
funds to pay myself as well.  One of my
primary goals, both personally and professionally, is to provide a space where
art is truly valued.  So.  Here I am. Asking for your help. 
You now have the opportunity to participate in this groundbreaking,
unique event – creating community, hanging out with your friends, hearing some
stimulating and entertaining stories, and seeing some great art, both
spontaneously created and already on display within the gallery!  Woot!
Rewards!!  Yay!
Most of the rewards are fairly straight-forward, but here’s
a few words about some of the details.
Thanks! – If I
could give you a real hug, I totally would, but I want you to know: super-duper
thanks! From the bottom of my heart!  And
I want the world to know too, so I’m gonna tell them on my handy-dandy
Kaleidoscope Facebook Page.  The excitement
doesn’t end there – I’ll also mention you on my Kaleidoscope website after the
show!
A Larger Community
– If you live in the area, this is your ticket into the show!  If you don't, I sure wish you could be here in person, but you can still be part of the
show.  I’ll send you a url so that you
can watch the show live from the comfort of your own home.  Invite some friends, make some popcorn, and
enjoy!  The campaign ends September 24th,
and the show is September 26th at 7:30 – “doors” at 7.  This gives a couple days for you to receive
the instructions and ask questions so that it can all go smoothly!
An Ongoing Connection
– Relive the memories after watching the show. 
A few days after the show, I’ll send you a link so that you can
digitally download an audio recording and listen to the stories anytime you
want!
The Pick-Me-Up
and The All-Nighter – Many of you
have missed my freshly roasted coffee since I relocated from Phoenix
to El Cerrito.  This is for you and anyone else looking for
some really good coffee in the morning.  I’m
not roasting anymore, so since I moved out here, I’ve been hunting around,
trying different local roasters, and let me tell you: there’s a lot of good
ones!  Highwire Coffee does an excellent
job with their roasts – balanced and with a lot of variety in their
selections.  If you sign up for either of
these rewards, I will make sure you receive at least two different kinds of
coffee so that you can experience this goodness and diversity yourself!
Art in the Moment
– Prints of the illustrations created during the show will be high-quality
11x14 giclée prints.  After the show, I
will send out surveys with images of the illustrations so that you can choose
which one you would like to receive as a print. 
To receive additional prints, add $50 to your contribution.
Big Thanks! To you and everyone!  Thanks for exploring this fun idea with
me.  Thanks for contributing what you are
able.  If you are unable to contribute
monetarily, you can still be a big help by spreading the word among your
friends, sharing an enthusiasm for art and artists everywhere. Thanks for being part of a community.  This is only the beginning!

story:
DESCRIPTION :

"Ne retournent à l’Éternité que ceux qui l'ont cherchée sur Terre" film réalisé par Marina Bourdoncle.

Marina Bourdoncle ayant partagé la vie d'Eugène Leroy durant 20 ans, a filmé, photographié, enregistré leur quotidien...
Tenant la promesse qu'elle lui avait faite, de ces images d'archives inédites, intimistes et authentiques, ce film vous retrace la vie d'Eugène Leroy, à la fois peintre, graveur, sculpteur et philosophe.
Durée : 72 minutes.

En complément du film trois bonus seront incorporés :

Une séance d'atelier.
Plan séquence, l'atelier avec Eugène et un couple posant pour lui.
(film diffusé au MUba de Tourcoing lors de l'exposition « Le corps dévoilé » en septembre 2011)
Durée : 10 minutes.

 

Rimbaud par Eugéne Leroy.

Poésie dite par Eugène Leroy, mise en musique par Wolf B et en image par Marina Bourdoncle.



Interview de Michael Werner (galeriste), Bruno Mory (galeriste) et Pierre-Yves Bohm (artiste).
Durée : 30 minutes



Ce film sera accompagné d'un livre composé d'une auto-correspondance jamais dévoilée à ce jour qu'Eugène Leroy entretenait avec la peinture, le fait d'être artiste de sa vie, ses rapports avec les autres artistes et galeristes.
Ce livre sera agrémenté de photographies inédites de Marina Bourdoncle.


-------------------------------------------------------------


APPEL A CONTRIBUTION :

Malgré les aides que nous avons reçu de la Ville de Tourcoing, La L.M.C.U, de Pictanovo (ex C.R.R.A.V), et de mécénats privés, nous ne disposons pas assez de fonds nécessaires à sa diffusion !

Si vous êtes sensibles à son œuvre et voulez nous soutenir, nous avons mis en place un crowdfouding, afin de lever les fonds nécessaires à la diffusion.
En y participant vous aurez ainsi le privilège d'avoir en exclusivité le livre, le dvd et bien d'autres choses ! et surtout, nous vous en serons reconnaissant à tout jamais !
Alors n'hésitez pas !


Pour celles et ceux qui ne connaissent pas l’œuvre de cet artiste, figure majeure de l'art contemporain international, nous vous invitons à consulter ces quelques liens que nous avons sélectionnés :

http://www.eugeneleroy.com
http://www.muba-tourcoing.fr/
http://www.michaelwerner.com/artist_9_ma...

Merci à vous !

Art Tourne Al Fabrik

 

ENGLISH VERSION :


«Return to eternity for those who searched it on the earth»

Official page regarding the film and the book concerning the artist Eugène Leroy,

«Return to eternity for those who searched it on the earth»

Film by Marina Bourdoncle


Marina Bourdoncle shared her life with Eugène Leroy during twenty years, she filmed, photographed, and registered their life together.
She made a promise to him that these archives, rare, intimite and authentic will retrace the life of Eurgéne Leroy during his painting, engraving, sculpture and philosophy.

Time lapse: 72 minutes

Encorporated in the dvd are 3 bonus films.

First bonus:
One painting workshop session.
The sequence: workshop with Eugéne and a couple posing for him. (This exerpt of film has been played at the MUba in Tourcoing during the exibition «the body unveiled» in September 2011)
Time lapse: 10 minutes

Second bonus:

Rimbaud by Eugène Leroy

Poetry spoken by Eugène Leroy, music by Wolf B and Marina Bourdoucle image's.

 

Third bonus :
Interviews with Michael Werner (International gallery owner), Bruno Mory (National gallery owner) and Pierre-Yves Bohm (artist)
Time lapse: 30 minutes


This film will be accompanied by a book composed of his memoires that have never been seen by the public eye. He speaks of his paintings, the fait of the artisitic life, and his rapport with other artists and gallery owners.
Inside this book there will be many rare photographs taken exclusively by Marina Bourdoncle.


We give great thanks to our supporters and doners. Which include: The municipality of Tourcoing, the L.M.C.U., the C.R.R.A.V., and various private donations.

Even with all of these public and private donations:

WE ARE STILL LACKING FUNDS TO COMPLETE OUR PROJECT!!!!

You can help in a variety of different ways. I

f you choose to make a donation to crowdfunding you will get an exclusive book, dvd and extra bonuses. This is a great way to make a donation and receive something back at the same time!

For those of you that are not familiar with Eugéné Leroy the internationally famous artist, we are adding a few links so that you can do your own research and learn more about this amazing artist.

http://www.eugeneleroy.com
http://www.muba-tourcoing.fr/
http://www.michaelwerner.com/artist_9_ma...

We appreciate your time and help!

Thank you,

Art Tourne Al Fabrik

story:
ABOUT ME......

Hello, 

 My Name is Laurel LeMaistre. I am a floral artist, painter, designer and photographer.  


 I am a free spirited colorful person with old fashion values and a whole lot of skill.  I am hoping  this year to become a member of the most elite trend setting group of floral designers AIFD. It stands for American Institute of Floral Design, and it is the bomb! 

To see why take a look at some of the pics I took at the Miami AIFD Symposium in 2012...  

https://www.facebook.com/laurel.lemaistrecfdnhmfd/media_set?set=a.507983205902417.119410.100000722262936&type=3    

THE GOAL - 

The reason why I want to achieve this is simple.  It truly is the highest honor one can receive as a florist.  I have pushed myself through hundreds of weddings, years of retail sales, and  now I yearn for the accomplishment acknowledgement of obtaining the credentials of AIFD for my truest PERSONAL growth.  What I plan to do with the opportunity should it arise, is share with interested people of all ages all over the place what I have learned.   I love to motivate others to press onward and up with their goals,    and classes encourages EVERYONE involved.  It can calm the anxious, sooth the weary, and enlighten the darkened.  There are special powers in flowers, and when combined with smiles, and put in an educational setting, wonderful things can happen.  

GETTING THERE _ 

This has been quite a journey for me in that the basis for my career is horticultural science, botany and art, and I am now actually living my dream by doing flower art.  I am asking for help with funding because I own and operate a small business, and in the winter months in NH, there is very little business to keep me afloat.  Cost of goods have risen, over head to keep my shop is outrageous, and frankly I just cant afford it.  The cost of the entire process will be about $5000.00.  Well worth it for the doors of opportunity that will come.  So... If you believe in art/design/floristry/education/ and of course self perseverance than I could use your help.  You can see my work at www.dandelionsflorist.com or on FB Dandelions Flower and Art Gallery.  It will only get better from here!  Thank You for your interest... Laurel

story:
Teaching Youth New Skills

With your support, this July, we,Teaching Artists Rachel Mauser and Shannon Moon will travel from Penland, North Carolina to Mineral de Pozos, Guanajuato, México to teach a free two-week book making workshop with 30 local children ages 8-14 in collaboration with La Fundación Comunitaria del Bajío.

Rachel Mauser is a multi-media artist and recent Core Fellow at Penland School of Crafts. She holds a BFA in painting and art education from Murray State University. Rachel recently completed an internship with Penland's Community Collaborations program, where she taught book making to K-12 students in rural NC. 

Shannon Moon, Penland's Teaching Artist Initiative Program Manager, is an art educator, environmentalist, and fundraiser from the Bay Area. She holds a BA in International Relations: Environmental Policy and two minors in Spanish Literature and Environmental Studies from the University of CA, San Diego. She has served as an environmental educator for CA Trout and the Environmental Foundation in San Diego.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to raise $2500 for airfare and art supplies to make this opportunity possible for 30 rural youth who have limited access to arts education. Round trip airfare from NC to  México is approximately $1600 for 2 people. The rest of the donations will be used to purchase book making materials. La Fundación Comunitaria del Bajío will generously provide room and board during this workshop, and our instruction is purely volunteer. All donors will receive email updates about the project, including photographs and quotes from the students.

The Impact

In this bookmaking workshop, we will reflect deeply and take joy in each person's unique cultural experience through drawing, painting, collage, making paper, paper marbling, bookbinding  and more!  Every step of the way, we will learn about ourselves and each other, celebrate family and friends, and discover our own personal connections with the places around us. 

La Fundación Comunitaria del Bajío works in rural Mexican communities, like Mineral de Pozos, which have been affected by US-Mexican migration. These communities have limited access to basic services and infrastructure and lack local opportunities for economic development.  Through mobilization of resources, Fundación Comunitaria del Bajío, aims at inspiring Mexicans to put down roots.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread the word about our campaign by encouraging your friends to visit Book Makers in Mexico

story:
Short Summary

Two weeks from now the the 2012 Individual World Poetry Slam launches in Fayetteville Arkansas. The top 70 poets on planet earth will be meeting on the field of battle to determine who is the next world champion of poetry. Our girl, Steph Holmbo is one of the poets qualified to compete and we need to get her to the dance. Travel to a smaller metropolitan city like Fayetteville is prohibitively expensive. Smaller airports mean higher airfare costs. She will be representing The Intangible Slam of NYC (one of only three poets competing to represent Gotham). This is a MAJOR, MAJOR accomplishment and an enormous oppurtunity for Steph. We NEED to leap into action and throw our support behind her to make sure nothing stops her from getting to Arkansas and delivering a full on HADOUKEN to the rest of the planet's poetry superstars. Hotels, airfare, food, etc. She needs you. We need you. PLEASE HELP

What We Need & What You Get

- Airfare, hotel, food are what we need to pay for

- Every dollar raised after Indiegogo's cut will go direct to the pocket of Steph Holmbo

- Every contributor will recieve personal loving poetry goodies from the champ herself.

 

The Impact

- Steph has soared through the ranks of the NYC poetry scene, and yet has twice already been waitlisted or bumped from competing in the last two major tournaments. It has been a labor of love for Steph to keep her chin up through all of this. And now we arrive at the next crucial moment. Help a young artist make her dreams come true. Someone good, kind, and talented who DESERVES this.

- Steph spent the last year donating her time freely to the NYU Slam Team (who just won their first national title). She is one of the most generous and loving young humans you are ever likely to meet. She gives of herself every day she wakes up. She needs the rest of her community, friends, and family to give of themselves, right now. 

Other Ways You Can Help

1) SHARE THIS LINK

2) SHARE THIS FREAKING LINK

3) SHARE THE HELL OUT OF THIS LINK!!!!!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Short Summary

With performing arts education being virtually eliminated from schools today it is more important than ever before to have a program like Hollywood Launch Portland. Hollywood launch Portland students not only learn the performing arts, we teach core values and how to keep your integrity as an artist.

Today in there are nearly 12,000 children attending schools that do not have art, dance, drama, or music instruction. The rate of decline for arts education is shockingly steep. Arts and music instruction has been cut by half in many schools, while larger school districts have dropped all arts instruction. Hollywood Launch Portland is filling that gap! 

Hollywood Launch Portland has a scholarship fund for students that would traditionally get their education in their local school. Our scholarship recipients are extremely talented students that cannot afford the program. We believe that money should never be a factor when it comes to performing arts education. Currently 90% of Hollywood Launch Portland students are on scholarship, there is a huge need for quality training and funds.

We have already given out over 12,000 in scholarships since September. We had to turn people away because we had no more funds available. This was very difficult for us to do knowing the talent that they have and the lack of instruction in the schools.  It is our goal to raise a minimum of 15,000 but we know even at 15,000 we will still have to turn students away. The bottom line the more money we raise, fewer students will have to be turned away.

 

Please help us spread the word about Hollywood Launch Portland.....because we all enjoy the arts!! 

Use the share button to let people know about this amazing program!

Follow us on Twitter @HLportland

You can also like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/managermom09#!/HLPortland

Or find us online at http://portland.hollywoodlaunch.net/
